However, as society evolves, respect for human rights increases, making the idea of "killing" criminals morally objectionable and difficult to accept.Firstly, it is fundamental to recognize that every individual has a right to life, and no authority should have the power to take that away. While the actions of criminals can deeply harm society, particularly their victims, they remain human beings whose lives deserve consideration. Additionally, executing someone does not erase the aftermath of their crimes and can inflict further suffering on the criminal's family, all while the pain of the victims' loved ones endures without solace.Secondly, capital punishment is not the sole solution to crime reduction; life imprisonment serves just as effectively by keeping offenders incarcerated for life. Moreover, from a punitive perspective, enduring a grim existence confined to a small cell and grappling with guilt day after day can be far more torturous than facing immediate death.Lastly, there is always the risk of innocent individuals being wrongfully convicted. Jurors are human and can exercise poor judgment. Consequently, some people are executed for crimes they did not commit, raising serious concerns about the fairness of the judicial process.In summary, while capital punishment may act as a severe deterrent, I firmly oppose it as it is both irrational and inhumane. It can easily be substituted with a life sentence instead.

question: Businesses should do anything they can to make a profit. Do you agree or disagree with this statement?
human: There is no doubt that companies, factories and businesses establish to provide products which are people's need and make a profit for their managers. However, I completely disagree with the idea that businesses should be allowed to do anything they want to make a profit. With this permission they are allowed to hit and damage everything for just making a profit.Firstly, if there is not any control on the businesses and they are permitted to do everything they want, they will threaten the beings' life such as human, animals and plants. As every day we read and hear in televisions and newspapers that some factories hit the environment by their toxic substances.Moreover, if we let them do anything they can to just make a profit, they will produce products with low qualities and high prices, therefore they might hit consumer's life. For instance, a few months ago it was broadcast from TV that a company which produced baby milk, sold milk which did not have quality and it caused a few babies die.In conclusion, all companies, factories and businesses should be monitored by governments and executive, and they do not have to let do anything they want just due to making profit. They can hit both the environment and human's life easily.
llm: There is no doubt that companies, factories, and businesses are established to meet people's needs and generate profits for their owners. However, I firmly oppose the notion that businesses should have the freedom to do anything necessary to achieve those profits. Such freedom could enable them to harm the environment and society in their pursuit of profit.Firstly, without any oversight, businesses allowed to operate unchecked could pose a serious threat to all forms of life, including humans, animals, and plants. Daily, we hear reports in the news about factories polluting the environment with toxic waste.Additionally, if businesses are given free rein to maximize profits, they may resort to producing low-quality products at high prices, negatively impacting consumers. A recent example highlights this issue: a few months ago, news outlets reported that a company selling baby formula did so without ensuring its quality, resulting in tragic outcomes for several infants.In conclusion, it is essential for governments and regulatory bodies to monitor all companies, factories, and businesses closely. They should not be permitted to act solely in the name of profit, as this can lead to devastating consequences for both the environment and human life.

question: It is recently announced that a new high school may be built in your neighborhood. Do you support or oppose this plan?
human: Although some of my neighbors will oppose this idea, personally I approve it. The new high school will bring a lot of advantages to my community. The high school of my district is pretty old and lacks in necessities for students, so they can't get enough education. I really believe that new high school is a great addition to the educational system of my community.	Firstly, I think that the new high school will bring a lots of opportunities for student concerned in education. Their old high school is pretty old and need in new educational materials, repairing of the place for sport activities. Also the laboratory of physics and chemistry was in bad condition, so the students can't study well during the classes. They will study with new breath and great enthusiasm in new school. Secondly, the new high school will be a place for new connections between the student of different communities and districts of the city. After classes students and not only the students will get together in building of high school, participate in different competitions. For instance during the football match the students of different high schools will come and after the competition they will keep in touch. This will increase the social connections of the students. The only disadvantage is the noisiness of the competitions. The people living in the neighborhood will be a bit perturbed, but I think this isn't a important reason for ceasing the competitions. To sum up, this new construction has a lot of advantages like new connections between students from different communities, also the new educational equipment will increase the students' enthusiasm toward studying. The only disadvantage is the nosiness of competitions which students will participate, but I think that it isn't a big deal. So the new high school will be a great addition for my environment.
llm: While some of my neighbors may disagree, I wholeheartedly support the idea of building a new high school in our community. This new facility would offer numerous benefits, especially considering that our current high school is quite outdated and lacks essential resources for students, hindering their educational experience. I truly believe that a new high school would greatly enhance the educational landscape of our area.Firstly, the new high school will provide invaluable opportunities for students focused on their education. The current school is in dire need of updated educational materials, repairs to sports facilities, and improvements to the physics and chemistry laboratories, which are currently in poor condition. With a new environment, students will approach their studies with renewed vigor and enthusiasm.Secondly, the new high school will serve as a hub for building connections among students from various communities and districts within the city. After classes, students—along with members of the community—will gather in the high school for various events and competitions. For example, during sports matches, students from different high schools will come together, fostering relationships that can continue beyond the competitions. While the noise generated by these events may disturb some nearby residents, I believe this is a minor issue compared to the benefits of increased social interaction.In conclusion, the construction of a new high school offers many advantages, including fostering connections between students across various communities and equipping them with the tools they need to engage more enthusiastically in their studies. The only potential drawback is the noise from competitions, which I consider a minor concern. Overall, I am confident that a new high school would be a fantastic addition to our community.

question: Parents or other adult relatives should make important decisions for their older (15 - 18 year old) teenaged children. Do you agree or disagree with this statement?
human: It might seem that teenaged children particularly in age of 15 - 18 are fully grown, so they do not need any help for making important decisions. However, in my opinion, teenagers need more attention and help in comparison with the higher ages. I will discuss my view in two main areas.In the first place, there is no doubt that parents and other adult relatives are more experienced towards children, therefore they are the best advisor for their children. They have experienced a large numbers of stuffs during their life, so if children listen to their advices they can prevent happening worst things. Also, they can save value things in their life such as time and money, and enjoy they life with the best way.Moreover, I have always believed that parents and adults relatives are the best friends and consular for the teenagers, because unfortunately nowadays there are some individuals who cheat the others for gaining more power and money. They cheat young ages because they believe they are immature and they can trap them easily.To sum up, it makes no difference, people from young ages to old ages are free to make a decision, nonetheless sometimes to prevent some problems coming up for young individuals , it is a good idea to ask parents and adult relatives to give a piece of advice.
llm: It may appear that teenagers, especially those aged 15 to 18, are fully matured and capable of making important decisions independently. However, I believe that they actually require more support and guidance than older individuals. I will outline my perspective in two main areas.Firstly, it is undeniable that parents and other adult relatives possess more life experience, making them the best advisors for their children. Having navigated a variety of situations, their insights can help prevent teenagers from making detrimental choices. By heeding their advice, young people can avoid costly mistakes, saving both time and money, and ultimately enjoy life more fully.Additionally, I firmly believe that parents and adult relatives serve as the best friends and counselors for teenagers. Regrettably, there are individuals in society who exploit and deceive others for personal gain. They often target younger individuals, assuming that their immaturity makes them easier to manipulate.In conclusion, while everyone, regardless of age, has the right to make their own decisions, it is wise for young individuals to seek advice from parents and adult relatives in order to sidestep potential challenges.

question: Childhood is the happiest time of a person's life. Do you agree or disagree with this statement?
human: You hardly ever can find a person who says that he or she had unpleasant childhood. When individuals reminisce their memories they absolutely infer to some of their childhood events. As much as their events might were bitter, in their adulthood they are sweet. In my opinion, childhood is definitely the happiest time of people life in two main areas.In the first place, children are free whatever they want to do, they are not restricted and their limitation are really rare. Because they are in the age of growth and they are allowed whatever they want to do to experience new stuffs. Therefore there is no argument and punishment for them.In addition, in this age they are not expected to be responsible. Also, they do not have to educate and they do not have to work, so they have a lot of time in their hand to enjoy this stage of their life. As a matter of fact, I made a large number of friends in this age, and I almost traveled to all cities of my county when I was in kindergarten. Also I got familiar with different kind of animals and plants in this age.All in all, I would maintain that the best phase of people life is their childhood. They not only free to do whatever they want without any confine or punishment, but also they are free and have a lot of time in their hands to try and experience new things and enjoy them.
llm: It's rare to find someone who claims to have had an unhappy childhood. When people reflect on their past, they often recall various events from their formative years. Even the more challenging experiences typically take on a sweeter tone in adulthood. In my view, childhood truly represents the happiest period of a person's life for two main reasons.First and foremost, children enjoy a remarkable level of freedom. They can pursue their interests without many restrictions and rarely face limitations. As they grow, they are encouraged to explore, which means they often encounter new experiences without the threat of punishment or argument.Additionally, children are not burdened with responsibilities. They aren’t expected to work or study in the same way adults do, allowing them plenty of time to relish this stage of life. Personally, I made a host of friends during my childhood and traveled extensively throughout my country while I was still in kindergarten. I also learned about various animals and plants during that time.In conclusion, I firmly believe that childhood is the most wonderful phase of life. Children are free to explore and enjoy life without constraints or punishments, and they have ample time to seek out new experiences that bring them joy.

question: People attend college and university for many reasons. Why do you think people attend college and university? Use specific reasons and examples to support your idea.
human: From many centuries ago, universities have been playing an important role in ones' life. Different people attend university for different point of views. In my perspective, the three most reasons are increased knowledge, career preparation and new experiences.First of all, for most people, university is an ideal place for them to develop their understanding. Truthfully, in this wonderful academic environment, everyone is provided with varieties and gigantic number of information by a lot of professors and well-trained teachers. Thus, people are able to strengthen their knowledge. Moreover, through the instructions of teachers, the sufficient infrastructure such as laboratory, library, students is capable of doing research on every academic aspect. Therefore, they can gain a deep sight into what are they studying.Secondly, studying in university means that you have totally turned into a different page of your life, which included many new experiences. The number of individual who enroll in university are enormous, more than any school one person have studied. Thus, students are given such fantastic chance to create new and wide relationships with a lot of people from any corner of one nation, even from the whole world. For instance, my brother are studying in an international university with a mixed community include Vietnam, Brazil, Argentina, etc. And he told me that he is very excited for experiencing such new environment, which is one of his main purposes when attending university. Last but not least, preparing for career is an essential function of university. Students not only do homework, assignment and attend class but also need to participate in volunteer work, internship and part time job. Thus, they can have some experiences in the outside world and discover what their life goals are. After all, they know where and what to put high emphasis on in order to achieve their objectives.In summation, people may attend university for various reasons. Some want to enjoy new experiences, some are going to prepare for their future career, while others are eager to develop their understanding. Even though the purposes could be various, everybody who is studying in university should concentrate on the objectives and try their best.
llm: For centuries, universities have played a pivotal role in shaping individuals' lives. People enroll in university for a variety of reasons, but I believe the three most significant are the pursuit of knowledge, preparation for a career, and the chance to have new experiences.To begin with, many view university as an ideal environment for enhancing their understanding. In this enriching academic setting, students are exposed to a vast array of information provided by knowledgeable professors and experienced educators. Consequently, individuals can deepen their knowledge base and critical thinking skills. Additionally, with access to resources like laboratories and libraries, students can engage in research across various academic fields, allowing them to gain profound insights into their subjects of study.Furthermore, attending university signifies a significant transition in one’s life, filled with new experiences. The sheer number of individuals enrolled in university surpasses that of any previous educational institution. This provides students with an incredible opportunity to forge diverse and lasting relationships with peers from different parts of the country and even the globe. For example, my brother is studying at an international university with a multicultural community that includes students from Vietnam, Brazil, Argentina, and more. He has expressed excitement about this new environment, highlighting it as one of his main reasons for pursuing higher education.Lastly, preparing for a career is a fundamental aspect of the university experience. In addition to completing coursework and attending classes, students are encouraged to engage in volunteer work, internships, and part-time jobs. These activities allow them to gain real-world experience and clarify their career aspirations. Ultimately, they learn where to focus their efforts to attain their professional goals.In conclusion, individuals may attend university for diverse reasons, whether it’s to embrace new experiences, prepare for a future career, or expand their knowledge. Regardless of their motivations, all students should prioritize their objectives and strive to make the most of their university experience.

question: Do you agree or disagree? It's better to have one or two close friends than to have a large number of casual acquaintances.
human: There is no need for me to put any emphasis on the advantage of having a large number of casual acquaintance. However, I still agree that it's better to have one or two close friends than to have a large number of casual acquaintances.We can not deny that being a friend with someone is different from only being acquaintant. First, it's not easy to make friend with anyone. I believe friends are people who have great compatibility with each other. After two years in college I have found sometimes there is more differences between people than similarities, for we are growing in the different families and was educated in various ways. Sometimes acquaintances are just acquaintances. We spend time together but we could never be friend. So, it's much easier to have some casual acquaintances than have some close friends.Second, close friends can easily understand each others feelings. Because of the similarity I talked before, acquaintances probably not able to understand you better than your friends. Moreover, they wouldn't even spare time to consider your feelings. Everyone play the role of acquaintance and friend at the same time. Being friendly is a good way to treat a acquaintance but way not enough for a friend. When my friend is sick, I would not only ask if he is okay like an acquaintance but do my best to make him get well as soon as possible. If my friend is going to the wrong direction in his life trail, I will try my best to pull him back, but not stand and stare like it's not of my business. And I believe my friend will do the same to me. In conclusion, a friend is a person you care about. To me, friends are the most important people in my life second to my family. I am the kind of person who has only one or two close friends, and I am fully content that I have such nice friends. If someone exchange my friends with thousands of acquaintances, I will definitely say NO.
llm: There’s no need to highlight the benefits of having numerous casual acquaintances, but I do believe that having one or two close friends is preferable to a large circle of acquaintances. The distinction between a friend and an acquaintance is significant. Making real friends can be challenging; true friendship often arises from deep compatibility between individuals. After spending two years in college, I’ve realized that, at times, differences among people can outweigh their similarities, shaped by varied upbringings and experiences. Consequently, some acquaintances remain just that. We may spend time together, but that doesn't necessarily translate into friendship. Thus, it’s generally easier to have a few casual acquaintances than to cultivate close friendships.Furthermore, true friends possess an innate ability to understand each other’s feelings. The understanding that comes from shared experiences and similarities allows friends to empathize more deeply than acquaintances can. Often, acquaintances may be polite but not genuinely concerned about your feelings. While being friendly is appropriate for casual interactions, it’s not sufficient for deep friendships. For example, when my friend is unwell, I won’t simply ask if they’re okay like an acquaintance might; I will do everything I can to help them recover. If my friend makes a poor life choice, I won't just watch passively; I'll intervene because their well-being matters to me, and I trust they would do the same for me. In summary, a true friend is someone you genuinely care about. For me, friends are among the most important people in my life, second only to my family. I tend to have only one or two close friends, and I am completely satisfied with that. If given the choice between my friends and a multitude of acquaintances, I would certainly choose my friends.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Life today is easier and more comfortable than it was when your grandparents were children. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: The life today is totally different from half centuries before. Advances in technology do help humans to solve abundant of problems; however it also deprives of some things that we had. In my opinion, life in the old days brings more happiness to people than today for several reasons.The first reason is life is simple in the past. Nowadays, all humans compete together. Since world population getting higher, competition is getting fierce. If you are not able to handle your jobs, then someone will replace you right away. People need to put much more effort to keep their living condition. Therefore, lives in the old days is easier than today.Second, the environment today is serious damaged. Looking out the windows, what I see isn't sky, trees or mountains, but is coldly high buildings. Everyday, I walk on hard roads, breath in polluted air, and live in a limited space. What's worse, it has been proved that living in this kind of condition will result in some mental diseases. Thus, the environment our grandparents live is more comfortable than today.The third reason is that the pace of life. Today, we are able to read the news all over the world, to chat with people through the Internet, or to travel around the world by planes; however, it also means that any thing happens in the world will affect our life. If we cannot react properly and immediately, then we will be in a vulnerable situation. We have no choice but have to live in a fast pace.In conclusion, while there some people live in a pretty good condition, it is only a minority. People are put too much focus on making wealth and progress in technology; nevertheless, behind the glamorous facade of it, what we loss will never be returned.
llm: Life today is drastically different from what it was just fifty years ago. While technological advancements have certainly helped humanity tackle numerous challenges, they have also stripped away certain aspects of our lives that we once valued. I believe that life in the past offered more happiness than it does today for several reasons.Firstly, life was simpler in earlier times. Today, we are all in a constant competition with one another. As the global population continues to grow, the competition becomes increasingly intense. If someone struggles to perform their job, there is always another person ready to take their place. This pressure forces individuals to exert much more effort just to maintain their living standards. In contrast, life back then was less complicated.Secondly, the current state of our environment is severely damaged. When I look out the window, I don’t see the sky, trees, or mountains; instead, I’m faced with cold, towering buildings. I walk on hard pavement, breathe in polluted air, and reside in constricted spaces. What’s more, research has shown that living under such conditions can lead to various mental health issues. In comparison, the environment in which our grandparents lived was much more comfortable and serene.Lastly, the pace of life has accelerated dramatically. Today, we have access to news from around the world, the ability to connect with others via the Internet, and the means to travel globally by airplane. However, this also means that events happening elsewhere can directly impact our lives. If we fail to respond swiftly and appropriately, we find ourselves in vulnerable situations. We are forced to navigate a fast-paced existence.In conclusion, while some individuals may enjoy relatively good living conditions, they represent a minority. Society has become overly focused on wealth accumulation and technological progress. Yet, behind this glitzy exterior, we have lost much that can never be reclaimed.

question: High school should allow students to study the courses that students want to study. Agree or disagree?
human: High school is the time when you decide your future career and particular field you want to concentrate and interested in. In my opinion high school should permit students to choose courses they want for several reasons which are freedom of choice, to have progress in students grades and knowledge as well as to help students explore their aptitude.First of all, as I mentioned above students should have a right to choose what they want to study. Not allowing students their desired subjects to be chosen is a restriction of human rights. As children of independent country we should know our rights and opportunities we have in order to achieve our goals and dreams.Next, students should choose their classes to have progress in their studies and grades. Also, we can avoid conflicts among students and teachers which can be enjoyable and productive for both instructor and students. For example, when I was taking art class everyone shared the same interests and it was easy to understand each other. Giving chance students to choose their interested fields of study is merit.Lastly, the most important reason I support this idea is he or she can explore in an area she/he has an aptitude. When schools can give such kind of opportunity the students are likely do their best and succeed in their future lives which is one of the point most people get education. Furthermore, this type of opportunities can raise future geniuses.In conclusion, as a young women I want my children to get knowledge they have desire to study in order to have distinguished achievement so it has advantage not only for him or her but for society as well. Having three reasons helps us to bring up students who are well-educated, with a bright and independent mind.
llm: High school is a crucial period when students begin to determine their future careers and areas of focus. I believe that high schools should allow students to choose their own courses for several compelling reasons: the freedom of choice, improved academic performance, and the opportunity for students to discover their potential.First and foremost, students should have the right to select the subjects they wish to study. Denying them this choice is a violation of their rights. As young individuals in an independent country, it's important for students to understand the rights and opportunities available to them in pursuing their goals and dreams.Additionally, allowing students to choose their classes can lead to greater academic progress and better grades. It can also minimize conflicts between students and teachers, fostering a more enjoyable and productive learning environment for everyone involved. For instance, when I took an art class, it was easy to connect with my peers because we all shared a common interest. Providing students with the chance to study subjects they are passionate about is undoubtedly beneficial.Finally, the most important reason I advocate for this approach is that it allows students to explore areas where they may have a natural aptitude. When schools offer such opportunities, students are more likely to excel and achieve success in their future endeavors, which is a primary goal of education. Moreover, this kind of environment can cultivate future leaders and innovators.In conclusion, as a young woman, I aspire for my children to pursue knowledge in areas that spark their interest, leading to remarkable achievements that benefit both individuals and society. By supporting student choice in education, we can nurture well-rounded individuals with bright and independent minds.

question: Some people are always in a hurry to go places and get things done. Other people prefer to take their time and live life at a slower pace. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.Ê
human: There is a hotly debated issue over whether people have to live at a higher or lower pace, and this topic can also be approached from several different angles due to its complexity. Some people tend to be hurry to complete their tasks, while others seem to prefer the opposite position. After deeply pondering over this issue, I also develop my own perspective. I favor the former; that is, I prefer to live in a higher pace condition. The first and foremost reason lies in the inevitable fact that we need to save time for accomplishing some important tasks, and a fitting example of which can be found in my experience of missing exam. I just failed to participate in the university entrance exam because I thought I had enough time for eating breakfast and transporting to the testing place; while I was stocked in a traffic jam and then missed the first test. Therefore, we can start to agree that we have to be eager in our lives. Apart from the one I have mentioned above, another equally important aspect is keeping in high pace condition can prevent me from getting lazy. If I can avoid being a sluggish person, I can have a higher probability of fulfilling my dream successfully. For instance, I had spent more time on practicing playing piano so that I won a piano competition, defeating those spending less time on practicing. Hence, from this case we are capable of stating that keeping our pace higher is important. Admittedly, on the other hand, there might be some people proclaiming that with a slower pace can enjoy their lives more because it is not necessary for them to notice the time control or acquire the fame of succeed. However, from my limited understanding, I just doubt the credibility of that saying. I do not think that those people with slower pace losing the piano competition can be really happy. In contrast, it is really joyful for me that I can immerse in the joy of the victory and accomplishment. Based on the reasons demonstrated above, I believe that living in a higher pace is better because the advantages of this are qualitatively greater than that of the opposite. In other words, I prefer to live in high pace. It is not to say, of course that other points of view are totally without merit. Still, I am firmly convinced that the reasons I proposed in favor of my own sentiment are much more tenable and plausible.
llm: The debate over whether individuals should live at a faster or slower pace is a contentious one, and its complexity allows for various perspectives. Some people are inclined to rush through their tasks, while others seem to favor a more leisurely approach. After careful consideration of this issue, I have formed my own viewpoint: I advocate for a faster pace of living.One primary reason for my preference is the necessity of managing time effectively to complete important tasks. A personal experience illustrates this point: I missed the university entrance exam because I underestimated the time needed for breakfast and travel. I became stuck in traffic and consequently missed the first test. This situation underscores the importance of being proactive in our lives.Additionally, maintaining a faster pace helps me avoid laziness. By staying active, I increase my chances of achieving my dreams. For example, I dedicated extended hours to practicing the piano, which led me to win a competition against others who practiced less. This experience highlights the importance of maintaining higher momentum.Of course, some individuals argue that a slower pace allows for greater enjoyment of life, as it frees them from the pressures of time and competition. However, I find this perspective questionable. I believe that those who experience defeat, like losing a piano competition due to a slower pace, may not find true happiness. In contrast, I derive immense joy from the success and fulfillment that comes from hard work and victory.Considering the reasons outlined, I firmly believe that living at a faster pace is advantageous, as its benefits outweigh those of a slower approach. While I acknowledge that others' perspectives may hold some validity, I am convinced that the rationale I have presented in support of a faster lifestyle is far more substantial and compelling.

question: Tourism is a multibillion-dollar industry that supports economic development. However, some people think that it causes too much damage to the local environment and culture. What do you think?
human: Tourist trade is becoming a powerful engine for the economy. Nevertheless, some individuals believe that this position ignores the ecological and environmental destruction, as a result of tourist activities, and its adverse effects on local communities and ecosystems. While both positions seem reasonable, my view is that, through proper management and regulation, a booming tourist industry is an excellent source of economic growth and wealth for rural and urban areas.The most obvious merit is that tourism can vastly boost economic development in a particular state or region. This takes place, not only through direct expenditure from tourists, but also because it provides direct and indirect jobs to the community, including retail, agriculture, and in the service industry. The increasing tax and the expansion of local markets for accommodation, luxury goods amongst others are also a result of a solid, well-regulated tourism programs. Furthermore, tourism provides a considerable number of direct and indirect jobs to the community, including retail, hotels, transport, agriculture, and in the service industry. This increase of job opportunities allows more people to make significant contribution to society through the purchasing of commodities by their growing incomes. As a result, this gives energy to the economic cycle, generating local economic prosperity in return.Some people may oppose these, citing the environmental and cultural destruction caused by tourism. In fact, compared to the tourism industry, other alternatives, like resource extraction and manufacture, are far worse destroyers. For instance, paper mills pour hundreds and thousands of tons of contamination into rivers, causing severe water pollution. On the other hand, the dramatic majority of tourist, particularly those who tend to spending a wealth of time and money locating and visiting rustic villages, are well educated. It is illogical to believe that these rational folks will not conduct themselves decently if required to do so.After careful consideration of both sides of the argument, the tourism sector is desirable for its important socioeconomic advantages. In conclusion, it is evident that under suitable administration, the benefits of tourism outweigh its drawbacks.
llm: The tourism industry is increasingly recognized as a significant driver of economic growth. However, some people argue that this perspective overlooks the ecological and environmental damage caused by tourism-related activities, as well as their negative impacts on local communities and ecosystems. While both viewpoints have merit, I believe that with effective management and regulation, a thriving tourism sector can serve as a valuable source of economic development and prosperity for both urban and rural areas.One of the primary advantages of tourism is its potential to significantly enhance economic development in a specific region. This occurs not only through tourists’ direct spending but also through the creation of both direct and indirect employment opportunities in various sectors, such as retail, agriculture, and services. A well-structured tourism program leads to increased tax revenue and the growth of local markets for accommodation and luxury goods, among others. Moreover, tourism creates numerous job opportunities across different areas, from hotels and transportation to agriculture and services. As employment grows, individuals are able to contribute more significantly to society through increased consumption, driving the local economic cycle and fostering prosperity.Critics may highlight the environmental and cultural degradation associated with tourism. However, when compared to other industries like resource extraction and manufacturing, tourism often has a lesser impact on the environment. For example, industries such as paper manufacturing can release substantial amounts of pollutants into waterways, resulting in severe water contamination. Additionally, many tourists—especially those who invest time and resources to visit remote villages—are typically well-educated individuals. It is unreasonable to assume that these rational guests will behave irresponsibly when it comes to respecting the destinations they visit.After weighing both sides of the debate, it is clear that the tourism industry offers significant socioeconomic benefits. In conclusion, with appropriate oversight, the positive impacts of tourism far outweigh its potential drawbacks.

question: The government should allocate more funds to public services instead of wasting money on arts such as music, painting and so on. Do you agree or disagree with this statement? Give your own opinion
human: The issue of governmental financing provision to aesthetic features in the society has sparked a heated debate. While some argue that the budget allocation to the arts is waste of national resources and the money should instead be spent on public services, I contend that this investment in field of the arts would be in the best interest of a society.First of all, there is no doubt that governments are liable for providing societies with appropriate public services and adequate facilities in an efficient way. Admittedly, no one should suffer from any sort of deficiency in field of health, education, transportation and communication. However, these could only help individuals with their physical requirements. There is also a burden on the government to highly concern about the people mental health initiatives which would be unconsciously or sensibly provided by the arts.On top of this, the arts play a pivotal role in all-round development of a society. No developed country could be named that music, painting, literature and other fields of arts are out of its government consideration. Enriching people's life and enlightening their thoughts, the arts basically affect the enhancement of societies in many positive ways.Furthermore, investing in art could bring employment opportunities and could end in return of capital occasionally. The investment could be paid back through the values of the created works of art which as a matter of fact should be considered as national possessions. To sum up, not only could investing in art be considered as wasting money at any kind, but also it would enriches the culture of the society and governments and individuals would benefit from it in multiple ways.
llm: The allocation of government funding for aesthetic initiatives has ignited considerable debate. While some assert that budget resources devoted to the arts are a misuse of national funds, suggesting these resources would be better directed towards public services, I argue that investment in the arts serves the best interests of society.Firstly, it is undeniable that governments have a responsibility to provide effective public services and facilities. Every individual should have access to adequate care in health, education, transportation, and communication. However, these services primarily address physical needs. It is equally important for governments to consider initiatives that support mental health, which can be greatly nurtured through the arts, whether consciously or unconsciously.Moreover, the arts are instrumental in the holistic development of a society. No developed nation neglects music, painting, literature, or other artistic expressions in its governmental policies. The arts enrich lives and inspire thought, yielding numerous positive outcomes that contribute to societal progress.Additionally, investing in the arts can generate employment opportunities and sometimes lead to a return on investment. The financial returns can come from the intrinsic value of the artwork created, which should be regarded as national treasures.In conclusion, funding the arts should not be viewed as a fiscal irresponsibility; rather, it enhances cultural richness and offers diverse benefits to both governments and individuals.

question: The idea of having a single career is becoming an old fashioned one. The new fashion will be to have several careers or ways of earning money and further education will be something that continues throughout life.
human: The career itself became the motto of living since the beginning of industrialization in the late 19th century. People usually tend to have a single career as a means of living. However, a modern trend reveals that new generations are more interested to perform several jobs and also would like to gain multiple higher educational certificates in order to earn more and to gain financial security.A full time job with a steady income was enough for a potential employee to support himself and his family. But with the recent recession, almost all the countries all over the world are seeing significant economic downfall. This overwhelming crisis is prompting delayering and reduction of workers. As a result, people are focusing on doing several jobs or gaining further qualification to secure their economic condition.Moreover, the arrival of technology has also been playing a major role promoting further unemployment. The official term of it is named "Technological Unemployment". North American economists have published reports after scrutinizing the recent American economic situation that, technology is eliminating more jobs than creating one. For example, robots, automation and softwares are taking over manual human workers professions such as clerks, interpreters, security services, retails and specially in manufacturing companies. Thus many people's jobs are now at high stake. The best way to ensure a flexible earning is getting more jobs. Last but not least, corporational policy to to pay less to inferiors is another reason that drives labours to work on different sectors.For the reasons mentioned above, I believe that people are now more conscious to gain more educational qualification and also are more interested to work on various fields simultaneously to earn more and support themselves.
llm: Since the advent of industrialization in the late 19th century, a career has become synonymous with a way of life. Traditionally, individuals often pursued a single career to earn a living. However, a contemporary trend indicates that younger generations are increasingly inclined to take on multiple jobs and seek various higher education credentials to enhance their earnings and achieve financial stability.In the past, a full-time job with a reliable income was generally sufficient for individuals to support themselves and their families. Yet, with the recent global recession, many countries are experiencing significant economic challenges. This crisis has led to workforce reductions and layoffs, prompting individuals to seek multiple job opportunities or further qualifications to bolster their financial security.Additionally, the rise of technology has played a significant role in contributing to unemployment, a phenomenon referred to as "Technological Unemployment." Reports from North American economists analyzing the current economic landscape indicate that technology is destroying more jobs than it creates. For instance, robots, automation, and software are increasingly taking over roles traditionally filled by human workers, including clerical positions, interpretation, security services, retail, and particularly within manufacturing. Consequently, many jobs are now at significant risk. The most effective strategy for generating flexible income is to pursue multiple job opportunities. Furthermore, corporate policies that favor lower wages for entry-level employees further motivate workers to seek positions across different sectors.In light of these factors, I believe that individuals are now more aware of the importance of acquiring additional educational qualifications and are increasingly interested in diversifying their careers by working in various fields simultaneously to improve their financial situation.

question: Some people think that computers are more of a hindrance than a help in today's society. Others believe that they are such indispensable tools that they would not be able to live or work without them. Discuss both opinions and give your opinion
human: Computer is a modern device that is useful for human life. People use computer particularly for work, study, even for communication. However, many people argue that computer more give obstacle than a help in social life. Other sides believe that it becomes prominent thing, and they cannot do anything without that device. However, I strongly believe that computer can influence society, and people's lives have already been controlled by device. I would argue that this modern device has been a major hindrance to some people. A study conducted by Mediabank shows that majority of Australian adults do not socialize with their families and friends as much as they used to, due to the fact that they spend almost nine hours a day dealing with computers as to produce efficient time in working. As it can be seen from the example, the idea that computers could be a help has been neglected.However, using computer can make people easier to complete their work. Businessmen, for example, use computer device to presentation or communication with their colleagues. Communication by feature-computer such as email and internet help busy businessmen to make deal with relation even in different country. This is due to using computer more efficient and, many workers cannot do more in work without computer.In conclusion, in era technology like this age, computer becomes important thing in human life. Every day, people cannot pass the day without stay in front of computer or using it. This situation becomes lifestyle habits, and nowadays human activities are influenced by computer use.
llm: The computer is a contemporary tool that plays a vital role in modern life. It is utilized by individuals for various purposes, including work, education, and communication. Nonetheless, some argue that computers create more obstacles than they solve in social interactions. Others contend that computers have become essential to daily life, to the point where many feel they cannot function without them. I firmly believe that computers significantly influence society, and our lives have become increasingly reliant on these devices.I would argue that for some individuals, this modern technology can be quite detrimental. A study by Mediabank revealed that most Australian adults spend nearly nine hours a day on computers, which has led to decreased socialization with family and friends compared to the past. This statistic highlights how the potential benefits of computers are often overlooked.On the other hand, computers undeniably simplify work tasks for many people. For instance, business professionals utilize computers for presentations and to communicate with colleagues. Features such as email and the internet enable busy executives to negotiate deals and maintain relationships even when they are in different countries. This demonstrates that reliance on computers can enhance efficiency, making it challenging for many workers to perform their jobs effectively without them.In conclusion, in this technological era, computers have become an integral part of human life. Daily, people find it difficult to go through a day without using a computer. This reliance has transformed into a lifestyle habit, greatly influencing contemporary human activities.

question: Some employers are giving increased importance to social skills. However, others still believe qualifications are the most important. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.Ê
human: With the increased educational level of workforce, there are growing number of employers seeking criteria other than qualifications such as social skills in their employee selection process. However, some employers still believe that qualifications should be the most paramount criterion. The essay intends to explore both sides of arguments and also present my own opinion. Firstly, some people suggest that qualification should be the foremost measurement to determine the value of a employer. It is of importance that workers should be well educated and trained to perform duties of their job. Specifically, people who work in professional fields such as medicals are required to have a university degree and years of experience. Social skills seem to be less important as they cannot contribute to the success of a surgery. On the other hand, it is no doubt that the importance of social skills have been recognized by increasing number of employers. It is because people nowadays are required to work as a team in their jobs frequently. Interpersonal skill plays an essential role in helping colleagues to cooperate with each other, especially when conflicts arise. Better social skills allow them to resolve disagreements in a much more harmony way. Besides, organization have been transformed to customers oriented. Excellent social skills can help employees maintain strong relationship with their clients which thus lead to a better customer satisfaction.To my view, I incline to believe qualification is still the fundamental determinant of an employee's competency of their jobs. Yet, the importance of social skills should not be neglected as those skills can help one to perform their job effectiveness and efficiency by facilitating interaction and communication with others.
llm: As the educational level of the workforce continues to rise, an increasing number of employers are beginning to prioritize criteria beyond qualifications, such as social skills, in their hiring processes. Nevertheless, some employers still contend that qualifications should remain the primary consideration. This essay will examine both perspectives while also presenting my own viewpoint.On one hand, many argue that qualifications should be the leading measure of an employee's value. It is crucial for workers, especially in professional sectors like healthcare, to possess a solid educational background and relevant experience. For instance, individuals in the medical field are mandated to hold university degrees and accumulate years of hands-on practice. In such cases, social skills may seem less critical, particularly as they do not directly influence the success of medical procedures.Conversely, an increasing number of employers are recognizing the significance of social skills. In contemporary workplaces, team collaboration is often essential, making interpersonal abilities vital for facilitating cooperation among colleagues, especially during conflicts. Strong social skills enable individuals to navigate disagreements more harmoniously. Furthermore, organizations have shifted towards a customer-centric approach. Excellent social skills can empower employees to foster robust relationships with clients, ultimately enhancing customer satisfaction.From my perspective, I firmly believe that qualifications remain the foundational criterion for assessing an employee's competency in their role. However, it is essential not to overlook the value of social skills, as they can significantly enhance job performance by promoting effective interaction and communication with others.

question: Some people believe that charities should give aid to those who need the aid most, wherever they live. Some people believe that charity organisations would better concentrate on people in their own countries instead. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
human: The world has become more prosperous than ever yet a great number of people are still living in poverty or suffering by wars or disasters. Charity organisations have been playing an important role to provide support to those people. However, it is controversial whether the help should go to the people who need it most or the citizens of the country where the charity organisations are located. My view is that international aid should be prioritised.International aid is critical because people from other countries may be facing much more serious problems. Many people, for example in some African countries, are living below the basic standards. They lack food, water or clothes which keep them warm, not to mention the education needs. What is worse, people who live in countries that are confronted with wars or natural disasters are facing even more severe issues such as security, homelessness or the pain of losing best friends or family members. It is clear that those people are in desperate need of international support.Despite the importance of helping those beyond our national borders, it is reasonable to lend a hand to our fellow citizens. After all, charity organisations are mainly funded by the home country thus there is a high demand that the money should be spent in the place where it is collected. Another reason is that, even within the most developed countries, there are still poor people who lack their basic needs. By solving the problems in the home country, it is beneficial for social stability and steady economic growth.In conclusion, people from unfortunate countries need more international assistance while helping citizens in the home country is also necessary.
llm: The world has never been more prosperous, yet many individuals still endure poverty, conflict, or disasters. Charity organizations have played a crucial role in offering support to those in need. However, there is ongoing debate about whether assistance should be directed primarily to those who need it most globally or to the citizens of the country where the charities are based. I believe that international aid should take precedence.International aid is essential because individuals in other countries may be facing far more severe challenges. For instance, many people in certain African nations live well below basic standards of living. They struggle with inadequate access to food, clean water, and clothing, not to mention the lack of educational opportunities. In even more dire situations, individuals in countries afflicted by war or natural disasters face critical issues such as insecurity, homelessness, and the trauma of losing loved ones. It is evident that these individuals are in urgent need of international assistance.While addressing the needs of people beyond our borders is vital, it is also justifiable to support our fellow citizens. Charity organizations are predominantly funded by local donations, creating a strong expectation that funds should be utilized within the community from which they originate. Additionally, even in the most developed nations, there are still individuals who lack access to basic necessities. Addressing these issues within our own country can contribute to social stability and promote steady economic growth.In conclusion, those in struggling nations require significant international aid, but it is also important to assist citizens within the home country.

question: Students at schools and universities learn far more from lessons with teachers than from others sources (such as the internet, television).To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: The way in which children today study is radically different from any previous generations, and the increased availability and relatively low price of modern technology has been instrumental in this change. Despite the argument of some people that learners can obtain more useful knowledge from teachers than from other sources, I firmly believe that both alternative sources and traditional teaching methods from educators are equally important in children's acquisition of knowledge.It is undeniable that the widespread of alternative sources of knowledge has played an important role in students' acquisition of knowledge. Computers can be programmed to provide an endless numbers of questions in diverse range of fields, and as the students answer these questions, the facts has been learned and reinforced. A case in point is the reading and listening parts of TOEFL iBT exams, as candidates have to answer many questions in a limited period of time. Moreover, when students have some academic problems, they can post those to some websites and receive correct answers from unknown people in faraway places without any costs. Besides, in the past, conducting a research require long hours of searching in library shelves, now all can be done at a click of a button. Thus, technologies are vital in students' learning.On the other hand, schools and university are places in which students gather to be educated and learn from each others as well as formal educators. At schools, students' development has been orchestrated stage by stage, step by step by experienced teachers, and their acquisition of knowledge is guided and backed up in a systematic way. Therefore, formal education approaches are also indispensable. To put it all in a nutshell, I pen out saying that alternative sources information and traditional education systems are equally important in children's development. So students should learn both from their teachers as well as modern technology to gain the best learning outcome.
llm: The manner in which children study today is fundamentally different from that of previous generations, largely due to the increased accessibility and relatively low cost of modern technology. While some argue that students gain more valuable knowledge from teachers than from other sources, I firmly believe that both alternative sources and traditional teaching methods are equally vital in the knowledge acquisition process for children.There is no doubt that the proliferation of alternative knowledge sources has significantly contributed to students' learning. Computers can be programmed to present an endless array of questions across various subjects, allowing students to learn and reinforce facts as they respond. For instance, the reading and listening sections of the TOEFL iBT exams require candidates to answer numerous questions within a limited timeframe. Additionally, students facing academic challenges can post inquiries on websites and receive accurate answers from strangers around the world, often at no cost. In the past, research demanded countless hours spent searching library shelves; today, it can be accomplished with a simple click. Therefore, technology plays a crucial role in students' education.On the other hand, schools and universities serve as environments where students not only learn from formal educators but also engage with each other. In these institutions, experienced teachers guide students through their development step by step, ensuring a systematic approach to knowledge acquisition. Hence, formal educational methods remain indispensable.In conclusion, I assert that alternative information sources and traditional educational systems are equally important for children's development. To achieve the best learning outcomes, students should learn from both their teachers and modern technology.

question: Popular events like the football World Cup and other international sporting occasions are essential in easing international tensions and releasing patriotic emotions in a safe way. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
human: A world sportive competition event is watched by almost every country around the world and provide social stimulus and people gathering. However, while people view these sportive events as vital in release international problems, others think that they are just entertainment to distract people. I believe that they are important somehow, but not essential.As a matter of fact, world sport events provide positive waves for number of people. The main purpose of such competitions is to enjoy and share emotions between supporters though their favorite team. These emotions are shared locally in our village or city, nationally in our own country but even internationally too. Obviously these events gather people and their nationalist pride feeling is increased. For example, the football world cup taking place every four years is a very followed event during which everyone is having fun.Moreover, these sports events are not essential in other issues such as politics or other international affairs. Thus, if the general atmosphere during the show is peaceful and fraternal, the reality is different. In other words, this is the "calm before the storm". After the Olympics games are finished, everything came back to normal and all the game competition is forgotten by the majority. To picture it, recently, Putin was pleased to open the last winter Olympic games and gather international countries, but actually it has been just facade and Putin didn't listen international warning after he conquered the Crimea.Finally, an international sports event is a very good thing to gather people, let them dream, being proud of their nationality and forget problems, but just for a while. These meetings are in none case here to interact with international affairs.
llm: Global sporting events attract viewers from nearly every country, fostering social connection and community engagement. While some people see these competitions as crucial for alleviating international issues, others view them merely as entertainment meant to distract the masses. I believe they hold significance, but not in a fundamental way.In fact, world sports events create positive experiences for many individuals. The primary aim of such competitions is to bring joy and unite fans around their favorite teams, allowing them to share emotions—locally within their communities, nationally within their countries, and even internationally. These events undeniably create a sense of togetherness, igniting national pride. For instance, the football World Cup, held every four years, captivates audiences and generates excitement across the globe.However, these sporting events are not pivotal to resolving serious matters like politics or international relations. The atmosphere during these events may seem harmonious and friendly, but the underlying reality can be quite different. It can often feel like a "calm before the storm." Once the Olympics conclude, life resumes, and most people quickly forget about the competitions. A recent example is when Putin opened the last Winter Olympics, which seemingly brought nations together, but this was simply a façade, as he ignored international warnings following his conquest of Crimea.In conclusion, while international sports events provide a wonderful opportunity for people to come together, dream, take pride in their national identity, and escape their problems—this impact is only temporary. These gatherings do not fundamentally influence international relations or address pressing global issues.

question: Many people use distance-learning programmes (study material post,TV,internet...)to study at home. But some people think that it cannot bring the benefit as much as attending college or university. Do you agree or disagree?
human: With the tremendous development in information technology, long-distance education enables people to study at home without going to school. Whether this teaching approach is more beneficial to pupils than the traditional way sparks off a heated debate. From my perspective, I agree with the view that students can acquire more benefits from the remote education.To begin with, studying at home save the pupils enormous time and considerable expense. Students who use distance-learning programs can cut down their commuting time, tuition fees, textbook fees and so forth just by an internet connection. This especially makes a significant difference for the children who live in the far-off countryside and the children whose families are living below the poverty-line.Besides that, long-distance education provides students the opportunity to access the immense knowledge resources and a variety of teaching approaches. Pupils can obtain materials for their curricula just by one mouse click, such as science reports, study posts, documentary records, etc. A student can even select a specific online course based on his own preference and time schedule so he can control the learning progress and make satisfactory achievement on this course.It is undeniable that traditional education has its advantages in face-to-face communication, mental inspiration and physical educations. These make remarkable contributions in providing immediate feedbacks and cultivating pupils' personalities. But with the improvements in streaming and sensor technologies, remote education can eliminate the obstacles of distance and body contacts.In conclusion, I concede that traditional education has some merits like feedbacks and inspirations that cannot be replaced in the near future. However, distance-learning outweighs the conventional way not only with its efficiency, convenience and economic value, but also with the self-regulated education that pupils can study on their own purpose.
llm: With the rapid advancement of information technology, distance education has made it possible for individuals to study from home without the need to attend a physical school. The question of whether this method of teaching is more advantageous for students than traditional education has generated significant debate. I personally believe that students stand to gain more from remote learning.Firstly, studying from home enables students to save both time and money. Those enrolled in distance learning programs can significantly reduce their commuting time, tuition costs, and expenses for textbooks and other materials, all simply by having internet access. This is particularly beneficial for children living in remote rural areas or those from families struggling financially.Additionally, online education offers students access to a vast array of knowledge and diverse teaching methods. Learners can easily find curriculum materials with just a click, including scientific reports, research articles, and documentaries. Moreover, students have the freedom to choose specific online courses that align with their interests and schedules, allowing them to control their learning pace and achieve their desired outcomes.While traditional education undeniably offers advantages such as face-to-face interaction, motivational support, and physical activities, which contribute greatly to immediate feedback and personality development, advancements in streaming and sensor technology are beginning to bridge the gaps in distance learning regarding personal interaction.In conclusion, I acknowledge that traditional education has some irreplaceable benefits, such as direct feedback and inspiration. However, the merits of distance education—its efficiency, convenience, economic advantages, and the opportunity for self-directed learning—outweigh those of conventional schooling.

question: There are many extinct species in the world nowadays. Some people say we should protect these animals from dying out, while others say we should concentrate more on problems of human beings. Discuss both opinions and give your personal view.
human: Many animals today are in danger of extinction owing to various reasons. While some people believe it is important to protect these endangered species, others argue that problems of human beings deserve more attention. In my opinion, we should give priority to our own issues.Animal protectionists may base their argument on the ground that biodiversity is essential to maintain the balance of ecosystem. If certain species are absent from this system, such kind of balance is likely to be disrupted and other species, including human beings, will come under threat. Therefore, it is our responsibility to keep as many species on the Earth as possible.However, I think species extinction is quite natural according to the theory of evolution. The environment on the Earth has been transformed many times since the first species came into being. A great number of plants and animals died out because they were unable to fit into the new environment. On most occasions, the process of extinction of some species is irrevocable and we can do nothing about it.Furthermore, human beings nowadays are still faced with many urgent problems such as starvation, disease and wars. When these problems are taken into account, extinction of some animals recedes greatly in importance and it is not sensible to devote our limited resources to animals that have been past help. We should put our own survival and sustainment in order first before considering the conservation of other species.In conclusion, more emphasis should be laid on human beings other than animals, and it is better to let nature take its course with regard to species extinction.
llm: Many animal species today are at risk of extinction for various reasons. While some individuals argue for the importance of protecting these endangered species, others contend that human challenges should take precedence. In my view, we should prioritize our own issues.Proponents of animal conservation often argue that biodiversity is vital for maintaining the balance of ecosystems. The absence of certain species can disrupt this balance and endanger other species, including humans. Thus, they assert it is our duty to preserve as many species as possible on Earth.However, I believe that species extinction is a natural part of evolution. The Earth’s environment has undergone significant changes since the emergence of the first species. Many plants and animals have gone extinct because they could not adapt to new conditions. In many instances, the extinction process is irreversible, and there is little we can do to prevent it.Additionally, humanity continues to confront pressing issues such as hunger, disease, and warfare. When these urgent matters are considered, the extinction of certain animals becomes significantly less important, and it doesn't make sense to allocate our limited resources to species that are beyond assistance. We must first ensure our own survival and well-being before focusing on the conservation of other species.In conclusion, we should place greater emphasis on human concerns rather than animal welfare, allowing nature to take its course in matters of species extinction.

question: Universities should accept equal numbers of male and female students in every subject. To what extend do you agree or disagree.
human: In today's context, education is the most significant factor which ultimately determines one's future. In my personal opinion, I am totally agreed with the view that there should not be any room for partiality in terms of gender while allocating seats for students in every university courses. There appear to be various reasons often strike in my mind in support of this position. To begin with, judging student's skills and abilities should only be based on their academic qualifications and talents rather than gender in particular. Nowadays, both male and female students are equally competitive to each other and deserve to produce impressive results in various field of education. In India, for example, female students are more often likely to grab more number of top scorer positions in every year higher secondary school examinations. Furthermore, female students are highly interested in learning courses such as mechanical engineering which demands physical activities in their lab workshops, unlike previous generation females. In addition, due to increasing exposure on current affairs and knowledge on cutting-edge technological developments, female graduates are more willing to take huge responsibilities in their workplace, despite its intensive stress and pressure. For example, Chanda Kochhar, who is the CEO of India's second largest bank called ICICI bank and prominently awarded as the country's most powerful female head in business sector. In conclusion, I am firmly supporting the view, that every student either male or female should be given fairly equal opportunity to purse their education in all university subjects, provided they should meet the required qualifications rather than putting limitations based on their gender. Government should take interim measures, to regulate admission process for university courses which enables every student to get benefit.
llm: In today's world, education plays a crucial role in shaping one's future. I firmly believe that there should be no gender-based discrimination when it comes to student admissions in university courses. Several reasons support this perspective.First and foremost, a student's capabilities and talents should be assessed solely on their academic achievements and skills, rather than their gender. Nowadays, male and female students are equally competitive and both deserve recognition for their achievements across various fields of study. For instance, in India, it is common for female students to secure a greater number of top positions in higher secondary school examinations each year.Moreover, female students today show a keen interest in traditionally male-dominated fields, such as mechanical engineering, which involve hands-on work in laboratories. This marks a significant shift from previous generations. With increased awareness of current events and advances in technology, female graduates are also more prepared to take on significant responsibilities in the workplace, despite the challenges they may face. A noteworthy example is Chanda Kochhar, the CEO of ICICI Bank, who has been recognized as one of the most powerful women in the business sector in India.In conclusion, I strongly advocate that all students, regardless of gender, should have equal opportunities to pursue their education in any university subject, provided they meet the necessary qualifications. The government should implement measures to ensure a fair admission process that benefits every student.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Face-to-face communication is better than other types of communication, such as letters, email, or telephone calls. Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
human: There is a hotly debated issue over whether face-to-face communication is better than other kinds of communication, and this topic can also be approached from several different angles due to its complexity. Some people tend to believe that communication in person is the best way of expression, while others seem to stand on the opposite position. After deeply pondering over this issue, I also develop my own perspective. I favor the former; that is, I agree that face-to-face communication is better. The first and foremost reason lies in the inevitable fact that communicating in person can be more convincing. Sometimes, face-to face communication can lead us to convince or complain someone successfully, and a fitting example can be found from my uncle. He once complained a service of a restaurant. Without exaggeration, he directly went to the boss and told the boss that something wrong occurred on the meal--a fly concealed in it. Afterward, my uncle acquired a new service thanks to face-to face communication. If he just wrote something to complain on the website or by telephone, I do not think this problem would be thought important. Therefore, we can commence to agree that communicating with someone in person is the best way. Apart from the one I have mentioned above, another equally crucible aspect is that it is easy to be deceived without face-to face communication. For instance, I had received some harmful words on facebook from my best friend, Eric. He said that I was totally failed in building a good friendship and he did not want to be one of my friends anymore. I just shocked and did not know what happened. Finally, I realized that his facebook account was stolen. Hence, from this case, we are capable of stating that it is important to talk to people face-to-face. Admittedly, on the other hand, there might be some dissidents proclaiming that communication by letters, email, or telephone can enable them to talk without scruple, which is also one of the most important parts in communication. However, from my limited understanding, I just doubt the credibility of that saying. It is conceivable that before we talk, it is necessary for us to be imprudent about our words. Talking without scruple is not the indispensable part in communication; in contrast, it is usually detrimental to us. Based on the reasons demonstrated above, I prefer to express my opinion in person because the advantages of this are qualitatively greater than that of the opposite. In other words, I think the best way of communication is by means of face-to-face. It is not to say, of course, that other points of view are completely without merit. Still, I am firmly convinced that the reasons I proposed in favor of my own sentiment are much more tenable and cogent.
llm: The debate over whether face-to-face communication is superior to other forms of communication is a contentious one, and its complexity allows for multiple perspectives. While some people advocate for in-person interactions as the most effective form of expression, others hold an opposing view. After reflecting on this issue, I find myself in agreement with the former stance, believing that face-to-face communication is indeed the better option.The primary reason for this belief is the undeniable fact that in-person interactions can be more persuasive.
