For example, I recall an incident involving my uncle, who once expressed dissatisfaction with a restaurant's service. Rather than leaving a negative review online or making a phone complaint, he approached the restaurant owner directly and explained that a fly had been found in his meal. As a result of this face-to-face communication, he received a new meal and better service. Had he chosen to complain through other means, I doubt the issue would have been taken as seriously. This illustrates that speaking directly with someone is often the most effective method of communication.Additionally, another crucial point is that without face-to-face interactions, misunderstandings can arise. For instance, I once received hurtful messages on Facebook from my best friend, Eric, who claimed I had failed at building our friendship and no longer wanted to be friends. I was shocked and confused until I discovered that his account had been hacked. This experience highlights the importance of direct communication, which can help prevent misinterpretations and clarify intentions.Of course, some may argue that communicating through letters, emails, or phone calls allows for more freedom of expression without immediate consequences. While I understand this perspective, I remain skeptical of its validity. It's essential to choose our words carefully during conversations, and speaking without restraint can often lead to misunderstandings or hurt feelings.In conclusion, I prefer to communicate in person because the benefits of this approach far outweigh those of alternatives. While I acknowledge that other forms of communication have their merits, I firmly believe that the arguments supporting face-to-face interaction are more compelling and substantial.

question: One of the consequences of improved medical care is that people are living longer and life expectancy is increasing. Do you think the disadvantages of this development outweight the disadvantages?
human: Along with the development of technologies, advanced medical care has played an important role in the improvement of life expectancy. Although the increase in life expectancy has some pressure on the Medicare system, I am inclined to believe that the advanced medical care brings with it more benefits than disadvantages.The main advantage of high-tech medical care is that people are better taken care so that they have a good health. They can contribute effectively to the development of the economy because healthy workers can create more productivity. In other words, they do not have to spend more time in health checking or treatment so this saves an amount of time as well as cost.In addition, a community with the elderly who have a good health has a major role to play in a sustainable development of a society. In facts, young people will be happy as their parents, grandparents are healthy. It can be said that the improvement of medical care makes a better life for all people.On the other hand, some people maintain that the increase in life expectancy puts a high pressure on the economic system because more pension have to spend for Medicare instead of investing in other sectors of the economic system. Although it is real in some aspects, I believe that the capital that spend on taking care the elderly is contributed by these people during their working time, so they are worth to have good care. They have given their effort to the society so that young people, the governments have a responsibility to improve the Medicare system.By way of conclusion, it is true that the development of the health care system helps people have a better life. It helps people build a sustainable society where people can live a happy life when they are old.
llm: The advancement of technology has significantly enhanced medical care, contributing to increased life expectancy. While this rise in life expectancy does place some strain on the Medicare system, I believe the benefits of improved medical care far outweigh the drawbacks.One of the primary advantages of high-tech medical care is the enhanced health management it provides, allowing individuals to enjoy better overall health. This, in turn, enables them to contribute more effectively to the economy, as healthy workers tend to be more productive. With less time spent on health check-ups and treatments, both time and costs are saved.Moreover, a community with healthy elderly individuals plays a crucial role in the sustainable development of society. Young people benefit from having healthy parents and grandparents, fostering a sense of happiness. Thus, it can be argued that advancements in medical care lead to an improved quality of life for everyone.Conversely, some argue that increased life expectancy places substantial pressure on the economic system, as more funds are needed for Medicare rather than for investments in other areas. While this concern is valid to some extent, it is important to recognize that the resources allocated for elderly care come from contributions made by these individuals during their working years. They have invested their efforts into society, and therefore, the younger generation and the government have a responsibility to ensure a robust Medicare system for them.In conclusion, it is evident that the development of the healthcare system enhances people's lives. It paves the way for a sustainable society where individuals can enjoy a fulfilling life in their later years.

question: Successful people do something new or take risks rather than only doing something they know how to do well. AGREE OR DISAGREE.
human: There is a hotly debated issue over whether successful people usually take risk or try new things, and the topic can be approached from several different angles due to its complexity. Some people tend to believe that to be successful, they should do something they are unfamiliar with, while others seem to stand on the opposite place. After deeply pondering over this issue, I develop my own perspective as well. I favor the latter; that is, successful people still do things they already know.The first and foremost reason lies in an inevitable fact that to be successful, we all try to reduce the risk we might encounter. The lower the factors making us fail we have, the higher probability to success we own. Consider a circumstance in which one person is rich because he knows a lot of knowledge of investment. He can focus on certain companies which he thinks is worth it to invest, and then just waits for the not so high but constant income. He does not have to invest some dangerous companies to get higher profit which might lead him to bankrupt in a short time. Therefore, we can commence to agree that successful people do not have to try new things or take risks.Moreover, another equally crucial aspect is that it depends on the capability of one to decide whether he can succeed or not. At least, a successful person should be able to dismantle the hurdles prohibiting him to success. For instance, the sports stars do not have to take some drugs to win a game or show their extraordinary skills. The same reason why they succeed is that they all have the predominated abilities in sports realm. In contrast, those athletes try to have distinctive performance by taking risks of taking drugs are failed to succeed. Hence, from this case, we are capable of stating that it is not necessary for successful people to take risks.Admittedly, on the other hands, there might be some dissidents proclaiming that doing something new is necessary for people to success because they can become different from others, which is also a widely accepted idea for success. However, according to my limited understanding, I just doubt the credibility of that saying owing to its imprudence. Try something new can indeed make people become special, while it does not mean successful. Based on the reasons demonstrated above, I believe that doing what we already known can still leads us to succeed because the advantages of this are relatively greater than that of the opposite. In other words, reducing risks and enhancing individual's capability is the most important path to success. It is not to say, of course, that other points of view are completely without merit. Still, I am firmly convinced that the reasons I have proposed in favor of my own sentiment are much more tenable and cogent.
llm: The debate surrounding whether successful individuals typically take risks or explore new ventures is nuanced and complex, offering various perspectives. Some believe that achieving success requires stepping outside of one's comfort zone, while others maintain that success often comes from leveraging familiar skills and knowledge. After careful consideration, I align with the latter viewpoint: successful people frequently rely on what they already know.A primary reason for this belief is the inherent desire to minimize risks associated with failure. The fewer obstacles one faces, the greater the likelihood of success. For example, consider an individual who becomes wealthy through extensive investment knowledge. By focusing on companies he knows to be stable, he can earn a steady, if modest, income without exposing himself to high-risk investments that could result in significant losses. Thus, it's reasonable to conclude that successful individuals need not seek out new experiences or take significant risks.Additionally, success often hinges on an individual's ability to navigate barriers that stand in the way of achievement. For instance, elite athletes do not need to resort to performance-enhancing drugs to excel; their success stems from dedicated training and inherent talent. Conversely, athletes who choose to take performance-enhancing substances often face scandal and failure. This reinforces the idea that taking unnecessary risks is not a prerequisite for success.Of course, there are those who argue that embracing the unfamiliar is essential for distinguishing oneself and achieving success. While it's true that innovation can set one apart, I question the validity of this perspective, as it can often lead to imprudent choices. Engaging in new endeavors may bring uniqueness, but it does not guarantee success.In conclusion, I assert that relying on established knowledge and skills can effectively lead to success, as the benefits of minimizing risks and enhancing individual capabilities often outweigh the potential advantages of taking a chance on something new. This does not imply that alternative viewpoints lack merit, but I firmly believe that the rationale I've presented in support of my position is more compelling and convincing.

question: Some people believe that a college or university education should be available to all students. Others believe that higher education should be available only to good students. Discuss these views. Which view do you agree with? Explain why.
human: The purpose of education is always a controversial topic among people and society, especially in high level such as college or university. Some people think that all students should deserve to be educated at this level. However, in my opinion, it should be better to leave this type of type of training for a certain group of good, knowledgeable learners.First, focusing only on talented students is a better option because it helps academic institutions maintain their high education quality. Unlike middle school or high school, university and college require far a lot of ability and skills to keep up with an enormous amount of complex knowledge. In fact, some students may be capable in high schools, but the pressure of higher education is tough even for talented ones. That explains why it is only suitable for a limited people, and opening up for everyone will be fatal for institutions, since they need to somehow lower the materials so that it is practical for everyone.Secondly, university should only accept good students because it gives better human resources for sophisticated purposes. Some people argue that this may lead to 'social division', when someone with high education refuses to do the called 'low jobs', but actually it gives no harm to the whole community. Those standard jobs will always be available for everyone, while complex ones should be only handled by the best people, who start their career from the best institutions. I think limiting the number of people who can be admitted by universities is a good choice since it will reward the motivation of students and constantly keep them in the difficult level of learning, which makes them do the best to improve themselves. Ultimately, this improves the overall quality of education and gives the best people to serve in the most necessary needs of the society.To sum thing up, I agree that everyone should have a compulsory education level up to high school, but the above divisions should be only the realm of the best students. This will improve the quality of both universities and students, thus placing people in positions which suit them most.
llm: The purpose of education often sparks heated debate among individuals and society, particularly at the college and university levels. Some believe that all students should have the opportunity to receive education at this stage. However, I contend that such training should be reserved for a select group of highly capable and knowledgeable learners.Firstly, concentrating on talented students is a more effective approach as it allows academic institutions to uphold their standards of high-quality education. Unlike middle and high schools, universities and colleges demand a greater level of skill and ability to navigate a vast array of complex subjects. While some students may excel in high school, the rigors of higher education can be a significant challenge even for the most gifted individuals. This underscores the need for selective admission; allowing everyone access could dilute the educational quality, as institutions would be forced to simplify coursework to accommodate all students.Secondly, universities should prioritize admitting well-qualified students in order to cultivate a skilled workforce for specialized roles. Critics may argue that this creates a "social division," claiming that highly educated individuals might shun so-called "low-skilled" jobs. However, this perspective overlooks the reality that standard jobs will always be available to the broader population, while more complex roles should be tackled by the most competent individuals, who emerge from top-tier institutions. By limiting university admissions, we not only incentivize students to strive for excellence but also maintain rigorous academic standards, ultimately enhancing the quality of education and ensuring that the most capable individuals meet the critical needs of society.In conclusion, I believe that while everyone should receive mandatory education up to high school, higher education should be the domain of the most talented students. This approach will enhance the quality of both universities and their graduates, placing individuals in roles that best match their strengths and abilities.

question: Agree or disagree? Universities spend money on improving facilities (labs and general requirements) better than hiring famous teachers.Ê
human: There is a hotly debated issue over whether universities should spend money on improving facilities is more than hiring famous teachers, and this topic can be approached from several different angles due to its complexity. Some people tend to prefer that schools should invest in renewing facilities, while other seem to believe that famous teachers is more conducive to students. After deeply pondering over this issue, I develop my own perspective as well. I favor the former; that is, I prefer to spend money on improving facilities. With this convenient and versatile facility, students can improve their learning condition. Therefore, we can commence to agree that certain facilities are beneficial to students. Moreover, another equally crucial aspect is that students are not always staying in classrooms. They have numerous activities in school. Consider a circumstance in which a student who is a member of jazz ensemble in their school. He must need a better auditorium for him to have an extraordinary performance. With this distinguished performance, the student would acquire an unforgettable and valuable experience burring deeply in his mind. Hence, from this case, we are capable of stating that students would prefer school to spending on improving facilities.Admittedly, on the other hand, there might be some people proclaiming that schools should spend money on hiring prestigious teachers because they can impart their students well. However, according to my limited understanding, I just doubt the credibility of that saying owing to its imprudence. A student is good or not do not depend on whether he has a good teacher but is decided by his effort on study. It is useless to hire a super famous teacher to teach those who behaviors as sluggards. Based on the reasons demonstrate above, I believe that improving facilities is the best way for school because the advantages of this are relatively greater than that of the other. In other words, students can procure more advantages from better facilities. It is not to say, of course, that other points of view are completely without merit. Still, I an firmly convinced that the reasons I have proposed in favor of my sentiment are much more tenable and cogent.
llm: The debate about whether universities should prioritize improving facilities over hiring renowned teachers is a complex issue with various perspectives. Some argue that investing in upgraded facilities is essential, while others contend that attracting famous educators is more beneficial for students. After careful consideration, I align myself with those who advocate for facility enhancements.The primary reason for my stance is the undeniable fact that advanced facilities can significantly enhance the learning experience. For instance, a well-equipped library provides an ideal environment for students to study and conduct research. With a quiet atmosphere and ample resources, students can focus on their studies, ultimately improving their academic performance. It’s clear that quality facilities play a crucial role in supporting students’ educational journeys.Furthermore, students engage in a wide range of activities beyond the classroom, making adequate facilities even more important. Take, for example, a student participating in a jazz ensemble: a superior auditorium is essential for creating memorable performances. Such experiences can leave a lasting impact, enriching the student's education. This illustrates that students would prefer schools to invest in facility upgrades rather than solely focusing on hiring high-profile teachers.On the other hand, some might argue that hiring prestigious educators is vital because they can effectively teach and inspire students. However, I find this perspective flawed; a student’s success is not solely dependent on the teacher but rather on their own dedication and effort. Employing a renowned teacher will not yield results if the student lacks motivation.In conclusion, I firmly believe that investing in improved facilities is more beneficial for schools. The advantages of updated facilities outweigh those of hiring high-profile teachers. While other viewpoints have their merits, I am convinced that the arguments supporting facility enhancements are more compelling and valid.

question: Do you agree or dis agree with the following statement? High schools should allow students to study the courses that students want to study. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
human: Some people state that high schools should allow students to study what they want to. They believe this motivates students to study. I think, however, students should study a broad range of subjects from literature to mathematics. I believe that tertiary education should make students prepare for specialization at university. In addition, it should be to some extent paternalistic to prevent students from avoiding hurdles.To begin with, students have to find one or more fields of study in which they are really interested. They should not decide their future major without trying a broad range of subjects, otherwise they might miss valuable encounter with the subject. For instance, a would-be mathematician student may be strongly intrigued by philosophy and make a success in the field.Next, students should obtain knowledge from a variety of academic fields. General education plays a significant role in specialized education. Science today, for example, is said to be more and more specialized, but in order to solve a problem scientists have to combine knowledge from chemistry to physics. In addition, although textbooks used in higher education are labelled particular subjects, in fact they require basic understanding of other subjects. For instance, you sometimes need knowledge about physics to read a text on chemistry. Therefore, high school students should learn broadly and prepare future learning at university.Last but not least, students have tendency to shun difficulties. They might avoid tough courses, but instead attend mainly Mickey Mouse courses and enjoy themselves too much. This might result in limited choices in the future. Therefore, schools should be responsible for their future and protect them.In summary, students should find interesting subjects and acquire general knowledge to prepare higher education at tertiary education. Besides, high school must be responsible for their future with well-planned curriculum.
llm: Some argue that high schools should let students choose their own subjects, believing this approach enhances motivation. However, I contend that students should engage with a broad array of disciplines, ranging from literature to mathematics. This foundational education is essential for preparing students for specialized study at university. Additionally, there should be an element of guidance to ensure students face and overcome challenges instead of sidestepping them.To start, it is vital for students to explore various fields of study to discover their true interests. Making decisions about future majors without experiencing a diverse selection of subjects could result in missed opportunities for meaningful engagement with potentially intriguing areas. For instance, a student aspiring to be a mathematician might find a profound interest in philosophy that could lead to success in that field.Furthermore, acquiring knowledge across multiple academic disciplines is crucial. A well-rounded education significantly informs specialized studies. While science has become increasingly specialized, addressing complex problems often requires an interdisciplinary approach that draws on knowledge from fields such as chemistry and physics. Additionally, even when textbooks appear to focus on specific subjects, they usually presuppose a foundational understanding of other areas. For example, comprehending a chemistry text may necessitate some knowledge of physics. Therefore, high school students should have a broad learning experience to effectively prepare for their future university studies.Lastly, students often exhibit a tendency to avoid challenges. They might opt for easier courses, prioritizing enjoyment over rigorous study, which could limit their future opportunities. Consequently, schools have a responsibility to guide students toward making informed choices and to protect their long-term interests.In conclusion, students should explore various subjects and acquire a well-rounded education in preparation for higher learning. Moreover, high schools must take responsibility for shaping students' futures through a thoughtfully designed curriculum.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Games are as important for adults as they are for children. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: As people grow up, the arguments about the importance of games arise. Some people think that, adults need playing games as children do. However, in my opinion, games are no longer too important for them for several reasons.The first reason is that games become unnecessary for people when their careers begin. Someone may argue that games help adults relax and become more balanced in life. But, more often, the pressure of work and family commitment force them to abandon their lifelong hobbies, and as a result, they cannot spend enough time and effort to their favorite games as they did in 15 or 20 years ago. For example, in my country, except for a minor part of professional athletes, the majority of people stop playing games seriously as soon as they find a decent job. They often feel that such games become more troublesome than enjoyable for their daily lives.Another reason should be mentioned is that adults often do not pursue games as a competitive activity, while children are always keen on competition and winning. For youngsters, maintaining their desire to win often develops many outstanding characteristics whether they participate sport events or not. For example, my younger sister likes fencing, and thanks to her desire to win, she never gives up when facing a difficult situation, or even becoming hurt. On the other hand, adults often consider such behaviors as childish and drop them immediately. In fact, a competitive person usually finds it difficult to cooperate with friends and colleagues. Because of that, they no longer play games for any moderate achievements, and gradually lose their interest in such activities.To sum up, I think adults do need to play games, but their styles are often distinct from children's, which are often less competitive and more enjoyable. Along with the high requirement for family and work, games are just some leisure activities for adults, not something necessary as they are meant to be for children.
llm: As individuals mature, debates about the significance of gaming come to the forefront. Some advocate for adults to engage in games just as children do. However, I believe that games lose much of their importance for adults for several reasons.Firstly, games become less essential when individuals embark on their careers. Some may argue that games provide a necessary outlet for relaxation and balance in adult life. Yet, the demands of work and family often compel adults to forgo lifelong hobbies. Consequently, they struggle to dedicate the time and energy to their favorite games as they once did years ago. For instance, in my country, aside from a small group of professional athletes, most individuals tend to stop engaging in games seriously once they secure stable employment. They frequently perceive such activities as more burdensome than enjoyable in their daily lives.Another notable point is that adults typically do not approach games as a competitive endeavor, unlike children who are often eager to compete and win. For young individuals, the drive to succeed fosters essential qualities, regardless of their involvement in sports events. For example, my younger sister is passionate about fencing, and her competitive spirit enables her to persevere through challenges, even when faced with injury. In contrast, adults often dismiss such attitudes as immature and abandon them. As a result, competitive individuals may struggle to collaborate with friends and colleagues, leading to a gradual disinterest in games altogether.In conclusion, while I believe that adults do benefit from playing games, their approach differs from that of children, often leaning towards a more relaxed and enjoyable experience rather than a competitive one. With the increasing demands of family and work, games become mere leisure activities for adults rather than the essential experiences they are for children.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Modern technology is creating a single world culture. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: There are many different opinions regarding world culture. Some people think that all the countries in the world cannot have a single culture. However, in my view, a single modern culture is being created by modern technology for the following reasons.Firstly, most of the countries have the same educational system based on technology. Teachers give topics to the students who should research on the internet to find data, and then students should type their research by using computer and even give a presentation by using PowerPoint. For example, students who are studying in Iran use the same software, Microsoft, to type their homework or have presentation compared to Canadian students.Secondly, new technology has created some similar jobs all around the world. Computer technology is a growing job in most of the countries, and students are being encouraged to study in this field. For example, many immigrants in Canada who have the degree in computer technology fields can easily go to Canadian universities and find jobs with good salaries. This example shows that jobs that are related to technology are in demand in most of the countries.Some people might argue that there are some cultures such as making foods which are unicq in each culture, and technology cannot affect them. This point has some merits on the surface; however, many countries such as Canada, the USA, and British have many restaurants which serve many foods form different countries and cultures. In fact, cooks can find many new food recipes easily on the Internet. For example, two days ago, I went to a Canadian restaurant, and I ate noodle, sushi, which are Chinese foods, and Greek salad.To sum up, new technology has affected cultures of the world, and we can see many similarities in many cultures. In fact, new technology has influences on educational system, jobs and foods in the world.
llm: Opinions on global culture vary widely. Some argue that a universal culture cannot emerge from the diverse nations around the world. However, I believe that modern technology is fostering the development of a singular contemporary culture for several reasons.Firstly, many countries share a similar education system centered around technology. For instance, teachers assign research topics that students must explore online, compile their findings using computers, and often create presentations with tools like PowerPoint. For example, students in Iran and Canada both utilize Microsoft software for their assignments, illustrating this shared educational approach.Secondly, advances in technology have led to the emergence of similar job markets worldwide. The demand for computer technology professionals is increasing across various nations, prompting students to pursue studies in this area. For instance, many immigrants in Canada with degrees in computer-related fields can easily enroll in Canadian universities and secure well-paying jobs. This trend demonstrates that technology-related careers are sought after globally.Some may argue that certain cultural aspects, like culinary traditions, remain unique to each society and are unaffected by technology. While this argument has some validity, it overlooks the fact that countries like Canada, the USA, and the UK feature diverse restaurants offering dishes from numerous cultures. Moreover, chefs can readily access a wealth of new recipes online. For example, just recently, I dined at a Canadian restaurant where I enjoyed noodles and sushi—traditional Chinese dishes—as well as Greek salad.In conclusion, modern technology significantly influences world cultures, revealing numerous similarities among them. Its impact is evident in education, employment, and culinary practices globally.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: Nowadays it is much easier to achieve success with the help from one's family than what is like before
human: There are many factors that contribute to one's success. However, which factor is the most influential one is open to debate. Some people believe that nowadays the assitance from family is quite a essential factor in one's success. It seems that one can achieve success more easily with the help from his or her family. I agree with this statement. In my opinion, family plays a more important role in helping one to pursuit success. There are a couple of reasons.First of all, more and more people have the opportunity to receive education from university. Since our parents receive better education than our grandparents did, they can provide more advices and helps in our career. In the past, seldom people have the chance to attend a collage. For example, my grandparents did not get a education even in high school, so when my father had difficulty in solving a problem in his childhood, he had to go to his teacher for help. Things have changed a lot. I grow up in a better condition than my father did. Whenever I have problems, I can always ask my parents for help. They can solve the problem quickly because they have learned quite a lot. What is more, family members can help us in many other aspects. For example, when I did not know what major to choose when I attend university, my father told a lot about different majors. He shared his own experience with me, which helped me quite a lot. Parents are quite experienced than their child, they can guide them toward the right direction. Besides, parents can told their children as many as they can. What they want is help their child to make a progress.In a word, our parents and other family members can help us a lot in our life. I believe that with the help of our family, we can achieve success quite easily.
llm: Numerous factors contribute to an individual's success, but the most significant one remains a topic of discussion. Many argue that family support is crucial for success in today’s world, as having a supportive family can facilitate the journey toward achievement. I concur with this viewpoint, believing that family plays a vital role in helping individuals strive for success for several reasons.Firstly, an increasing number of people now have access to higher education. Parents today typically receive a better education than previous generations, enabling them to offer valuable advice and assistance in their children’s careers. In contrast, past generations had fewer educational opportunities. For example, my grandparents never completed high school, so when my father faced challenges in his youth, he often had to seek assistance from his teachers. Today, the landscape has changed considerably. I grew up with more resources than my father did, and whenever I encounter difficulties, I can turn to my parents for guidance. Their broader knowledge allows them to provide effective solutions.Additionally, family members can assist in various areas of life. For instance, when I was uncertain about which major to select for my university studies, my father shared his insights about different fields based on his experiences. Their wealth of knowledge and life experiences enables parents to steer their children in the right direction. Moreover, parents strive to share as much guidance as possible, motivated by a desire to see their children progress.In conclusion, the support from parents and other family members can significantly impact our lives. I firmly believe that with our family's assistance, achieving success becomes a much more attainable endeavor.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Reading fiction (such as novels and short stories) is more enjoyable than watching movies. Use specific reasons and examples to explain your position.
human: There are many different opinions regarding hobbies. Some people would rather watch TV. However, in my view, reading fiction is more enjoyable than watching movies for the following reasons.Firstly, fiction books pay more attention to details. In fact, we can know characters, places, and times of a novel very well during reading it. Most of the novels describe not only main characters but also other people in the novels, where each scene is happening. For example, after I read animal farms which is a story of Russian revolution, I could understand the leaders and different segments of the Russian people. However, a movie just gives us a very small review of its stories and characters.Secondly, reading a novel is more convenient. Some novels have around 100 pages and readers cannot finish them in just one hour. Yet these people can continue to read their novels wherever they find free time such as in bus or trains. For example, I have started to read a novel since last week. I do not have enough time to read a novel in one day, so I usually read it when I am coming home from English class. In contrast, I cannot watch a complete movie because I can just sit in front of TV for 15 minutes and after that, I have to study.Some people might argue that people enjoy watching TV when they know they can learn many things such as learning a language by watching movies. This point has some merits on the surface; however, movies are not a good idea to learn a language for beginners since characters in movies speak very fast and unclear for language learners. For these learners it is better to start by reading some novels which are more comprehensible and enjoyable.To sum up, reading fictions is more pleasant because these books have more depth, are much easier to use, and more useful for language learners.
llm: There are a variety of perspectives on the subject of hobbies. While some individuals prefer watching television, I believe that reading fiction offers a more enjoyable experience than watching movies for several reasons.To begin with, fiction books provide greater attention to detail. When we read, we become deeply familiar with the characters, settings, and timelines of a story. Novels often delve into not only the lives of the main characters but also the supporting figures and the contexts in which the events unfold. For instance, after reading "Animal Farm," which reflects the Russian Revolution, I gained insights into the leaders and various segments of Russian society. In contrast, films typically offer only a brief overview of their plots and characters.Additionally, reading novels is more convenient. Many novels consist of around 100 pages, which may take more than an hour to finish. Yet readers can pick up their books anytime they have a spare moment, such as during a bus or train ride. For example, I've been reading a novel for the past week. With my busy schedule, I can't dedicate an entire day to reading, so I usually read during my commute home from English class. Conversely, watching a complete movie is challenging for me; I can only sit in front of the TV for about 15 minutes before needing to study.Some may argue that watching TV provides valuable learning opportunities, such as acquiring a new language through films. While this notion has some merit, movies can be overwhelming for beginners since the dialogue often progresses too quickly and unclearly. For those starting out, it's generally more beneficial to read novels, which are clearer and more engaging.In conclusion, reading fiction is more enjoyable due to its depth, convenience, and effectiveness for language learners.

question: Several languages die every year. Many people feel this is a positive trend and that a world with fewer language promotes harmony and understanding between people. Analyze both sides of this argument and provide your opinion.
human: Today, English is commonly used language across the world. Its usage is increasing day by day. As a consequence, various local languages are becoming extinct. Some people argue that, this is a positive change and would help people to easily communicate. While there are others who disagree with this and are more concerned about dying local languages. In my opinion, I believe using single language through out the world is a positive change which is helping the world to become a better place to live.A world with fewer languages helps us interact with each other in a better way. Due to globalization, many people are traveling for professional trips. So, communicating in single language will reduce the problems of travelers in daily activities like ordering food in a restaurant or in going around places. Furthermore, students who migrate for better education would not have to go through lot of stress as they can easily make new friends and can be part of any discussions which is otherwise not possible in a world with multiple languages; this in turn makes it easy to adjust in new environment. Single language also reduces misunderstandings between people. Adding to that, exchange of knowledge in different sectors of research like electronics, medical, astronomy etc would become easier.On the other hand, few people are worried about the dying local languages. These languages are the basis for the origination and initial communication between different cultures. They represent local culture. As the usage of these languages decrease, culture also changes accordingly. Further, these languages are tightly coupled with history; all the olden day literature and scripts will be impossible to decipher if these languages are lost.To conclude, I believe change is inevitable and that usage of one language across the world is a positive one. We have to accept these changes for a world to be a better place. Communication in single language would improve the productivity of the world and brings everyone on to the same page.
llm: Today, English has become a widely used language around the globe, and its prevalence continues to grow. As a result, many local languages are facing extinction. Some argue that this shift is beneficial, as it facilitates communication among people, while others express concern about the loss of these languages. In my view, the adoption of a single global language is a positive development, making the world a more harmonious place.A world with fewer languages fosters better interaction among individuals. With the rise of globalization, many people travel for work, and speaking a common language can alleviate the challenges travelers face in everyday tasks, such as ordering food at a restaurant or navigating unfamiliar places. Moreover, students who relocate for educational opportunities experience less stress, as they can easily make friends and participate in discussions—a significant advantage in a multilingual environment. This creates a smoother transition into new surroundings. Additionally, a common language minimizes misunderstandings and enhances the exchange of knowledge across various fields such as electronics, medicine, and astronomy.Conversely, some individuals are concerned about the decline of local languages, which are integral to the origins and initial forms of communication within diverse cultures. These languages embody local traditions, and as their use diminishes, cultural identities may also shift. Furthermore, local languages are closely tied to history; losing them would render much ancient literature and historical texts indecipherable.In conclusion, I believe that change is unavoidable, and the increasing use of a single language worldwide is a positive trend. Embracing this evolution is essential for creating a better global environment. A common language enhances productivity and unites people, fostering a shared understanding.

question: Elderly people think that the way they spent their life was simpler and better than today. Do you agree or disagree? Provide you reasons and real life example
human: Changes are inseparable parts of this world which normally humans are responsible for by manipulating the environment they live in. Sometimes these changes adversely affect our lives that make elderly people think they used to live in a better world than the modern world the younger generation are experiencing. I utterly disagree with this opinion due to technological and medical reasons.We live in an era that technology is developing in the speed of light, steering the world toward a much more convenient place. A clear-cut example that supports this idea is the invention of smart phones. The strong navigation system installed on the phones has been rescued lives of many who left alone in remote areas like forests or deserts. Moreover, some people criticize social networks as tools that have ruined true relationships and friendships by reducing face-to-face communication. In my opinion though, social networks such as Facebook could foster the ties between friends and family members who are obligatorily far away from each other by keeping them in touch, the thing that was impossible less than 20 years ago. The phenomenal progress in medical science in the last decade was a huge achievement for human being to make the world a healthier and, thus, a happier place to live in. Today, even some disabled people with serious vertebral injuries can start doing physical activities like walking again thanks to the continuingly efforts of biomechanical engineers and neurologists. The advancement in drug delivery systems is another example that could save lives. To be specific, scientists could invent ways to lead drugs directly to the damaged organs of the body, which is a miraculous breakthrough. In general, the increase in the average age of human from 50 to around 75 years through last decades is a strong evidence to show how successful human was in medicine.In conclusion, even though the people from older generation may claim they had better life as there were stronger bonds between family members and friends, I think they are wrong, since they judge the contemporary age through a personal prejudice. In light of the above-mentioned facts, one can easily conclude that in the current world living standards stand in a much higher level and people are in better conditions socially and physically.
llm: Change is an inherent aspect of our world, often influenced by human actions that alter the environments we inhabit. This constant evolution can sometimes have negative effects, leading some older individuals to believe that their previous experiences were more favorable than those of today's youth. However, I firmly disagree with this perspective, especially when considering advancements in technology and medicine.We currently inhabit an age marked by rapid technological progress, making our lives significantly more convenient. A prime example of this is the invention of smartphones. The advanced navigation systems incorporated into these devices have saved numerous lives, particularly for those stranded in isolated locations such as forests or deserts. While critics argue that social networks have diminished genuine relationships by reducing face-to-face interactions, I contend that platforms like Facebook actually strengthen connections among friends and family who are geographically separated, something that was nearly impossible less than two decades ago.Medical science has also seen remarkable advancements in recent years, contributing to a healthier and, consequently, a happier society. Thanks to the tireless efforts of biomechanical engineers and neurologists, individuals with severe spinal injuries can now regain the ability to walk. Additionally, progress in drug delivery systems has led to groundbreaking methods that direct medications to damaged organs, representing a significant medical breakthrough. The increase in the average human lifespan from 50 to around 75 years over the past several decades serves as compelling evidence of the success achieved in the field of medicine.In conclusion, while members of the older generation may assert that life was better back then due to stronger familial and social bonds, I believe this view is misguided and rooted in personal bias. Considering the points highlighted above, it is clear that contemporary living standards are significantly higher, and individuals today enjoy better social and physical conditions.

question: Some people say that all secondary school and higher school students should be taught how to manage money as its an important life skill. Do you agree or disagree with this argument?
human: There is no doubt that money has become key ingredient in various walks of our life than before. Teaching financial management to juvenile students is always a topic of debate. Some people feel that teaching money management skill to teenage students will help them realise the importance of money, while few feel that exposing children to money math at this age may turn fatal. In my view, I agree to that fact that higher school students should be made aware of the money management.The reason why I think teenage students need to understand the money management basics is, primarily when secondary school students attain the age of undergoing graduation, students ought to stay in hostels or with friends and away from family, during such situations when money management is taught at an early age students will have increased sense of responsibility and confidence. For example, while I was a kid my father used to maintain expense log for the month, I was asked to do the same for my keep track of my pocket money expenses, during my future course of life this became a practice and helped me in planning my expenses.In addition, if financial management is taught at an early age, students will have better sense of understanding of their family financial background and status, students coming up with unrealistic whims and fancies are minimized. For example, buying a gaming console may not be a big deal for a student from an affluent financial background. However, for a student coming from middle class buying a gaming console may not be the need of the hour. Hence, having exposed to money management at a high school level will help them in prioritizing the financial commitments efficiently.In conclusion, I think students understanding the money management techniques will have more positive effects than negative impact. However, the teaching should be in a constructive manner and students should not feel that they are being bullied for every expense.
llm: There is no doubt that money has become a crucial element in various aspects of our lives today. The topic of teaching financial management to young students is often debated. Some argue that teaching money management skills to teenagers will help them appreciate the significance of money, while others caution that exposing children to financial concepts at a young age may have negative consequences. Personally, I believe that high school students should be educated about money management.One key reason I advocate for teaching financial management to teenagers is that, as secondary school students approach graduation, many begin living independently, such as staying in hostels or with friends, away from their families. Providing money management education at an early age fosters a heightened sense of responsibility and confidence. For instance, when I was younger, my father kept a monthly expense log, and he encouraged me to do the same with my pocket money. This practice ingrained in me the importance of tracking expenses, which has proven invaluable as I navigated my financial journey.Moreover, teaching financial management at an early stage helps students develop a better understanding of their family’s financial situation. It minimizes the chances of them pursuing unrealistic desires. For example, a student from a wealthy background may see no issue in purchasing a gaming console, while a student from a middle-class family may recognize that it is not a necessary expense. Thus, exposure to money management during high school enables students to prioritize their financial commitments more effectively.In conclusion, I believe that teaching students about money management will yield more positive outcomes than negative effects. Nonetheless, this education should be delivered in a constructive manner, ensuring that students do not feel pressured or judged for their spending habits.

question: Some single people like to live with a roommate, while others prefer to live alone. Which would you prefer? Give specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Many single people have difficulties deciding whether to live with a roommate or to live alone. Each makes different decisions. Some people choose to live alone for privacy, while others choose to live with a roommate for practical reasons. As far as I am concerned, I prefer to live with a roommate. This is because it saves me money, enables me to socialize, and allows me to get help.Living with a roommate saves me a lot of money. If you have roommates, you can split the rent and utilities among them. This means you can get more for less. For example, last year, I shared a room off-campus with my friend, and we decided to split the rent and heating bills into half: I was able to save about fifty dollars for heating, and two hundred dollars for rent monthly. I was able to save a lot of money by sharing wasted heating and rooms with my friend and splitting the bills.Apart from saving a lot of money, living with a roommate also enables me to socialize more easily. It is always easier to socialize when you have a lot of people around you. You can invite your roommates' friends over to your room and have fun together. For instance, one night, my roommate, Millan, brought his friends along. Even though his friends and I were total strangers to each other, we quickly got to know each other. We soon found out that everyone loved playing video games. We played a video game called 'Halo' together all night, and became good friends. Living with a roommate made socializing much easier for me.Finally, living with a roommate allows me to get help. It often is the case that your roommates have the skills or knowledge you need. When you run into a problem, you can ask your roommates if they can help. Some of them may have something to offer. To illustrate, when my computer mysteriously broke down, I dialed up the manufacturer and asked for help. They failed to give me any useful solutions. To my surprise, one of my roommates noticed my problems and offered to help. He was very good with computers, and he managed to fix the problem quickly.In conclusion, while many people decide to live alone for various reasons, I prefer to live with a roommate, and I always will. This is because it offers me many advantages, such as less spending, more socializing, and more help. I think single people should live with a roommate, if they want to enjoy their lives.
llm: Many single individuals face a tough choice between living alone or sharing a space with a roommate. Each option comes with its unique considerations. Some prefer the solitude of living alone for the sake of privacy, while others opt for roommates due to practical benefits. Personally, I favor having a roommate because it helps me save money, encourages social interactions, and provides assistance when needed.One of the biggest advantages of living with a roommate is the cost savings. By sharing the rent and utility bills, living expenses become much more manageable. For example, last year I co-rented an off-campus room with a friend, and we divided the rent and heating costs evenly. As a result, I saved around fifty dollars on heating and two hundred on rent each month. Collaborating on expenses significantly eased my financial burden.Beyond financial savings, living with a roommate enhances my social life. It's naturally easier to connect with others when you’re surrounded by people. Sharing a living space opens up opportunities for socializing, such as inviting friends over. One memorable evening, my roommate Millan brought some friends over. Even though we were strangers at first, we quickly bonded over our shared love for video games. We spent the night playing 'Halo' together, and by the end, we had formed a strong friendship. Living with a roommate has undoubtedly made socializing more accessible for me.Additionally, having a roommate means you have someone to turn to for help. More often than not, your roommate may possess skills or knowledge that can assist you in various situations. For example, when my computer unexpectedly broke down, I reached out to the manufacturer for support but didn’t receive any useful advice. Fortunately, one of my roommates noticed my struggle and stepped in to help. He was tech-savvy and quickly resolved my computer issue.In conclusion, while many might choose to live alone for their own reasons, I strongly prefer the benefits of living with a roommate. The perks of reduced expenses, increased socialization, and readily available assistance make a compelling case for shared living. I believe that single people can significantly enrich their lives by choosing to live with a roommate.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Smoking should not be permitted in restaurants, and state laws that prohibit it should be upheld.
human: Generally speaking, smoking is never been good for human's body. There are so many researches done to prove that a cigar contains harmful ingredients for human's body. Although many smokers claim that they need to smoke in order to work more effectively or to think more creatively, those reasons never proves that smoking has any benefits for human's body. In my opinion, smoking should not be permitted, especially in public places like restaurants because it will make the non-smokers breathe uncomfortably.First of all, restaurants are places where people come and pay some money to enjoy their meals. Smoking in restaurants will absolutely disturb other people in enjoying their meals. They will not be able to enjoy their meals while breathing in smoke around them. Secondly, restaurants are places that people usually come with their families. This means, there will be children, grandparents, as well as pregnant women inside the restaurants. Smoking in restaurants can give a bad example to the children. Children have a high potential to imitate what adults do because they have really high curiosity towards something. Smoking in restaurants also can affect the elders' health, especially if they have problems with their hearts and lungs. The most dangerous people that would be affected by smoke are the pregnant women because they will breathe in the contaminated air and it will disrupt the growth of the babies.Last but not least, passive smokers will have a lot of health risks. When they are around the active smokers, they will inhale hazardous smoke. Stroke, heart disorders, hearing loss, and cancers are some diseases that can attack passive smokers. Personally speaking, it is unfair for passive smokers because they do not smoke but they have same health risks as the active one.In conclusion, smoking should not be permitted in restaurants because there will be a lot of people get disadvantaged. State laws that prohibit it should be upheld so the restaurant' management can make a clear rule in their restaurants because everyone has a right to enjoy their meals.
llm: Smoking has always been detrimental to the human body. Numerous studies have demonstrated that cigarettes contain harmful substances that can negatively impact health. Although some smokers argue that smoking helps them work more efficiently or think more creatively, these claims do not substantiate any genuine benefits of smoking. In my view, smoking should be banned, particularly in public spaces like restaurants, as it compromises the comfort of non-smokers.Firstly, restaurants are establishments where individuals pay to savor their meals. Smoking in these environments can undoubtedly disrupt the dining experience for others, making it difficult for patrons to enjoy their food while surrounded by smoke.Secondly, restaurants often serve as gathering places for families. This means that children, grandparents, and pregnant women can be present. Allowing smoking in restaurants sets a poor example for children, who are naturally curious and likely to mimic adult behavior. Additionally, the health of elderly patrons, especially those with heart and lung conditions, can be compromised by secondhand smoke. Pregnant women face the greatest risks, as exposure to contaminated air can adversely affect fetal development.Lastly, passive smokers face significant health risks. Being near active smokers exposes them to dangerous smoke, which can lead to serious illnesses such as strokes, heart disease, hearing loss, and various forms of cancer. It is particularly unjust for non-smokers who do not smoke yet face similar health threats.In conclusion, smoking should be prohibited in restaurants to protect the well-being of all patrons. Laws against smoking in public spaces must be enforced, allowing restaurant management to implement clear policies, ensuring that everyone has the right to enjoy their meals in a smoke-free environment.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Growing violence in films has affected youngsters in a negative way?
human: It's obvious that violent behavior is growing more in films in recent 20 years. This matter has been considered as a way to advertise a film. From my point of view, I believe that violence in movies has negative effects on youngsters mostly on their behaviors, emotions & study.In the first place, children behaviors are the most concerning matter which parents are always trying to do their best. Nowadays children are more involved in TV programs. Imagine an actor who is a child’s favorite is doing violent roles. In this case, the child would imitate the actor's behaviors in order to look like to him. Thus, unexpectedly the violent behavior has effected on child’s behaviors.Meanwhile, human beings are very sensitive, especially of youngsters. For instance, dying is always a disappointing happening. Furthermore, killing is worse. Therefore, if these scenes are in TV, they would probably have their negative effects on the viewer who could be a child.Finally, beside all above mentioned items, the study of youngsters shall always been controlled. For example, a child watches a frightening movie. On the other hand, he has to study for the exam. In this condition, because he is thinking about the movie or whatever has happened in it, it is obvious that he wouldn’t be able to concentrate on his study perfectly. Hence, the study of a youngster would affected terribly.In conclusion, I certainly can say that growing of violence in films have definitely negative effects on youngsters mostly on their study, emotions and behaviors. Therefore, I think this matter should be controlled by parents or somehow by directors.
llm: It is evident that violent behavior has increased in films over the past 20 years, often used as a marketing tool. From my perspective, this rise in on-screen violence has detrimental effects on young people, particularly regarding their behavior, emotions, and academic performance.First and foremost, children's behavior is a significant concern for parents, who strive to guide their children's development. Today, children are heavily influenced by television programming. When a beloved child actor portrays violent roles, young viewers may mimic that behavior in an attempt to emulate their favorite star. Consequently, exposure to violence in media can negatively impact a child's behavior.Moreover, young people are particularly sensitive to emotional stimuli. For instance, death is an inherently upsetting topic and depictions of murder are even more distressing. When such scenes appear on screen, they can adversely affect viewers, potentially leading to emotional issues in children.Lastly, it is crucial to monitor the academic engagement of young individuals. For example, if a child watches a frightening film, they may struggle to focus on their studies, especially if they are preoccupied with thoughts of the movie. This distraction can severely hinder their ability to concentrate and perform well academically.In conclusion, I firmly believe that the increase in violence portrayed in films has significantly negative effects on young people, affecting their behavior, emotions, and academic pursuits. Therefore, I think it is essential for parents and filmmakers to take responsibility in managing this issue.

question: Agree or disagree: In order to be well-informed, a person must get information from many different news sources.
human: Nowadays information plays an important role in our world. It has become a product, which can be sold, bought, or stolen. Some people say: "information is power". That's why it is so important to be well-informed. I consider the statement above to be right for several reasons.The first reason is that by using different sources of information we can guarantee its reliability. Some people may disinform you on purpose, that's why it is rather unwise to make conclusions before you are confident of the information. For example, Russian news announced that the war between Osetia and Georgia had been initiated by Georgia, however, european news announced that it was initiated by Russia. After a while the situation became clear, but before that a lot of people had already condemned the actions of Russia.Secondly, it is very important to know facts about some events or problem, not only estimations, because it can help you to make your own conclusion or estimate. Sometimes it can be really difficult to find out the facts, especially in the internet, that's why you have to look through different sources before you manage to find some reliable facts. It is possible to make a wrong decision because you have just used someone's personal opinion as a source of information, but it was actually wrong. For example, several years ago in Moscow salt became two times more expensive only in one week, because people thought that soon there would be no salt in the shops. The gossip-based information dramatically influenced the prices and only after official announcement the "salt-panic" was over. To conclude, I want to say that it is very important to be confident of the information, which you use, especially when your conclusion or decision may have a great influence.
llm: In today’s world, information holds significant importance. It has transformed into a commodity that can be sold, purchased, or even stolen. Many assert that "information is power," which underscores the necessity of being well-informed. I believe this assertion is valid for several reasons.Firstly, utilizing a variety of information sources can help ensure the accuracy of the information. Some individuals may deliberately provide misleading information, making it unwise to draw conclusions prematurely. For instance, Russian media reported that the conflict between Ossetia and Georgia was instigated by Georgia, while European outlets claimed Russia was the aggressor. Although clarity emerged later, many people had already condemned Russia's actions based on initial reports.Secondly, it is crucial to distinguish factual information from mere opinions regarding events or issues, as this distinction can aid in forming your own conclusions. Finding reliable facts can be challenging, particularly online, so it is essential to consult multiple sources before arriving at any conclusions. Relying on someone's subjective viewpoint can lead to incorrect decisions. A notable example is when the price of salt in Moscow doubled within a week due to rumors that it would soon be unavailable in stores. This rumor-driven panic drastically affected prices until officials issued clarifying statements to dispel the uncertainty.In conclusion, it is vital to verify the information you use, especially when your conclusions or decisions carry significant consequences.

question: Some people argue that there is no point in persevering old buildings when land is so valuable in our cities. Others believe that old buildings are important part of our heritage and should be preserved. Discuss both these views and state your opinion.
human: The preservation of old buildings always is a large question for governments because conflict between the issues of housing for citizens and the protection of our culture. In my opinion, all of the old building which contribute to our sense of culture should be conserved.There are different reasons which persuade that people should not restore old buildings. As a result of the rapid urbanization process, in which rural people must go to urban centers to look for job opportunities, the question of the preservation of old buildings has become more pressing. Because of that need, governments can construct more accommodation instead of preserving old buildings. Besides that, the preservation is very expensive because all components of old buildings have historical values. Old buildings are an essential part of history. Tourist often decide to discover the culture of a country when they visit through those old buildings. Therefore, managers of cities can earn more money from the attraction provided by old buildings and that amount can be spent on their conservation. Furthermore, the preservation of old buildings is also a ways to conserve our culture and everyone can learn much from them. Old buildings should be used as the culture museums and provide accommodation with more convenient for people who live there. . Many cities have development strategies as a city contains both unique and modern beauty, and that preservation help to finish half of work.	Overall, both of those view have strong arguments: the need for housing or the expense of restoration contrast with our desire to conserve culture and attract tourism. So I think we should restore those building because old buildings process the most outstanding feature of areas which contain them.
llm: The preservation of historical buildings poses a significant challenge for governments, as they must balance the need for housing with the desire to protect cultural heritage. In my view, all buildings that contribute to our cultural identity should be preserved. There are several compelling reasons against restoring old buildings. The rapid urbanization caused by rural populations migrating to cities in search of job opportunities has intensified the urgency for housing solutions. Consequently, governments often prioritize constructing new accommodations over maintaining older structures. Moreover, the costs associated with preserving these buildings can be quite high due to the historical significance of their components.Historical buildings play a crucial role in our collective past. Tourists frequently choose to explore a country’s culture through its ancient architecture, meaning that cities can benefit financially from the tourism these sites attract. The revenue generated can then be reinvested into their preservation. Additionally, maintaining old structures serves as a means of safeguarding our cultural heritage, providing valuable learning experiences for everyone. Old buildings can also function as cultural museums while offering more suitable housing options for residents. Many cities aim for development strategies that blend unique historical charm with modern amenities, and preserving these buildings is a key part of achieving that goal.In conclusion, both perspectives present strong arguments: the need for housing and the costs of restoration stand in contrast to our desire to uphold cultural heritage and encourage tourism. Nevertheless, I believe we should commit to restoring these buildings, as they represent the most distinctive features of the areas in which they reside.

question: Nowadays, many young people say that mobile phones are the most important thing in their life. Do you think the popularity of mobile phones to young people is a good or bad development? Give relevant examples from your own experience.
human: Nowadays, many young people consider mobile phone as the most important thing in their lives as it keeps them constantly organized and it provides much convenience for them to reach out their families and friends. Despite all these positive aspects, I think that the popularity of mobile phones to the young generation is a bad development.First of all, many young owners of cellular phones are struggling at school because they are distracted most of the time with their phones. Games and applications installed in phones have occupied much of their time, leaving them lesser time for their studies and other school activities. Similarly, internet capable phones help influence the young ones to become more interested in chatting and social sites rather than doing school works. In my college days, I was once addicted to a certain game on my cellular phone. I have spent most of my time trying to reach a higher level to show-off to my friends. That goal has led me to my lost in interest on doing my homework and I ended up failing one subject in that semester.Secondly, juveniles who possess mobile phones have great tendencies to become materialistic. They would not only purchase a phone because of its functionality but also for its brand. Relatively, these do not come at a significant and inexpensive cost. Furthermore, most of these juveniles are students so they would need their parents to support them financially for what they want. An illustration of this unfortunate trend can be seen almost everywhere these days, wherein most teens at an early age own phones which are worth twice the salary of their parents. This clearly shows that the negative impacts brought about by mobile phones are harmful to a person’s education and character. Therefore, I highly discourage the young ones to be overly dependent on mobile phones.
llm: In today's world, many young individuals view their mobile phones as the most essential aspect of their lives, as these devices help them stay organized and easily connect with family and friends. However, despite these advantages, I believe that the widespread use of mobile phones among the younger generation is detrimental.Firstly, numerous young phone users face challenges in their academic pursuits due to constant distractions from their devices. The games and applications they engage with consume significant amounts of their time, leaving them with insufficient opportunity for studying and participating in other educational activities. Moreover, internet-enabled phones divert young people's attention towards social media and messaging platforms, rather than focusing on their schoolwork. During my college years, I experienced a similar situation when I became addicted to a mobile game. I invested countless hours trying to achieve higher scores to impress my peers, which ultimately resulted in a lack of interest in completing my assignments and led to me failing a subject that semester.Additionally, young people who own mobile phones often exhibit materialistic tendencies. They are not only motivated by the functionality of a phone but also by its brand, leading to the purchase of expensive models that may not fit a student's budget. This trend is concerning, as many of these young individuals rely on their parents for financial support. It is increasingly common to see teenagers with phones that cost significantly more than their parents' monthly salaries.Overall, the negative consequences of mobile phone usage can adversely affect both a young person's education and character development. For these reasons, I strongly advise young individuals to avoid excessive reliance on mobile phones.

question: Some people believe that there should be fixed punishments for each type of crime. Others, however,argue that the circumstances of an individual crime, and the motivation for committing it, should always be taken into account when deciding on the punishment.
human: Generally reason behind punishment is to reduce the crime from a nation and to build a fear in the mind of offenders. Some people think that it does not matter what is reason behind committing a crime therefore there should be fixed punishment for a specific crime. Alternatively I believe that it should taken into consideration the situation and conditions, that forces to a person to be a criminal.First of all if there will be a fixed punishment for each type of crime then it will lead to increase the crime because the punishment will be clear in the mind of professional criminals and they will not feel fear while committing a crime. Secondly, laws and rules are there for people therefore it is necessary to have a look behind crime for instance "a women steals feed for her child should be treated same as a women, who steals for her drug addiction". The person who committed crime first time and the professional criminals should not be imprisoned at same place.On the contrary, fixed punishment will reduce the time taken by judges to give their judgement and it will be effective economically for the Government. Everyone should be treated equally because sometimes we see that a poor person who do not have much money for hiring a good lawyer they get imprisoned even without committing a crime and when they come back to the society they become a professional criminal. Therefore fixed punishment will reduce the space between poor and rich people and everyone will understand the importance of each other.To conclude, Government should decide for punishment case by case basis. In doing so crime can be eliminated from a nation and it is a responsibility of every individual to be in the favor of truth and respect the laws of our constitution.
llm: The primary purpose of punishment is to deter crime within a nation and instill fear in potential offenders. Some argue that the reasons behind committing a crime are irrelevant, advocating for fixed punishments for specific offenses. However, I believe that the circumstances and factors leading an individual to commit a crime should be taken into account.Firstly, implementing fixed punishments for each type of crime may actually lead to an increase in crime rates. Professional criminals would be aware of the consequences and may not feel deterred by the prospect of punishment. Secondly, laws exist for the protection of society, and it's crucial to consider the context of each crime. For instance, a woman who steals food to feed her child should not be treated the same as a woman who steals to support a drug addiction. First-time offenders and repeat criminals should not be imprisoned in the same environment.On the other hand, fixed punishments could streamline the judicial process and potentially be more cost-effective for the government. However, it is essential to ensure that everyone is treated fairly. Often, those from lower socioeconomic backgrounds may lack the resources to hire competent legal representation, leading to unjust imprisonment and, upon release, a higher likelihood of becoming repeat offenders. Establishing fixed punishments could widen the gap between the wealthy and the poor, failing to acknowledge the value of every individual.In conclusion, the government should determine punishments on a case-by-case basis. This approach could help reduce crime in society and underscores the shared responsibility of all individuals to uphold truth and respect the laws of our constitution.
