During this time, I not only learned how to work on projects but also had the opportunity to meet notable artists in the field. Most importantly, this involvement has enhanced my resume, improving my chances of securing a desirable job.Moreover, groups and organizations can motivate individuals to take action and accomplish their goals. For example, various charities around the world exemplify this concept. Tzu Chi, a non-profit Buddhist organization in Taiwan, is renowned for its contributions to community service and healthcare. Their generous spirit inspires hope and mobilizes volunteers and sponsors to undertake significant tasks. As a result, they illuminate the lives of the poor and marginalized, while also enabling individuals from diverse backgrounds to assist those in need globally.In light of these reasons and examples, it is evident that groups and organizations play a crucial role in various aspects of our lives, transcending age and background.

question: The government has announced that it plans to build a new university. Some people think that your community would be a good place to locate the university. Compare the advantages and disadvantages of establishing a new university in your community. Use specific details in your discussion
human: I will be happy to hear that the government has a plan to build a new university in my community. There are many advantages setting up the university such as more opportunities to people in the community to pursue their studies, creation of jobs. However, they come together with some disadvantages such as social problems.This new university will allow a great number of people in my community to have a chance to study. For example, suppose you live in a faraway community where there is no single university and you might not want to leave your family. If you would like to attend a business school, you have to travel across the country to get to a distant university. He or she definitely can get in the business school in the proposed community's university.Undoubtedly, the university will have to hire professors, employees and etc. Thus, a number vacant positions need to be filled. Also there will be more opportunities to work in the community. Moreover, when people have jobs, they will have money to spend on goods and services. This can also help stimulate the local economy. However, building the university may lead to some social problems. A number of people then may come from any other communities in order to get in to or get the jobs at the university. When many people congregate in one place, I think that some kinds of social problems will follow. Traffic may worsen. More wastes have to be managed. Maybe crime rate will also increase. These social problems may impair the quality of life in the community. In sum, I myself agree with the plan to build the university. I believe the benefit from it will outweigh the cost. However, it would be indispensable that the government conduct a survey about the community opinion on the new university first.
llm: I am excited to learn that the government plans to establish a new university in my community. This initiative presents several benefits, such as increasing educational opportunities for local residents and creating jobs. However, it may also lead to some social challenges.The new university will provide many members of our community the opportunity to pursue their education without having to travel long distances. For instance, someone living in a remote area with no nearby universities may be reluctant to leave their family to attend school elsewhere. Now, with a university in our community, they can enroll in a local business program without the hassle of traveling across the country.Additionally, the university will need to hire faculty and staff, leading to numerous job openings. This influx of available positions will stimulate job growth within the community as well. When people gain employment, they are more likely to spend money on goods and services, which can further boost the local economy.On the downside, the construction of the university might also give rise to some social issues. Many individuals from other areas may relocate in search of educational opportunities or jobs at the university. An increased population can lead to challenges such as heightened traffic congestion, greater waste management needs, and potentially rising crime rates. These factors could negatively impact the quality of life for existing residents.In conclusion, I support the plan to build the university, as I believe the benefits will outweigh the drawbacks. However, it is essential for the government to conduct a survey to gauge the community's opinion regarding the new university before moving forward with the project.

question: While some pelple believe that the government should provide a college education free to any citizen who wants it, others beleve that it is up to the individual to finance his/her own education.Ê
human: Some people believe that the government should cover the college tuitions and expenses for any citizen who wants to go to a college. However, I believe that individuals should pay their college tuition because it would cost too much, the college education is a personal's choice, and there are many ways to fund a college education. First, making college education free would cost too much. It would divert public funds from other needs such as law enforcement, infrastructure and so forth. There are many other needs which should come first, such as providing health care to all American, or improving public schools. In addition, it would cause to raise our taxes again and again to fund college education. Consequently, it would affect all taxpayers whether or not they benefit from the use of the funds. Second, it is a personal choice to go to a college. Not everyone wants to go to a college. People who want to make more money, and live a better life than other people decide to take a college education. Therefore, those people should make the financial investment in their own choice; not the government.Third, there are many ways to fund a college education. People who cannot afford to pay their tuition benefit from the scholarship, financial aids, and other funds. In addition, the government already helps pay college expense through indirect means. They often provide services such as fire departments, medical assistance, and police protection for the schools and their students. They also provide funds for academic research. While the money is not given to individual students, these contributions are not trivial. In short, the individual should finance his or her education because it is a personal choice. Otherwise, it would cause too much cost from taxpayers and the government.
llm: Some individuals argue that the government ought to cover college tuition and expenses for any citizen who wishes to pursue higher education. However, I contend that individuals should bear the responsibility of paying for their own college tuition due to the high costs involved, the personal nature of the decision to attend college, and the availability of alternative funding options.To begin with, making college education free for all would impose significant financial burdens. It would redirect public funds away from essential services such as law enforcement and infrastructure. There are several pressing needs that should take precedence, such as providing healthcare for all Americans and enhancing public schools. Furthermore, this initiative would likely lead to repeated tax increases to support college education funding, affecting all taxpayers regardless of whether they benefit from it.Secondly, attending college is a personal decision. Not everyone aspires to higher education; it is those who seek to enhance their earning potential and improve their quality of life who opt for a college degree. Therefore, it is appropriate for these individuals to invest in their own educational choices rather than relying on government support.Lastly, there are numerous avenues available for financing a college education. Those unable to afford tuition can access scholarships, financial aid, and various funding sources. Moreover, the government already contributes indirectly to college expenses, providing essential services such as fire and police protection, medical assistance, and funding for academic research. While such funds are not distributed directly to students, these contributions are still significant.In conclusion, individuals should take responsibility for financing their own education, as it represents a personal choice. Relying on the government for this funding would impose unnecessary costs on taxpayers and the broader community.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
human: We all know that television provides us many benefits; it helps people relax, helps keep up with news, helps broad our mind. However, have you ever thought that television has destroyed communication among friends and family? I personally consider this fact as the harmful thing that television has brought upon us.First of all, since people watch television too much, they can be isolated from others. Children, for example, pay more attention on movies, music show provided by television and do not want to do anything else such as going to school or practicing exercise with friends will be taken apart by others. Gradually, their friends leave them behind either activities or studying.Secondly, with the rapid change of the standard of life, each family has three or four TV in each room is more common. Parents and even children do not want to communicate with each other instead of watching TV in their own room. As a consequence, children will learn behavior from what they see on TV not from their parents. Moreover, parents are not able to function their parental care as the necessary thing to children. In this way, communication between family members is visibly destroyed.Last but not least, watching too much television people will unconsciously learn bad behavior that sow division among human. For example, watching film about terrorist children will be able to consider terrorism as a right thing. What happens if they do act exactly the terrorist in Hollywood movies does? is this one of the reason cause division in society?In conclusion, though television has some good sides, it has destroyed communication among friends and family. We need to quickly find the way to address this problem as soon as possible and the first concern is to reducing violent behaviors that children learn from television.
llm: Television offers numerous benefits, such as relaxation, staying informed about current events, and expanding our knowledge. However, have you ever considered how television might be undermining communication among friends and family? I believe this to be one of the most damaging impacts of television.Firstly, excessive television consumption can lead to social isolation. For instance, children often become engrossed in movies and music shows, neglecting school and time spent exercising or socializing with friends. As a result, they may gradually drift apart from their peers both academically and socially.Secondly, as families acquire multiple televisions—often having three or four in a single household—communication suffers. Parents and children tend to retreat into their own rooms to watch TV rather than engaging in meaningful conversations. Consequently, children may form their behaviors by absorbing what they see on screen, rather than learning from their parents. This dynamic significantly diminishes interaction within the family.Finally, prolonged television viewing can lead individuals to unconsciously adopt negative behaviors that foster discord. For example, children exposed to films depicting terrorism might begin to view such actions as acceptable. What if they were to mimic the actions of the terrorists depicted in Hollywood movies? Could this be a contributing factor to societal division?In conclusion, while television has its advantages, it has also eroded communication among friends and family. It is imperative that we address this issue promptly, with a primary focus on mitigating the violent behaviors that children are exposed to through television.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Attending a live performance (a play, concert, sporting event, etc) is more enjoyable than watching the same event on television. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
human: Have you ever traveled along to support your home football team during tournaments? Have you attended at a stadium to watch your team's match, yell or even cry with the team and their thousands of fans there? If you have a great love with football and your home team, it is much more gratifying to stay side by side and cheer up the team at the stadium rather than just to stay at home and watch the match alone.First, attending a live football match is very fulfilling. Before the match starts, thousands of fans gathering outside of the stadium with team flags, colorful outfits, sound of trumpets and rattles... everywhere. As the game kicks off, the atmosphere inside the stadium is even more exciting. You are watching football stars play the game with your own eyes and sharing your feelings with about 40,000 people at the stadium, such an excitement you can never have when you are watching it at home. Everybody yells and sings together, the stadium is like bursted out whenever a goal is scored. See, you will be bored if you are watching it alone.Second, watching a live football game is an exceptional experience. You can watch it at home, but "easy come, easy go", you will quickly forget it, like a movie. The tickets to get in the stadium may be a little expensive, but you will gain much more entertainment value from the game. You can cherish your experience for a long time. Furthermore, it can be an exclusive experience. If it is a crucial win to acclaim a trophy, you will be "on site" to witness and celebrate the victory.In conclusion, watch a football match on television it is comfortable and pleasing, but watching the match live at the stadium is more enjoyable. It can be unforgettable moments in your life.
llm: Have you ever traveled to support your home football team during tournaments? Have you been in a stadium, cheering, yelling, or even crying alongside thousands of fellow fans? If you have a deep passion for football and your local team, there's nothing quite like being present in the stadium to cheer them on, rather than simply watching from home.Firstly, attending a live football match is an incredibly fulfilling experience. Before the game starts, you can feel the energy outside the stadium, with thousands of fans waving team flags, wearing vibrant outfits, and making music with trumpets and rattles. Once the match begins, the excitement inside the stadium skyrockets. You get to watch football stars play right in front of you and share that thrill with around 40,000 people. The energy is electric, far surpassing the experience of watching from home. When a goal is scored, the collective roar of celebration makes the stadium feel alive. Watching alone just doesn't compare.Secondly, being at a live football game is a unique experience. While you can catch the game on TV, it lacks the depth of emotion that comes with being there in person. Sure, tickets can be a bit pricey, but the entertainment value you receive is well worth it. You'll create memories that will last a lifetime. Additionally, if your team wins a crucial match and claims a trophy, you can celebrate that victory right there in the moment.In conclusion, while watching a football match on television is comfortable and enjoyable, experiencing it live in the stadium offers a level of joy that is truly unmatched. It can create unforgettable moments that you'll cherish for years to come.

question: Renewable resources of energy (Sun, wind, water) will soon replace fossils fuels such as gases, oil, and coal. Do you agree or disagree?
human: Although renewable resources of energy are elements of the current and future energy strategy, as far as I'm concerned, these new forms of energy cannot soon replace fossil fuels such as gases, oil, and coal.Firstly, due to the limitation of technology renewable resources are relatively expensive. Researches in renewable energy cost a huge amount of money which developing countries cannot afford. On the other hand, fossil fuels are abundant and inexpensive in many areas. For example, it is estimated that China has the largest deposit of coal in the world and the government does not want to invest too much money on new forms of energy, say expensive solar batteries and wind farms. Thus the plan of renewable resources of energy may face challenges in that not every country can afford the reforming.Besides, although utility companies claim that renewable energy is environmentally friendly; these new forms of energy may not be as clean and green as we think. Latest studies have shown that these renewable resources of energy are problematic as well and they are very likely to pose long-term environmental hazards. For example, the dams built for hydroelectricity influence the water flows of the rivers and sometimes cause drought in areas in front of the dams. This damages the habitats of many valuable fish and wading birds. More importantly, the accumulation of heavy metal in the silt on the bottom of the rivers behind the dams is extremely difficult and expensive to clean up; leaving problems for the following generations. Thus renewable resources are not as reliable as we think.Admittedly contemporarily fossil fuels cause serious environmental conundrums such as acid rain, deduction of ozone layer and global warming; these problems can be solved by improving efficiency of the mechanism and reducing emissions. For example we can use chemicals to desulfurize the emissions from plants and vehicles to avoid acid rain. These improving methods are often cheaper and simpler compared to the high-tech of renewable energy. With these solutions fossil fuels seem more sustainable.In conclusion as promising as renewable resources of energy sound, there is no way those new forms of energy will replace fossil fuels soon.
llm: While renewable energy resources play a crucial role in both current and future energy strategies, I believe that they are unlikely to replace fossil fuels such as natural gas, oil, and coal in the near future.To begin with, the technology surrounding renewable energy remains relatively expensive, making it challenging for developing countries to invest in. The costs associated with research and development in this field can be prohibitively high. In contrast, fossil fuels are often abundant and more affordable in various regions. For instance, China has the largest coal reserves globally, and the government is hesitant to allocate significant funds to new energy sources like pricey solar panels and wind farms. Consequently, the shift to renewable energy may encounter obstacles, particularly in nations with limited financial resources.Additionally, despite claims from utility companies that renewable energy is environmentally friendly, these energy sources may not be as clean as they are portrayed. Recent studies have highlighted potential long-term environmental risks associated with them. For example, hydroelectric dams can disrupt river ecosystems, leading to droughts in nearby areas and harming fish and bird habitats. Moreover, the buildup of heavy metals in the sediment behind these dams poses significant cleanup challenges, burdening future generations with ongoing environmental issues. This raises concerns about the reliability of renewable energy solutions.While it's true that fossil fuels contribute to serious environmental issues such as acid rain, ozone depletion, and global warming, many of these challenges can be addressed through improved efficiencies and emission reduction strategies. For instance, using chemicals to desulfurize emissions from power plants and vehicles can mitigate acid rain, and these methods are often more cost-effective and easier to implement than the advanced technologies required for renewable energy. As a result, fossil fuels may appear to be more sustainable in the short term.In summary, despite the optimism surrounding renewable energy, it is unlikely that these new sources will replace fossil fuels anytime soon.

question: Some people think that human needs for farmland, housing and industry are more important than saving land for endangered animals. Do you agree or disagree this point of view? Why or why not. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Nowadays, there is a prevailing opinion that human needs for farmland, housing and industry are more important than saving land for endangered animals. People who disagree with the point dispute that the decreasing of land for endangered animals will bring damage to ecological balance. As far as I am concerned, I agree with the opinion human needs for farmland, housing and industry are more important. The reasons are based on the following aspects.First, land used for farmland, housing and industry can benefit more to the whole society. There is no deny that the economy of the whole society will be developed with the help of agriculture, real estate industry and industry, in particularly industry which is the pillar industry of national economy, because they produce plenty of profits. What is more, the society will be stable and harmony due to more farmland and industry. It is widely acknowledged that more farmlands and industries can provide more job opportunities which can decrease the unemployment rate and crime rate. Thus the needs for farmland, housing and industry are more important.Second, farmland, housing and industry can satisfy the desire of human that living a better life. It is clearly understood that farming, housing and industry provide us the food we eat, place we live, clothes we wear, which are essential to live. Especially in some poor areas, survival is the most significant thing. In addition, highly developed agriculture and industry can improve our living conditions which allow us have a good quality life. Last I want to mention is that even though farmland, housing and industry will occupy the land used for endangered animals, it can do good to protect the endangered animals. According to the discuss above, agriculture and industry make a contribution to the economy. With the economy development, we can have more advanced methods to take care of endangered animals. For instant, we can invent new technique to help endangered animals to produce offspring to be sure they would not distinct.All in all, protecting endangered animals is necessary, nevertheless, human needs for farmland, housing and industry are more important.
llm: In today’s society, there is a widespread belief that human needs for farmland, housing, and industry take precedence over the preservation of land for endangered species. Critics of this perspective argue that reducing habitat for these animals could disrupt ecological balance. However, I personally align with the view that human demands for farmland, housing, and industry are paramount. Here are my reasons.First and foremost, land dedicated to agriculture, housing, and industry offers significant benefits to society as a whole. There is no doubt that these sectors—particularly industry, which serves as the backbone of the national economy—drive economic growth and generate substantial profits. Furthermore, an increase in farmland and industrial activity fosters social stability and harmony by creating more job opportunities, ultimately lowering both unemployment and crime rates. Thus, prioritizing farmland, housing, and industry is essential.Additionally, the development of farmland, housing, and industry directly fulfills our basic needs for a better quality of life. These sectors provide the food we eat, the homes we inhabit, and the clothing we wear—all of which are fundamental for survival. This is especially true in impoverished areas where meeting basic survival needs is of utmost importance. Moreover, advancements in agriculture and industry can enhance living conditions and improve overall quality of life.Lastly, I would like to point out that while farmland, housing, and industry may encroach upon habitats for endangered species, such developments can also lead to better conservation efforts. A stronger economy allows us to invest in advanced methods to protect endangered animals. For instance, new technologies can be developed to help these species reproduce, ensuring their survival instead of extinction.In conclusion, while the preservation of endangered species is important, the human need for farmland, housing, and industry is ultimately more critical.

question: Some people think that learning a foreign language in its original country is more beneficial than learning the language in a countr with another language. Do you agree or disagree?
human: Although there are some advantages to learning a foreign language in its original country, I firmly believe that people who learn a foreign language in the country in which it is spoken have a deeper understanding of different language skills than those who learn the same languages in their own countries.Person 'A' who learns a non-native language in his country may receive benefit from a step-by-step teaching method. In other words, he is not jumping into the foreign country. Therefore he can set aside enough time and energy dedicated to learning the language. Besides, all the learners are probably from the same country, so all these people most likely have learned the language, more or less, in the same way.On the other hand, when a new learner wants to learn a new language in the country in which it is spoken, he has the opportunity to communicate with natives. He may find native friends and may participate in groups where members are people from the foreign country. No doubt, it leads to better understanding of language essential skills. He also has access to the most up-to-date language. Thus he can learn most useful idioms, proverbs and so many other things which the former person, person 'A', does not have access to.On the whole, if I wanted to learn a new language and had enough money to afford the travel, I would definitely make the second choice. There are lots of evidences show that communication is the most important factor in learning a new language. When you are exposed to an environment where everybody talks to you in the new language you want to learn and expects you express words from the same language, you are forced to learn it as soon and good as possible.In a word, although each of these methods have their pros and cons, I am pretty sure that advantages of learning language in the country in which is spoken outweigh the advantages of the other way of learning of a new language.
llm: While there are certain benefits to learning a foreign language in one's home country, I strongly believe that individuals who study a language in the country where it is spoken gain a more profound understanding of various language skills than those who learn it domestically.For instance, a person in country 'A' learning a non-native language might benefit from a structured, step-by-step teaching method. This setting allows them to gradually immerse themselves in the language without the pressures of being in a foreign environment. They can allocate sufficient time and effort to mastering the language, and since other learners are likely from the same background, they probably adhere to a similar learning approach.In contrast, a learner who chooses to study the language in the country where it is spoken has the unique advantage of direct interaction with native speakers. They can forge friendships with locals and engage in groups that include people from the host culture. This experience undoubtedly enhances their grasp of essential language skills. Additionally, they gain access to contemporary expressions, idioms, proverbs, and cultural nuances that the learner in country 'A' may not encounter.Overall, if I were to learn a new language and had the financial means to travel, I would definitely opt for the second approach. Numerous studies indicate that communication is a crucial factor in language acquisition. Immersing oneself in an environment where everyone communicates in the target language and expects the learner to respond in kind compels rapid and effective learning.In summary, while both methods of language learning offer their own advantages and disadvantages, I am convinced that the benefits of studying a language in its country of origin significantly outweigh those of learning it in one's home country.

question: Some people say that physical exercise should be required part of every school day. Other people believe that students should spend the whole school day on academic studies. Which opinion do you agree with?
human: Although some people believe that students should spend the whole day on academic studies, I nevertheless believe that physical exercise is a crucial part of every school day. Exercise is good not only for having a good health body, but also for the mind. In addition, including exercise in children's daily routine, it is a good way to teach them the importance of physical activity from an early age.Physical activity helps children to grow up physically healthier. As studies have shown that the rate of obesity in children has increased every year, it will be very beneficial for children to have a daily physical activity and get a break from being sitting several hours at school. In addition, exercise will help them to not be less exposed to illness related with cardiovascular, higher blood and cholesterol issues.Daily exercise will help also to develop children's brain function. It is well known how important it is to exercise regularly to help the body system to work better. When people exercise, the respiratory system's function is enhanced, helping all organs, including the brain, to get more oxygen in. Daily exercise will provide children with a mental break which will boost them to be efficient learners.Having children in the daily exercise routine from an early age will teach them the important value of having physical activity in their every day routine. Children are bombarded with lectures about nutrition and physical activity; however, they will be more beneficed if that knowledge can be put in practice. Moreover, they can stick with the routine and make the daily physical activities a good habit on their whole life. Including physical activity in children's school day should be strongly considered. It will meliorate not only mental and body health, but also will establish in children a habit of doing it, giving them the opportunity to measure the worth of including such an important activity in their daily live schedules.
llm: While some may argue that students should dedicate their entire day to academic studies, I firmly believe that physical exercise is an essential component of each school day. Exercise is beneficial not just for maintaining physical health but also for enhancing mental well-being. Moreover, incorporating physical activity into children's daily routines is an effective way to instill the value of exercise from a young age.Engaging in physical activity enables children to develop healthier physiques. Given the rising trend of childhood obesity, having regular exercise can be extremely advantageous for children, providing them with necessary breaks from long periods of sitting in class. Furthermore, consistent physical activity can reduce their risk of illnesses associated with cardiovascular problems, high blood pressure, and elevated cholesterol levels.Regular exercise also plays a critical role in enhancing children's cognitive function. It is well-documented that exercising regularly improves overall bodily function. When individuals engage in physical activity, their respiratory systems work more efficiently, ensuring that all organs, including the brain, receive adequate oxygen. This mental break provided by daily exercise can significantly boost children’s learning effectiveness.Instilling a routine of daily exercise in children from an early age teaches them the vital importance of incorporating physical activity into their lives. Although children often receive lectures on nutrition and exercise, they are likely to benefit more when they can put that knowledge into practice. Establishing such routines early on can transform physical activity into a lifelong habit.Incorporating physical activity into children's school days should be given serious consideration. It will enhance both their mental and physical health while fostering a habit that allows them to appreciate the significance of including this vital activity in their daily lives.

question: In some countries, teenagers have jobs while they are still students. Do you think is a good idea? Support your opinion with specific details.
human: In my opinion, it is not the good idea for teenagers to have job while they are still students. Although, many argue that it provide good working experience, but I think it can interfere with their life in various ways. Having jobs would affect the health of the student. It divert their mind from studies and would take away their childhood phase from their life.A student has to do lots of studies in today's competitive world to prove himself. He has to spend his most of time in school to get a good grades. If the student get involved himself in job in rest of the time, then it would cause an extra burden on them. Furthermore, jobs has various responsibilities like attendance, sometimes extra work and so on. This would result in stress, tension and tiredness. They won't be able to get proper time for relaxation, sleep. Thus, would affect their mental and physical health.Another reason, jobs can divert students from their studies. If students started earning in earlier age in their life, then they get attracted towards money. They feel themselves independent and would prefer to work more for money. This would affect their studies, they loose their interest from studies. Moreover, they drop out their studies so as to earn more money.In addition to this, the main drawback of teenagers job is that, they miss out the fun of their childhood time. He would miss various childhood activities such as hang out with friends, clubs and fun activities and social interaction with others. They have whole life to do job and prove themselves, but the childhood phase will never return in their life. Therefore, they should take advantage of life as much possible they can.Thus, for a teenager it is important to pay attention on their studies. Having job would affect their health, divert them from studies and take away one of the important phase from their life.
llm: In my view, it is not advisable for teenagers to hold jobs while they are still students. While some may argue that working provides valuable experience, I believe it can disrupt their lives in several significant ways. For one, having a job can negatively impact a student's health. It distracts them from their studies and takes away from their childhood.In today's competitive world, students must dedicate a significant amount of time to their education to excel academically. If they choose to work in their spare time, it can create an unnecessary burden. Jobs come with various responsibilities, such as attendance and sometimes additional tasks, which can lead to increased stress, anxiety, and fatigue. As a result, students may struggle to find adequate time for relaxation and sleep, negatively affecting their mental and physical well-being.Furthermore, working at a young age can shift a student's focus away from their studies. The allure of earning money may lead them to feel independent, causing them to prioritize work over their education. This shift in priorities can result in decreased interest in their studies and even lead to dropping out to pursue financial opportunities.Additionally, one of the most significant drawbacks of teenagers taking on jobs is that they miss out on the joys of childhood. Committing to work can mean forgoing experiences such as hanging out with friends, participating in clubs, and engaging in recreational activities. While there will always be opportunities for career growth in the future, the childhood years are irreplaceable and should be cherished.Therefore, it is crucial for teenagers to concentrate on their education. Balancing a job with academic responsibilities can harm their health, distract them from their studies, and rob them of a vital stage in their lives.

question: Some people believe that zoos serve useful function. Other people believe that it's cruel & wrong to confine animals in zoos. Tell which point of view you are agree with.
human: It has become quite a common hobby of children that they usually spend their free time in zoos. Zoos have been established for ages all over the world and have become interesting places for entertainment. Over the time, there are also a lot of arguments concerning whether zoos are helpful in serving people or they are just some kinds of bad treatments to animals.Some people spot out that humanities benefit so much from zoos. First of all, zoos are fascinating places of entertainment. For this point, they all think that the very nature and wildness are all brought into zoos and spending time there help us to forget all stress as well as pressure. Another function that all zoos serve relates to education. Many students as well as people find zoos as good places for witnessing and researching the true animal world. Moreover, some zoos are also reservation sites of many animals that are about to become extinct.On the other hand, there are, however, people who think that zoos just take away freedom of animals. Being confined, animals may lose their own nature as well as wildness and feel upset and discontented. In their opinion, zoos are some kind of prisons and it's so cruel and wrong to keep animal in such prisons.From my point of view, I agree with the first group. In modern life, zoos have become even more important in serving as places for people to study and enjoy the nature while a lot of natural destruction is made to build towers and skyscrapers. Besides, recently, zookeepers have also tried their best to make animals feel more comfortable by making artificial landscapes more familiar to the nature, taking care all animals in both feeding and sanity.
llm: Spending free time at zoos has become a popular pastime among children. Zoos, established for centuries around the globe, have evolved into engaging entertainment venues. However, there is ongoing debate about whether zoos are beneficial to people or simply a form of poor treatment for animals.Proponents argue that zoos provide significant advantages for humanity. Firstly, they offer a unique form of entertainment, allowing visitors to experience the wonders of nature and wildlife, which helps alleviate stress and pressure. Additionally, zoos serve educational purposes, enabling students and the public to observe and learn about the animal kingdom firsthand. Furthermore, many zoos play a critical role in conservation, housing endangered species and contributing to their protection.Conversely, critics contend that zoos infringe upon the freedom of animals. They argue that confinement can strip animals of their natural instincts and lead to feelings of distress and unhappiness. For them, zoos resemble prisons, and they view it as cruel and unethical to keep animals in such conditions.In my opinion, I align more with the supporters of zoos. In today’s world, where natural habitats are rapidly being destroyed to accommodate urban development, zoos have become increasingly vital as places for people to learn about and appreciate nature. Moreover, many zookeepers are making tremendous efforts to enhance the well-being of animals, creating artificial habitats that mirror their natural environments and ensuring that their care includes proper nutrition and hygiene.

question: Some students prefer to study alone. Others prefer to study with a group of students. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: When I found the chance of studying in a group with my classmates, I wished I can go back in time and took all my exams again. I personally prefer studying in a group due to these noticeable features, getting help from other students, improving my attitude for learning, managing my time in an effective way.When pupils make a group for studying, all member of group have the same chance to help each other. They can work together for understanding the complicated aspect of a course. For example, when a group faces with complex math problem, they can share their opinions to solve it. In addition, such a remarkable effect has incorporation that all students can improve their weak points in a group. Increasing the motivation and competence spirit are another benefit of group-studying. In a group of student, the best of those always encourages others to study harder. Besides, pupils often have a tangible competence in order that they can get the highest grade in a group. Clearly, better learning is one of noticeable result of these competences and encouragements. When the students study with their friends, they should have schedule to use their time in an effective manner. Group-studying causes some kind of internal obligation to manage the time, inasmuch as we always care about other people and we do not want to waste their time. Therefore, time management is another brilliant benefit of group-studying. In conclusion, I strongly prefer studying in a group of my friends because of some important opportunities gaining with this activity. I can receive some helps from other student as well as improving my learning skills, also managing of time is another achievements of group-studying. Now, it is time to start without any regret from my previous exams.
llm: When I had the opportunity to study in a group with my classmates, I found myself wishing I could go back in time and retake all my exams. I am a firm believer in the value of group studying, as it offers several distinct advantages: receiving assistance from peers, enhancing my learning attitude, and managing my time more efficiently.When students form study groups, each member gets an equal opportunity to support one another. This collaborative effort allows them to tackle challenging aspects of a subject together. For instance, when a group encounters a difficult math problem, they can pool their insights to find a solution. Furthermore, studying in a group significantly helps students identify and address their weaknesses.Another key benefit of group studying is the boost in motivation and a spirit of competency. In a group setting, the most driven members inspire others to strive harder. Additionally, students often experience a sense of collective responsibility, pushing them to achieve high grades as a unit. Clearly, improved learning is a notable outcome of this encouragement and camaraderie.To maximize their time, students should establish a schedule when studying together. Group study inherently creates a sense of obligation to manage their time effectively, as everyone is mindful of not wasting each other’s time. Consequently, time management emerges as another significant advantage of studying in a group.In conclusion, I greatly prefer studying with my friends because of the valuable opportunities it provides. I can benefit from the support of my peers while enhancing my learning skills, and I also achieve better time management. Now, it's time to move forward without any regrets about my past exams.

question: Some people prefer to spend time with one or two close friends. Other choose to spend time with a large number of friends. Compare the advantages of each choice. Which of these two ways of spending time do you prefer? Use specific reasons to support your answers.
human: Despite friendship is one of the most important values in a man's life, people might have different preferences: some of them prefer to spend time with one or two close friends, while other prefer to be surrounded by a large number of friends. In my view, I prefer the second attitude.The first reason is that staying in contact with a large number of friends gives the opportunity to learn more from the others' experiences. For instance, among a large number of people there could be someone who practices a particular sport, or plays an instrument or likes traveling very much and from their experiences you can be attracted to try something new that you had never considered before. Of course, while differences give the opportunity to learn, they can also mean that sometimes it can be difficult to reach an agreement. This would not happen or at least would happen rarely if one decides to spend time with one or two close friends. In fact, in this case it is more likely that interests and preferences are the same.Another reason is that a large number of friends can help you to consider all the possible solutions to a problem and to make you more open-minded. For example, if you happen to face a problem and ask them for advice, your friends you will see that issue from their different point of views and accordingly they will help you to consider better all advantages and disadvantages.When you have just few close friends, on one hand you develop a more intimate relationship with them and you feel you can trust them more, but on the other hand they often will give you viewpoints not so different from yours, adding less to your experience.In sum, although each choice - few close friends or a large number of friends - presents its advantages and its weak points, I think that spending time with a large number of friends can add more to one's life.
llm: Although friendship is one of the most valuable aspects of life, individual preferences vary: some people enjoy the company of one or two close friends, while others prefer being surrounded by a larger group. Personally, I lean towards the latter.One compelling reason is that maintaining relationships with a diverse array of friends offers the chance to learn from their unique experiences. For example, among a larger circle, there might be individuals who engage in specific sports, play musical instruments, or have a passion for travel. Their stories and insights can inspire you to explore new interests that you may have never considered.While these differences can facilitate learning, they can also lead to challenges in reaching consensus. This is less likely to occur when spending time with just a couple of close friends, where shared interests and preferences are more common.Additionally, having a wide circle of friends can broaden your perspective when faced with a dilemma. If you seek their advice, you’ll receive diverse viewpoints, enabling you to weigh different advantages and disadvantages more effectively.In contrast, having only a few close friends allows you to build deeper, more intimate relationships where trust flourishes. However, their viewpoints may be quite similar to yours, potentially limiting the growth you could experience.In conclusion, while both options—maintaining a few close friendships or a larger social circle—have their benefits and drawbacks, I believe that spending time with a larger group of friends enriches life more significantly.

question: Should government spend more money on improving roads and highways or should government spend more money on improving public transportation (Buses, trains,subways)?
human: The development of public transportation is the most essential thing for a developed society. Public transportation keeps society from the depletion of natural resources, the air pollution, the loss of a sense of community. So, I think the government have to spend more money on improving it.The use of public transportation is the best way to conserve natural resources gradually run out. Cars depend on oil and gasoline to move. If people use too many private cars, the oil and gasoline nonrenewable will run out quickly. Instead of using many private cars, people can use public transportation, such as bus, train, subway, each one can get far more people and less oil and gasoline are used up per person.The use of public transportation helps in reducing the air pollution. Cars use oil and gasoline and send out gas such as carbon dioxide, heat and so on. They cause pollution and make the Earth warmer. The more cars are driven, the more pollution will be put into air. If we use the public transportation, less cars will be used and less pollution will be emitted. The atmosphere, surrounding us, will be protected and help us more healthy.The use of public transportation make us live more sociable. When we drive a private car, we are alone or only our family members that we already know and lost the opportunity to make friends with others or to see that we are a part of this society. When using public transportation, we have a chance to meet more people and more chances to discovery new aspects of life.Using public transportation has a lot of advantages for the modern society facing a lot of problems: the environmental population, the isolation in life, the depletion of natural resources. So, the government have to invest more for it and encourage people to use.
llm: The advancement of public transportation is crucial for a thriving society. It helps mitigate the depletion of natural resources, reduces air pollution, and fosters a sense of community. Therefore, I believe the government should allocate more funding to enhance public transportation systems.Utilizing public transportation is one of the most effective ways to conserve our dwindling natural resources. Personal vehicles rely on oil and gasoline, which are finite resources. An excessive reliance on private cars can lead to their rapid depletion. In contrast, public transportation options, such as buses, trains, and subways, can transport many more people while consuming significantly less fuel per person.Moreover, public transportation plays a vital role in reducing air pollution. Cars emit harmful gases, including carbon dioxide and other pollutants, contributing to environmental degradation and climate change. As the number of cars on the road increases, so does the level of pollution. By opting for public transportation, we can decrease the number of vehicles on the road and consequently lower emissions, creating a healthier atmosphere for everyone.Additionally, using public transportation encourages social interaction. When we drive alone or with family, we miss opportunities to connect with others and can feel isolated from our communities. Public transportation allows us to meet new people and experience diverse aspects of life, fostering a greater sense of belonging.The benefits of public transportation are significant, especially as modern society grapples with challenges such as environmental degradation, social isolation, and resource depletion. Therefore, it is imperative for the government to invest more in these systems and promote their use among the public.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Animals should be free, people should not keep them in zoos. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Many people state that zoos are a great asset to animals. Others believe that they are inferior creatures and therefore do not deserve our attention. In my opinion, we must help animals live safely and comfortably in their own environment.Many scientific studies have revealed the detriment that zoos have caused to animals. Firstly, like we, human beings, animals are delivered to this world with genetic instincts. Skills which help them live and survive in their residing areas. When we captivate animals and put them to live a style of life that they are unfamiliar with, they begin to loose those in-born instincts. Hence, when they are released or in the worst case, when they escape, they act disorientated and this contributes to the animal mortality rate. In addition to the previous point, various zoos do not have the proper implements or policies that assure the quality of animal care. For instance, I recall my first trip to a zoo, at age eight. I was shocked by the cruelty which animals were treated. I can not think of any staff memeber who did not have an improper behaviour towards the animlas in the zoo. They beat them up because they did not wanted to eat their meals and then excused themselves saying that it was a way to train the animals.In conclusion, I strongly believe that we have to assit animals and provide them the best quality of life possible. Scientific facts showed the damage that zoos can inflict on animals. Moreover, many zoos do not meet the standards of care required for them.
llm: Many individuals argue that zoos serve as valuable resources for animals, while others contend that they are lesser beings and do not warrant our concern. Personally, I believe it is crucial to support animals in living safely and comfortably within their natural habitats.Numerous scientific studies have demonstrated the negative impact zoos have on animals. Firstly, like humans, animals are born with innate instincts that enable them to thrive in their natural environments. When we confine them and impose unfamiliar lifestyles, they begin to lose these instinctual skills. As a result, if they are eventually released or, in unfortunate circumstances, escape, they may struggle to survive, leading to increased mortality rates.Furthermore, many zoos lack the appropriate resources and policies needed to ensure adequate animal care. I recall my first visit to a zoo at the age of eight; I was horrified by the treatment of the animals. I cannot recall a single staff member who acted appropriately toward the animals. Instead, they resorted to physical punishment when the animals refused to eat, justifying it as a form of training.In conclusion, I firmly believe that we must assist animals and ensure they have the highest possible quality of life. Scientific evidence highlights the harm zoos can inflict on them, and many facilities fail to meet the necessary standards of care.

question: A university plans to develop a new research center in your country. Some people want a center for business research. Other people want a center for research in agriculture (farming). Which of these two kinds of research centers do you recommend for your country? Use specific reasons in your recommendation.
human: Most of the universities in the world seek to develop some research in some countries. These researches can be aimed for several fields such as business or agriculture. If a university plans to develop a new research in my country and I have to choose between establishing a centre for business research or a centre for agriculture research, I would opt for the second one.First of all, my country has a lot of land which is useful for the agriculture. Most of these lands are left without any treatment. The centre for research in agriculture can help my co-citizens to better exploit these land. This centre can also help people there to solve their issues related to their land. Especially, if they have no knowledge or education in this field.Secondly, the centre for research in agriculture helps the economy of my country to improve. The agriculture field has only thirty percent as a market part. The centre of research can raise the market part of this field by developing the agriculture products. For example, the dates are the most important agriculture product in my country. The centre of research for agriculture can make some research in how to get a good quality of this product, how to treat the Palme and maybe how to treat the land of the palms.Another reason that makes the centre of research for the agriculture more important than the centre of business research is that the first one can create a lot of jobs. Obviously, showing people how to exploit a land and get good agriculture products will push people to think about working in the field of agriculture rather than working in business or other field to make money. Some people think that a centre of business research is more important because we have to be in parallel with the advanced countries which have focused in business field. For me being a developed country does not mean that we have to focus only in business, but we have to focus on what really bring us to the level of self satisfaction, and the agriculture for our country is the field that can realize that.My country need to focus more on the agriculture by establishing centers for research in this field, which will have some very positive consequences on agriculture people work, on the economy and on the employment.
llm: Many universities worldwide aim to advance research in various countries, focusing on fields such as business and agriculture. If a university were to initiate new research in my country, I would prefer the establishment of a center for agricultural research over one for business research.Firstly, my country possesses vast tracts of land that are underutilized in agriculture. Establishing a research center could empower local citizens to optimize these lands for agriculture. Additionally, it would provide support to those facing challenges related to land management, particularly individuals who lack knowledge or education in this area.Secondly, an agricultural research center could significantly enhance my country's economy. Currently, agriculture accounts for only about thirty percent of our market share. By developing agricultural products through research, this center has the potential to increase that share. For instance, dates are a key agricultural product in my country; research could focus on improving the quality of this crop, effective cultivation practices for date palms, and land management techniques.Moreover, establishing an agricultural research center could generate numerous job opportunities. Educating people on how to cultivate land and produce quality agricultural goods may encourage them to pursue careers in agriculture rather than in business or other sectors.While some argue that a business research center is more critical for keeping pace with advanced countries, I believe that true development should not solely concentrate on business. We should prioritize what genuinely contributes to our sense of fulfillment, and for my country, agriculture is that key area.In conclusion, my country would benefit significantly from investing in agricultural research centers, as they would lead to positive outcomes in agricultural practices, economic improvement, and job creation.

question: People learn in different ways. Some people learn by doing things, other people learn by reading about things, others learn by listening to people talk about things. Which of these methods of learning is best for you? Use specific examples to support your choice.
human: People have a lot of things to learn in their lives. They use several ways to broaden their knowledge and their skills. One of these several ways of learning that I prefer is doing things by my self rather than learning by reading about things or learning by listening to people talking about. There are a lot of reasons to recommend this method for who is serious about learning some thing in their lives.First of all, learning by doing things develops our maturity. When you do things by your self, you learn to depend on yourself. You will not be in need to refer to books or persons. The fact of doing things by ourselves can help us to get some experiences that would strong our maturity. For example if some one wants to learn how to be a leader, they have to experience this by being in a real situation of leading a team or a group, or even a situation. We can not be leaders by reading books or by listening to person talking about leading. Secondly, learning by doing things is more exciting than learning by reading about things or listening to people talking about. There are a lot of things in life that should be learnt by doing them. Reading about things or listening to people talking about can rarely submit the same sensation or the same excitement to some one who wants to learn about the same thing. People who want to learn how to swim have to go to the beach or to the swimpool and laid themselves in the water to feel and know what is swimming. Nor listening to people or reading about can teach them swimming.Another reason that makes learning by doing things more advantageous than learning by reading about things or listening to people talking about is that we find more motivation to continuing on learning by doing things. With the time, Reading about things or listening to people talking about could become more and more boring. Learning by doing things gives us more and more pleasure especially if we success in learning perfectly this things. So we become motivated to learn other things by doing them.The history shows that learning by doing things is the best way and the best method to learn things. People should not depend only on reading or listening to people talking about things to learn. They should try and keep trying until they learn what they want to learn.
llm: Throughout our lives, we encounter numerous opportunities for learning and skill development. Individuals adopt various methods to expand their knowledge. Personally, I prefer hands-on learning over passive approaches such as reading or listening to lectures. There are several compelling reasons to advocate for this experiential method for those genuinely committed to learning.Firstly, learning through direct experience fosters personal growth and maturity. When we engage in tasks independently, we cultivate self-reliance and confidence, reducing our dependence on books or external guidance. This process allows us to gain valuable insights and experiences that contribute to our personal development. For instance, someone aspiring to become a leader must practice leadership in real-life situations, such as managing a team. You cannot truly understand leadership by merely reading about it or listening to others discuss it.Moreover, hands-on learning tends to be much more exhilarating than traditional methods of reading or listening. There are countless life skills that can only be mastered through practice. The thrill and satisfaction of doing something can't be replicated through a book or a lecture. Take swimming, for example: to truly grasp the skill, one must get into the water rather than just read about it or hear others explain it.Additionally, learning by doing often provides a greater source of motivation. Over time, reading and passive listening can become monotonous. In contrast, engaging in active learning brings enjoyment and satisfaction, especially when we achieve proficiency in a task. This sense of accomplishment can inspire us to take on new challenges and continue learning through hands-on experiences.History has demonstrated that experiential learning is one of the most effective ways to gain knowledge and skills. Relying solely on reading or passive listening limits our potential. Instead, we should embrace opportunities to try things for ourselves and persist until we achieve our learning goals.

question: Many people think that cheap air travel should be encouraged because it gives ordinary people the freedom to travel further. However, others think that this leads to environmental problem, and so air travel should be more expensive in order to discourage people from having it. Discuss both sides and give your own opinion.
human: In recent years, many airlines offer to their customers more and more number of cheap flights. People have various different views about cheap air travel. Although there are good arguments in favour of this trend should be encouraged, I personally think that cheap flight can make many serious problem.It is undeniable that cheap air fares have broadened travel possibilities for many people, particularly for the lower income group. These days, millions of people can travel around the world for work or pleasure. They can develop their careers, broad their knowledge, and interact with many other people from varied cultural backgrounds. Moreover, travels also help to promote the tourist industry development, boost the economy and job markets of many countries.On the other hand, growing of cheap flights really have negative impact on environment. Apparently, more flights could mean bigger and busier airport that may be grown the air pollution for people who live and work close to it. However, the biggest concern is the effect on global warming. Burning plane fuel can releases carbon dioxide into environment that cause the Earth to heat up. In fact, while many efforts are being made to reduce CO2 emissions from cars and factories, nothing is being done to reins the airlines. In conclusion, I would argue that the drawbacks of cheap air fares outweigh the benefits. However, it does not mean that air travel should be more expensive. Instead, people should be aware of their responsibility to reduce the emissions caused by their lifestyle choices.
llm: In recent years, many airlines have been increasingly offering their customers a growing number of budget flights. Opinions on affordable air travel vary widely. While there are strong arguments in favor of encouraging this trend, I believe that the proliferation of cheap flights can lead to significant issues.There is no doubt that lower airfares have opened up travel opportunities for many people, especially those with lower incomes. Today, millions can journey around the globe for work or leisure, allowing them to advance their careers, expand their knowledge, and connect with individuals from diverse cultural backgrounds. Additionally, increased travel contributes to the growth of the tourism industry, bolstering the economies and job markets of numerous countries.Conversely, the rise of budget flights has detrimental effects on the environment. More flights often result in larger and busier airports, which can increase air pollution for those living and working nearby. The most pressing concern, however, is the impact on global warming. The combustion of aviation fuel releases carbon dioxide into the atmosphere, contributing to the warming of our planet. While significant efforts are underway to decrease CO2 emissions from automobiles and industrial sources, little has been done to regulate emissions from airlines.In conclusion, I contend that the negative consequences of inexpensive airfares outweigh their advantages. This does not imply that air travel should become more costly; rather, individuals must recognize their responsibility to minimize the emissions stemming from their lifestyle choices.

question: Should governments spend more money on improving roads and highways, or should governments spend more money on improving public transportation(buses, trains, subways)? Why?Ê
human: Many people think that governments should spend money on improving roads and highways while the others say that it would be better to spend money on public transportation. In my opinion, governments should certainly spend money on the public transportation system because it would deal with problems that the rising number of private cars is creating.First, the using of public transportation reduces the amount of resources using on transportation. Cars depend on gasoline, which is a non-renewable resource. Therefore, the more cars we use means that the faster gasoline in this world is used up. In the contrary, if the public transportation is efficiently used, the amount of gasoline consuming per person will be much lower. And this definitely helps to reserve our invaluable natural resource, gasoline.Second, public transportation helps to solve the air pollution problems. Averagely, public transports use much less gasoline to carry people than private cars. It means that by using public transports, the less gas exhaust is pumped to the air and people will no longer have to bear the stuffy situation on the roads, which is always full of fumes.Last but not least, using public transportation is much safer than private transportation. According to National Safety Council, riding the bus is over 170 times safer than private care. Thus there is no reason that governments should hesitate to invest in public transportation, a healthy, safe and economical way of transporting.In short, I can say for certain that spending money on improving public transportation is necessary because it is the key to protect our world, creating a healthy and safe environment for people to live in.
llm: Many individuals believe that governments should allocate funds to enhance roads and highways, while others argue that investing in public transportation is a better option. In my view, it is essential for governments to prioritize spending on public transportation, as it addresses the challenges posed by the increasing number of private vehicles.Firstly, public transportation significantly reduces resource consumption in transportation. Cars rely on gasoline, a non-renewable resource, meaning that a higher number of cars leads to a more rapid depletion of this resource. Conversely, efficient public transit systems consume far less gasoline per person, helping to conserve this precious natural resource.Secondly, public transportation plays a crucial role in mitigating air pollution. On average, public transit vehicles consume significantly less gasoline per passenger compared to private cars. This means that by opting for public transport, we can decrease the amount of gas exhaust released into the atmosphere, alleviating the congestion and fumes that people often endure on the roads.Lastly, utilizing public transportation is considerably safer than driving privately. According to the National Safety Council, taking the bus is over 170 times safer than traveling by car. Therefore, there’s no justification for governments to hesitate in investing in public transportation, which offers a healthier, safer, and more economical means of travel.In conclusion, I firmly believe that funding improvements to public transportation is vital, as it is essential for safeguarding our environment and creating a healthy, safe living space for communities.

question: Some students prefer to study alone. Others prefer to study with a group of students. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer?
human: Everyone has their method to success in life. At school or university, success depends on how we study. Some students benefit a lot when they study with groups. Yet, I prefer to study individually because it helps me to concentrate more, and it helps me to build my personality.Studying alone helps us to focus more in our lessons. For instance, I am a type of person who cannot comprehend my subjects unless I am alone. I can prepare my schedules, guidelines, exercises and go over them all. Moreover, we have a lot of subjects which require us to sit and study alone such as math, reading, and drawing. In my opinion, I can take advantage of every minute without wasting by studying alone.Additionally, we are building our personalities when we study alone. For example, answering our homework alone encourages us to be more responsible and independent. Also, it motivates us to be accurate in our work in the future. Personally, when I fix my study plan with a specific time and finish it on time, it improves my ability in the future to become more precise and careful. To conclude, there are many ways to study and it is our right to choose which is suitable for our characters whether alone or with group. In fact, I agree with the idea of studying a lone since it helps me to focus more and establish my personality. Success needs us to work hard and sacrifice more whether we choose to study alone or with group.
llm: Everyone has their own approach to achieving success in life. In academic settings, whether at school or university, success largely hinges on our study methods. While some students thrive in group study environments, I personally prefer studying alone, as it enhances my concentration and fosters personal growth.Studying independently allows me to better focus on my lessons. For instance, I find it challenging to grasp my subjects unless I'm in a solitary environment. This allows me to create my own schedules, guidelines, and exercises to review comprehensively. Additionally, many subjects, such as math, reading, and drawing, necessitate individual study. I believe I can maximize every moment by studying on my own without distractions.Moreover, studying alone contributes to our personal development. For example, tackling homework by myself reinforces my sense of responsibility and independence. It also encourages attention to detail in my future work. When I set a study plan with specific deadlines and adhere to it, I enhance my ability to be precise and meticulous moving forward.In conclusion, there are various ways to study, and it's important to choose the method that best aligns with our individual personalities, whether that’s alone or in a group. Personally, I advocate for solo studying, as it boosts my focus and aids in building my character. Achieving success requires hard work and dedication, regardless of whether we choose to study independently or collectively.

question: Some people believe that the Earth is being harmed (damaged) by human activity. Others feel that human activity makes the Earth a better place to live. What is your opinion? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Whether human activity is making the Earth a better place to live or damaging it is a debatable issue. Some people advocate the idea that human activity is advantageously influencing to the Earth. However, I strongly believe that human activities are having a bad effect upon our planet, for human are polluting the Earth's environment, exhausting natural resource and threatening the living of other species.People are corrupting their ecosphere. In recent decades, concurrently with the increase of human consume, the waste discarded by human also multiplies. These wastes including household waste and industrial waste are so big that a "new" continent is now being formed in the sea from garbage. Furthermore, the industrial exhaust gases are adulterating the air, causing the insalubrious phenomenon such as acid rain, global warming or climate change.Besides, people are draining the Earth's natural resources. These resources such as oil, coal are vital for human activity, therefore nowadays, the exploitation activities of these resources are increasing dramatically to adapt to the infinite need of people. Researchers indicated that most of natural resources are un-recyclable and only several decades after, the Earth's natural resources are totally exhausted. At that time, human activity will be seriously affected due to the dependence on these resources.Also, people are endangering other species' live. Hunting has been a fundamental activity of human for having food. Through million years of hunting, especially in recent centuries with the innovation of rifle and dynamite, people have killed many animals and even have made some kinds of them become extinct. Moreover, people, suffering from the population pressure, are expanding their living area; consequently, the living area of other species narrowed. This narrowing of living region is pushing many creatures to the brink of extinction.All in all, from discussed reasons, we can conclude that human activity are gradually destroy the Earth since it is polluting the Earth environment, depleting the resource and imperiling other species' lives.
llm: The impact of human activity on the Earth—whether it is improving our living conditions or causing harm—is a topic of ongoing debate. Some argue that human efforts have positive effects on the planet, yet I firmly contend that our actions are detrimental to the environment. Human activities are polluting the atmosphere, depleting natural resources, and endangering the survival of other species.Human beings are significantly harming their ecosystem. In recent decades, as consumption has risen, so too has the amount of waste generated. Both household and industrial waste have increased to the point where a "new" continent of rubbish is emerging in our oceans. Moreover, industrial emissions are polluting the air, leading to serious environmental issues such as acid rain, global warming, and climate change.Additionally, humans are exhausting the Earth's natural resources. Resources such as oil and coal are essential for our daily activities, resulting in a dramatic increase in exploitation to meet endless demands. Researchers warn that most natural resources are not recyclable, and within a matter of decades, we may completely deplete these essential materials. This depletion would severely impact human life, given our reliance on these resources.Furthermore, human activities are putting other species at risk. Hunting has been a primary source of food for millennia, but with advancements in weaponry like rifles and dynamite, many animal populations have been decimated, leading to the extinction of several species. As the human population grows, we are encroaching further into the habitats of other animals, shrinking their living spaces and pushing many towards the brink of extinction.In conclusion, the evidence presented supports the notion that human activities are gradually destroying the Earth. We are polluting the environment, depleting vital resources, and putting other species at great risk.

question: A company is going to give some money either to support the arts or protect the environment. Which do you think the company chooses? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: If I had the opportunity to help a company make a decision on spending money either on supporting the arts or helping the environment, I would choose the latter without hesitation for the reasons below. First, conservation is more urgent now than at any time in history. According to a statistic conducted by the International Animal Preserving Association, we have only ten percent of the animals that have ever existed, which means that the biodiversity of our home is grievously endangered. What's more, rising sea levels, caused by global warming, have reached a level that is threatening human's life in many countries. If we continue discharging carbon dioxide with non-environmentally friendly cars, nations like Japan will be submerged and weather patterns could change, causing flooding, drought, and an increasing amount of damaging storms. In short, the ecosystem is in its worst condition ever and if we didn't take harsh measures now, we never will.Furthermore, supporting environment protection will benefit the company eventually.
