In times of uncertainty, parents can offer comfort and support, providing the kind of advice that comes from deep familiarity and love. Without their parents' immediate assistance, young adults might face unnecessary challenges. By valuing this guidance, they can navigate obstacles more effectively.In conclusion, staying with parents for an extended period fosters shared memories, reduces expenses, and provides essential parental advice. Therefore, I believe that young adults are better off living with their parents for longer.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the statement that a zoo has no useful purpose. Use specific reasons and example to explain your answer.
human: Some people may believe that a zoo is futile in the era of globalization, which people can develop their knowledge fast and easily. However, I do not agree with them. I believe that the zoo is invaluable for human beings. It is very crucial for learning. It helps animals out of extinction. Also, it is a interesting travel location.First of all, the zoo gives humans new knowledge. When you were so young that you did not know many kinds of animals, what should you do if there were no zoo? Inevitably, the zoo is the important place for innate learning. The zoo also let students have a chance to learning biology practically. They are able to observe animals' behaviors and features. Moreover, practical learning help students relax from a boring lecture class. Besides, researchers need the zoo to pick up some examples of animals for their researches because it has diverse species of animals.Secondly, the zoo preserves a large number of rare animals and provides them safe habitats. In the zoo, there is not so harmful as a forest. They, fed by zookeepers, do not need to find food themselves. Furthermore, we can do artificial insemenation to maintain nearly extinct wildlife.Last but not least, because of all weird, acute, and beautiful animals in the zoo, it can be a great tourist attraction. There are a lot of tourists who seek to see those animals closely. If the zoo has a large number of both national and foreign tourists, it will receive a great deal of money. That also make money flow, and then economics become better. It benefits to a certain country. In conclusion, the zoo not only saves animals in danger of extinction, but also helps people around the world have better lives. I firmly believe that the zoo is so useful for the earth.
llm: Some may argue that zoos are unnecessary in our globalized world, where knowledge can be acquired quickly and easily. However, I strongly disagree. Zoos hold immense value for humanity; they are vital for education, play a key role in wildlife conservation, and serve as fascinating travel destinations.Firstly, zoos provide individuals with new knowledge. Imagine being a child and not having access to a zoo—how would you learn about different animal species? Zoos are essential for gaining foundational knowledge. They also offer students the opportunity to learn biology in a hands-on way, allowing them to observe animal behaviors and characteristics up close. This practical experience can be much more engaging than traditional classroom lectures. Additionally, researchers rely on zoos to study diverse animal species and gain insights for their scientific work.Secondly, zoos play a crucial role in preserving numerous endangered species and ensuring they have safe habitats. Compared to the wild, zoos provide a less dangerous environment for animals, where zookeepers supply food and care. Moreover, techniques like artificial insemination are utilized to help sustain populations of nearly extinct wildlife.Lastly, the unique, fascinating, and diverse animals found in zoos can attract a significant number of tourists. Many people are eager to admire these creatures up close, and a zoo that draws both domestic and international visitors can generate substantial revenue. This influx of tourism can positively impact the local economy, benefiting the country as a whole.In conclusion, zoos not only play a critical role in protecting endangered species but also enhance the lives of people worldwide. I firmly believe that zoos are incredibly valuable to our planet.

question: Parents are the best teacher for young children. To what extend do you argee or disagree?
human: It is obvious that parents are the first teachers who teach babies how to walk and speak and make children to become a good person. Moreover, parents provide their children the best social skills and knowledge in order to prepare for their children's future life.First, children are taught basic things, which influence their whole life, by their parents. As a baby, they do not know any thing all around but they learn everything from their parents. Parents always try to explain and describe tenderly all things in simple way so that their baby can understand and learn from that. Consequently, parents bring the whole world of wonderful and colorful thing into their baby's little mind.Second, parents train their child how to become a good person. They always make their children basically say thanks and apology in the right way. On the one hand, it is common that they try to explain who is a good or bad person. On the other hand, children are shown how to behave well with others. This seems to be easy but this can influence positively their future children and makes children's behavior better before they face the real world.Third, it is clear that parents are ones who loves their children most and always take care of their children. Thus, they tend to provide the best knowledge and advice from their experience for children. Unlike a professional, parents always support children and give them much social skill so they can communicate well with others and have good habit in life. In fact, parents' support is one factor which makes people succeed in their life.In conclusion, parents are really the best teachers who give us much knowledge and advice. Based on love, they always try their best to make good condition for their children development in order to prepare children's future life.
llm: It is clear that parents are a child’s first teachers, guiding them in how to walk, speak, and develop into good individuals. Furthermore, they equip their children with essential social skills and knowledge to prepare them for the future.Firstly, parents impart fundamental lessons that shape their children’s lives. As infants, babies are unaware of the world around them, but they absorb everything from their parents. Parents make an effort to explain concepts in a gentle and simple manner, allowing their little ones to grasp and learn from these interactions. As a result, parents open up a vibrant and fascinating world to their children’s minds.Secondly, parents play a crucial role in teaching their children to be good individuals. They instill basic manners, such as expressing gratitude and offering apologies appropriately. While they explain the difference between good and bad behavior, they also model positive interactions with others. Although it may seem straightforward, this guidance greatly impacts their children's future interactions and fosters better behavior as they navigate the real world.Thirdly, it is undeniable that parents are the ones who love their children most and provide constant care. They offer invaluable knowledge and advice drawn from their own experiences. Unlike professionals, parents provide unwavering support, helping their children develop strong social skills that enable effective communication and the cultivation of healthy life habits. Indeed, parental support is a key factor in a child's future success.In conclusion, parents are truly the best teachers, imparting knowledge and wisdom driven by love. They consistently strive to create an environment conducive to their children’s growth, preparing them for the challenges of life ahead.

question: Some people say that television has a bad influence to young children. To what extend do you agree or disagree?
human: Nowadays, we have undergone many technology innovations such as Tv. Many people say that television has negative effects on children, since it can be violent or inappropriate for children. However, I strongly believe that television has more positive effects than negative effects. There are two reasons to support my idea.First of all, television has useful and educational programs. Not only the up-to-date news, but also there are many programs which has educational purposes. If children can use those programs wisely, they can learn many information from it. For example, in Korea, there's program called EBS. It is targeted for children to teenager. We can study subjects through EBS lecture. Also, there are many documentary films such as the life of a great man in Korea. Using those education programs let people get a lot of inspirations instead of having negative effects. In addition, Tv is helpful to relieve our stresses. There are many Tv programs such as sports programs. Many children have a lot of stresses recently, since they have so much pressure about study. When they are watching sports programs, it's easy to relieve those stresses. As an example, I got too much stress from the school. So, I was quite aggressive, however. After I watch the soccer match between Korea and Japan, the stress was gone. Instead, this soccer match helped me to continue my academic career in the school, since it helped me to relieve my stress.In conclusion, of course, the television can have violent programs, however, if children can use Tv programs wisely, there are more positive effects than negative effects. Now that, it has useful and educational programs and quite helpful to relieve stresses for children. For these reasons, I strongly disagree with the statement that television has negative effects on children.
llm: In today's world, we have experienced numerous technological innovations, including television. While many people argue that TV has detrimental effects on children due to its potential for violence and inappropriate content, I firmly believe that the benefits of television far outweigh the negatives. I have two key reasons to support my viewpoint.Firstly, television offers a wealth of informative and educational programs. Alongside current news broadcasts, there are numerous shows designed to educate viewers. When utilized wisely, these programs can significantly enhance children's knowledge. For instance, in South Korea, we have a program called EBS, which is aimed at children and teenagers. It provides lectures on various subjects, allowing students to learn effectively. Additionally, many documentary films showcase the lives of notable figures in Korea, which can inspire viewers. Engaging with such educational content can foster inspiration and learning, rather than contributing to negative experiences.Moreover, television can serve as a valuable tool for stress relief. Many programs, including sports shows, provide an enjoyable escape for children who may be feeling overwhelmed by academic pressures. For example, I often felt stressed about schoolwork, leading to frustration. However, after watching a thrilling soccer match between Korea and Japan, I found that my stress dissipated. This experience rejuvenated my motivation to continue my studies with renewed energy.In conclusion, while it's true that some television programs may contain violence, I believe that if children approach TV thoughtfully, they can experience far more positive outcomes than negative ones. With its array of educational content and its ability to relieve stress, television can be a beneficial resource for children. For these reasons, I strongly oppose the notion that television negatively impacts young viewers.

question: Businesses should hire employees for their entire lives. Do you agree or disagree. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.Ê
human: Many entrepreneurs hypothesize that it is safer to hire employees for their entire lives in order to ensure the productivity and efficiency of working. From my perspective, those assumptions are not only conservative but also out-of-date. I am biased towards the opposite side that businesses had better not employ the workers for the whole of their life because of the three main crucial reasons. First and foremost, various ideas and creativity from different people are indispensable for a company to flourish. The invaluable experience of senior employees can pass down to the young apprentices who get used to new job, but regularly give out creative and novel ideas. What's more, the rapid development in every field nowadays requires precise updates and access to new knowledge. Therefore, the youngsters are capable of meeting those standards. More importantly, they have activeness, inventiveness and enterprise which allow them to complete their jobs perfectly. These vital factors can decide whether the company can thrive or not.Secondly, the staff soon gets boring with their stable job in such a long time. At a certain time, they may presume that a securing job is the most important and necessary because they need to earn money to manage their life. Thereafter, the bulk of them realize that high promotion and competition can assist them to improve their skills and horizons also. Many people enjoy challenging them because they don not want to be monotonous and passive ones. The same-old-same-old environment soon makes them depressed, so this situation will have an adverse impact on the enterprise. Last but not least, the economic crisis and financial recession result in a tremendous increase in unemployment. In my opinion, the businesses ought to recruit many workers so as to tackle this aching issue. It enables the jobless to better their life and earn a living. Furthermore, the factories and companies will have abundant human sources to ensure the pace of manufacture and also devising lots of unique ideas. In a nutshell, varied characteristics of various people, feeling tired of having the same occupation and solving the unemployed problem drive me to agree with the statement that the employer should not hire the staff for a whole life. I believe that the brilliant bosses are conscious of the need for giving opportunities to diverse employees.
llm: Many entrepreneurs believe that it is safer to hire employees for life in order to maintain productivity and efficiency. However, I contend that this perspective is not only conservative but also outdated. I am inclined to argue that businesses should avoid long-term employment contracts for three key reasons.Firstly, diverse ideas and creativity from different individuals are essential for a company's success. While veteran employees offer invaluable experience to new hires, fresh talent often brings innovative and original ideas. The rapid advancements across various fields today necessitate constant updates and access to new knowledge, which younger workers can provide. They often possess enthusiasm, creativity, and a proactive approach, all of which are critical for achieving exceptional performance. These factors can significantly influence a company's potential for growth.Secondly, employees often become bored with their roles when they are held in the same position for too long. Initially, many may view job security as paramount to sustaining their livelihoods. However, most come to realize that opportunities for advancement and competition can greatly enhance their skills and broaden their perspectives. Many individuals thrive on challenges and wish to avoid the monotony of a stagnant work environment, as boredom can lead to dissatisfaction and, ultimately, adversely affect the organization.Lastly, economic downturns and financial crises often lead to a significant rise in unemployment. I believe that businesses should strive to hire more personnel to address this pressing issue. By doing so, they not only provide opportunities for the unemployed to improve their circumstances and support themselves but also ensure that companies benefit from a diverse range of talents, bolstering creativity and productivity.In conclusion, the varied talents of individuals, the risk of job monotony, and the need to address unemployment all support my belief that employers should not commit to hiring staff for their entire careers. I am confident that forward-thinking leaders recognize the importance of offering opportunities to a diverse workforce.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Childhood is the happiest time of a person's life. Use reasons and specific examples to support your opinion.
human: I agree with the statement that childhood is the happiest period of one's life. It's not only the lack of responsibilities and daily struggle that make childhood the happiest time of our lives, but also factors like learning lots of new things every day and freedom to imagine and say what you think.Starting with our adulthood, we are strictly bounded with our responsibilities in our daily lives. We are told at what hour we shall wake up, how we shall dress up and how we shall behave. Every action we make are watched closely and judged by the community. But during our childhood, though responsibilies exist, we are much more free to do what we would like to. Being late for school or laughing at a place where you aren't supposed to do not have consequences as serious as that would be if you were an adult. Another great thing about being a child is possibility learning new and interesting things about the world you live in every single day. Being a child means that you are new in this world and every single thing around you is there to be discovered by you. There are lots of new facts you can learn, stories you can listen to and things you can see. Therefore, childhood is the period of time in which a person is surprised most.Using your imagination and saying what you think freely is another great thing about being a child. Children are not judged about the things they say as much as the adults, and freedom to express yourself is a very important for developing a colorful imagination. In adulthood, people are forced to express themselves in boundaries, therefore they are in no way free to think or use their imagination.Childhood, in several aspects, is the happiest period of our lives. It's not only because of the nature of childhood and children, but also the way our lives are changed when we are adults. In an ideal world with less boundaries, social judgement and more freedom of thought, things could be different; but since this is not the case, it seems that we will always be missing our childhood days.
llm: I wholeheartedly believe that childhood is the happiest phase of life. This happiness stems not only from a lack of responsibilities and daily struggles but also from the joy of learning new things every day and the freedom to express our thoughts and creativity.As we transition into adulthood, we become burdened with various responsibilities that dictate our daily routines. We are told when to wake up, how to dress, and how to act. Every action is scrutinized and judged by those around us. In contrast, while childhood does come with some responsibilities, we enjoy a greater sense of freedom to engage in what we like. The consequences of being late for school or laughing inappropriately are far less severe than they would be in adulthood.Another remarkable aspect of childhood is the ability to learn fascinating new things about the world every day. As children, we are explorers in a vast universe filled with wonders waiting to be uncovered. New facts, captivating stories, and sights abound, making childhood a time of constant surprise.The freedom to use our imagination and express ourselves without fear of judgment is another significant advantage of being a child. Children are less likely to be criticized for their thoughts, allowing their imaginations to flourish. In adulthood, we often find ourselves constrained by societal norms, which stifles our creative expression and ability to think freely.In many ways, childhood represents the happiest time in our lives. This happiness is not merely a reflection of the carefree nature of childhood but also highlights the constraining realities that come with adulthood. Ideally, a world with fewer restrictions, less social judgment, and greater freedom of thought would foster more joy; however, since this is not our reality, many of us long for the simplicity and wonder of our childhood days.

question: Learning about the past has no value on for those of us living the present. Do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Many people think that "Past has nothing to do with present, as time never stops, the next generations are completely different from the predecessors". Although it is true that life changes rapidly, there are many things in the past that we can learn about, such as mistakes, success and knowledge in many fields of study. First of all, the predecessors' mistakes are the first thing that we should consider when learning about the past. As everyone's life is too short to risk trying anything without any prepare, we all should learn about other's mistakes so that we can avoid making the same ones. Each mistake, from the smallest to the bigger one, is a treasure of experience, which, if we can make full use of, will make us well-prepared for many complicated situations of our life. Therefore, past obviously saves ourselves a bunch of failures and times.Secondly, people's success in the past is as significant as those mistakes. If the predecessors' mistakes are the indirect way that leads us to the goals, others' accomplishment can be served as the direct way. By looking into the ways other people use to achieve their targets, we have the chance to make those mine, put them into practice and, of course, be successful like them. For instance, Edison's statement "Genius is 1 percent inspiration and 99 percent perspiration" is still helpful for everyone today, and probably in the future. Last but not least, the past is the basis in which people can use to develope new knowledge, inventions. If it had not been for those knowledge in the past, we could never be as modern as today. How can America be the world's leading country if Columbus did not accidentally discover it in his search for India. How can the comtemporary scientists study the earth's gravity without the apple which fall on Newton's head. They are only some of many precious knowledge that the past presents us. We cannot ignore them in any way.All in all, the past's mistakes, success and knowledge all have crucial impact on people's lives today. We should make full use of the past, instead of ignoring it, for a better and brighter future.
llm: Many believe that "the past has no bearing on the present, as time is constantly moving forward, and each generation differs significantly from the one before." While it is true that life evolves quickly, there are invaluable lessons to be learned from history, including insights into mistakes, successes, and knowledge across various fields.Firstly, the errors made by those who came before us are essential considerations in our quest for understanding the past. Since life is too short to learn solely through personal experience, we should study the mistakes of others to avoid repeating them. Each mistake, regardless of its size, serves as a valuable lesson. If we can leverage these lessons, we will be better equipped to handle the complexities of life, ultimately saving ourselves from numerous failures and wasted effort.Secondly, the successes of previous generations are just as important as their mistakes. While the missteps of our predecessors guide us indirectly toward our goals, their accomplishments provide us with a more direct path. By examining how others have achieved their objectives, we can adopt and apply their methods, increasing our chances for success. For example, Thomas Edison's quote, "Genius is 1 percent inspiration and 99 percent perspiration," remains relevant today and likely will continue to inspire future generations.Lastly, the past serves as a foundation for the development of new knowledge and inventions. Without the discoveries and insights of those who came before us, our modern advancements would be unimaginable. How could America have emerged as a global leader if Columbus had not stumbled upon it while seeking a route to India? How would contemporary scientists explore the concept of gravity without the legendary story of the apple falling on Isaac Newton’s head? These are just a few examples of the invaluable knowledge that history offers us, which we must not overlook.In conclusion, the mistakes, successes, and knowledge of the past profoundly influence our lives today. Instead of dismissing history, we should embrace it to pave the way for a brighter and more promising future.

question: Governments spent a lot of money for traveling outer space. Do you think the investment is reasonable? Give your own opinion and reasons to support you claim
human: Space exploration, for discovery of out of space, has been possible for human in the 20th century. The United state and Russia are the important countries that spend large budgets for the research of this subject. In my opinion, spending the budget for space exploration is an important activity to save living of humanity in the future. Many governments believe that space exploration is an activity that wastes the budget, while the essential challenge of humanity in the future would be the discovery of a new place for the living. In 20th century, although human being succeeded to achieve out of space by means of new technologies such as rockets, but finding a new place for living in another planet is impossible until now. In during history, our planet is threatening by many of other planets or stars and it is an enormous danger for living of humanity. Therefore, it is very significant to find a new place for living in other planets. Space exploration has used as a tools for military power in the cold war. In the future, many countries will try to prevent attach of other countries by using and invention new missiles. In the past, the space race happened between the United Stated and the Soviet Union. Both countries tried to send man to the moon and show their power to each other. As a result, space exploration will use as a military power for many countries.In summary, spending budget for space exploring is not the waste budget, because it may helps to save civilization of humanity. Although exploring space used for discovery of other planets, nowadays most of governments have used many rockets for military purposes and therefore the purposes of exploring space has altered.
llm: Space exploration, aimed at uncovering the mysteries of the universe, became a reality for humanity in the 20th century. The United States and Russia are among the key nations that allocate substantial budgets for research in this domain. In my view, investing in space exploration is crucial for safeguarding the future of humanity.While some governments argue that funding space exploration is a waste of resources, I believe the primary challenge facing humanity is the need to find new habitats for life. During the 20th century, despite significant advancements in technology, such as the development of rockets, we have yet to discover a viable new home on another planet. Throughout history, Earth has been threatened by various celestial bodies, presenting a considerable danger to human existence. Therefore, it is imperative to seek out new potential living environments beyond our planet.During the Cold War, space exploration also served as a tool for military power. In the future, many countries will likely focus on developing new missile technologies to deter attacks from adversaries. The historic space race between the United States and the Soviet Union exemplifies this, as both nations competed to send humans to the moon and demonstrate their superiority. Consequently, space exploration has increasingly been intertwined with military ambitions.In conclusion, allocating funds for space exploration should not be seen as a waste of resources; rather, it has the potential to preserve the future of human civilization. Although exploring space is intended for the discovery of new planets, many governments now also utilize rocket technology for military ends, indicating a shift in the objectives of space exploration.

question: Do you agree with the following statement? Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.Ê
human: Television is one of the greatest innovations that we use every day. Besides, watching television has some cons and at the same time has very good pros. However, while some people argue that TV has devastated communication among friends and families, I believe it has done the opposite. I think TV programs are among the popular topics in every day talk as well as a great time for gathering. In addition Modern TV has smart system that let you be connected with people.First, it's true watching TV take a lot of your day, nevertheless it makes people meet and start a conversation about what they watch at other times like weather forecast and sport programs.Second, people like having meals while they are watching TV. Families usually tend to watch television either with each other or friends. For example my friends and I used to sit together and enjoy watching movies using VHS player at nights. It was fun and a little bit similar to the cinema. Third, TV can be one of communication ways. Moreover, TV can be connected to multimedia devices that have smart operating system like Google TV, WDTV using Skype, tango and other apps. In addition Teenagers can play games online with their friends; therefore we can communicate with each other through TV. To sum up, TV may take some of your time away from your family and friends but it can also make family get together and help to get in conversation. As well as it's one way of recent communications, based on that I think TV helps you to get connected with people.
llm: Television stands out as one of the most significant innovations we engage with on a daily basis. While there are certainly drawbacks to watching TV, it also offers many advantages. Some critics argue that television has harmed communication among friends and families, but I contend that it has actually fostered connections. TV shows often become popular topics of conversation and serve as excellent opportunities for social gatherings. Moreover, modern television features smart systems that facilitate connectivity with others.First, it’s true that watching television can consume a considerable amount of your day; however, it often sparks conversations about shared viewing experiences, such as weather forecasts and sports events. Second, many people enjoy having meals in front of the TV. Families and friends frequently come together to watch programs, creating moments of bonding. For instance, my friends and I used to gather for movie nights with a VHS player, which was an enjoyable experience reminiscent of going to the cinema. Third, television can serve as a communication tool. With smart TVs connected to multimedia devices, platforms like Google TV and WDTV allow users to engage via apps such as Skype and Tango. Additionally, teenagers can play games online with their friends, facilitating communication through their TVs.In conclusion, while television may take some time away from direct interactions with family and friends, it also encourages togetherness and conversation. As a medium of modern communication, I believe television plays a valuable role in helping us connect with others.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Letting a friend make a mistake is better than taking action that risks destroying a friendship.Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
human: There is an argument regrading weather letting a friend make a mistake is better than taking action that risks destroying a friendship. It is widely accepted by many people that a mistake will return sometimes terrible result. However, I believe that friendship is more important than mistake by a friend, although mistake is terrible. In this essay, I will present two reasons supporting my opinion. First of all, a mistake does not last for a long time but a friendship lasts forever. Anybody does not remember mistakes. If someone remembers mistake, he or she has a closed mind. I want to say that mistakes will be forgotten quickly. For example, my friend Lee made a mistake that he broke my precious gift. However, I forgot about it just after two days, and I felt at peace with him. Some people might say I am silly, but I think mistake is more forgettable than friendship. Second, Everybody makes mistake. However, if you end a friendship whenever your friend makes a mistake, there will be no friends around you. I agree if a friend makes very a big mistake, we will need to end a friendship. However, when the mistake friend made was not a big problem, we need to understand friend and forgive it because a friend is a gift of our life. According to a research, 85% of people answered that a best gift is a friend.I think that a mistake can not brake friendship if it is not a big because friendship is forever and gift our life.
llm: There is an ongoing debate about whether allowing a friend to make a mistake is preferable to taking action that may jeopardize the friendship. Many people believe that mistakes can lead to significant negative consequences. However, I hold the view that friendship is more valuable than a friend’s mistakes, even if those mistakes can be severe. In this essay, I will provide two reasons to support my perspective.Firstly, mistakes are typically temporary, while friendships can last a lifetime. Most people don’t dwell on past mistakes; if someone does, it often reflects a narrow mindset. In reality, mistakes are often quickly forgotten. For instance, my friend Lee once accidentally broke a cherished gift of mine. Despite my initial frustration, I moved on within a couple of days and felt at peace with him again. Some may call me foolish for this, but I believe that mistakes are generally more forgivable than the bonds of friendship.Secondly, everyone makes mistakes. If you choose to end a friendship every time a mistake occurs, you may find yourself alone. While it is understandable to end a friendship over a major error, for minor mistakes, it is important to show understanding and forgiveness, as friends are invaluable in our lives. Research has shown that 85% of people consider friendship to be one of life’s greatest gifts.In conclusion, I believe that a mistake should not jeopardize a friendship, especially if it is minor, because true friendship endures and is one of life’s greatest treasures.

question: One of the best ways that parents can help their teenage children prepare for adult life is to encourage them to take a part-time job.
human: Nowadays, the society has become exceedingly competitive than ever before, parents have the responsibilitis to teach their children to survive and to be indepedent from them, just as animals teach their offspring skills of finding foods. Parents can use many methods to guide them to achieve that, for example, asking them to do some housework or clean the rooms by themselves. In my views, I agree that it is the best way for teenage children to take a part-time job to prepare their adult life for several reasons.First of all, when children get a job, they are able to earn money by themselves, instead of getting pocket money from their parents. Thus, it is an oppertunity to learn how to deal with money. Take me as an example, when I was 16, I found a job during summer vacation and earned some money by own. At the beginning of the semester, I was told to buy a text book. Unfortunately, I spent most of my salary hanging out with my friend. Therefore, I finally realized that I should learn to make a plan before I spend my money, and that did influence me in my life now.Secondly, by taking a part-time job, they certainly have to be responsible for anything they have done. For instance, if a student get a job in a company but he is frequently late for work, the company may reduce his payment or even fire him. To compare with the school life, they might suffer only a small punishment at school. Under the circumstances, he will learn that he has to obey the rule and take responsibility for their work.In conclusion, to help their children to adapt adult life, parents should let them experience it as much as they can. Due to the reasons given above, to encourage children taking a part-time job is a good choice for them to get prepared for adult life.
llm: In today’s world, society has become more competitive than ever, and parents have a crucial role in teaching their children how to become self-sufficient and independent, much like how animals instruct their young on survival skills. There are various methods parents can employ to facilitate this learning, such as assigning household chores or encouraging their children to clean their own rooms. Personally, I believe that encouraging teenagers to take part-time jobs is one of the most effective ways to prepare them for adult life for several reasons.First, when children earn their own money rather than relying on an allowance from their parents, they gain valuable experience in managing finances. For example, when I was 16, I found a summer job and earned my own income. However, when it came time to purchase textbooks at the start of the school year, I realized I had spent a significant portion of my earnings socializing with friends. This experience taught me the importance of budgeting and planning before making expenditures, a lesson that has continued to inform my financial decisions.Additionally, holding a part-time job instills a sense of responsibility. For instance, if a student takes a job but consistently arrives late, they risk losing pay or even being fired. Compared to the relatively minor consequences often faced in school settings, this real-world scenario teaches the importance of following rules and being accountable for one’s actions.In conclusion, to aid their children in adjusting to adult life, parents should encourage them to seek as many experiences as possible. As discussed, promoting part-time employment is an excellent strategy for preparing young people for the responsibilities of adulthood.

question: It is better for children to grow up in the countryside than in a big city. Do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and examples to develop your essay.
human: It’s certainly better for children to grow up in a big city. Of course you need to choose a good neighborhood. I hold this belief because of two main reasons, academic and social reasons.Some people thinks that if a child grows up in a big city they will be all day at home at the computer or at the video-game, but this is not true if you live in a neighborhood with other people about your age as I did. My friends and I used to play soccer, bike, climb trees and do a lot of other stuff every day. We did play video-games, but that wasn't our main activity. In a big city there are more kinds of people and more things to do.I have a friend that grew up in the countryside. He said that he had to study a lot to pass the test to enter the university. This is another downside of growing up in the countryside. In a big city you have more qualified teachers and a better access to technology.Growing up in the countryside is not such a good experience, you won’t know a lot of people, there are gossips everywhere, and your life will be really limited. If someday I have children, I’m absolutely sure that they will grow up in a good neighborhood of a big city and they will be very happy about it.
llm: Growing up in a big city is undoubtedly advantageous for children, provided they are raised in a good neighborhood. I believe this for two primary reasons: academic and social benefits. Some people argue that children in big cities spend all their time indoors on computers or playing video games. However, that wasn't the case for me growing up in a community with peers my age. My friends and I engaged in outdoor activities like playing soccer, riding bikes, and climbing trees on a daily basis. While we did enjoy video games, they were just a part of our diverse range of activities. Big cities offer a wider array of people and opportunities for entertainment.I have a friend who was raised in the countryside and mentioned how challenging it was for him to study extensively just to pass the university entrance exams. This highlights a significant drawback of rural upbringing. In a big city, students often benefit from more qualified teachers and greater access to technology.Living in the countryside can be quite limiting; you may not meet as many people, and rumors can spread easily. If I ever have children, I'm confident that I will ensure they grow up in a good neighborhood in a vibrant city, where they can thrive and be truly happy.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: I completely agree that parents are the best teacher. Children normally think that their parents are somehow special and that makes them the most important people in the children’s lives.Firstly, the things that parents say have great power to their child. More power than any friend or other adult could have. For example, if someone tells a kid that something is wrong and they shouldn't do it, but his father told him/her that it was right, the kid will listen to the father instead of the other person, even if his father is wrong.Secondly, a child normally spends more time with their parents than with other people, so their parents have more time to teach him/her than anybody else. They have more contact and more intimacy with their children. Lastly, children usually mirror themselves on their parents. That’s as important thing because even if the parents don’t intend to teach their children something, they are always observing and learning by themselves. So, if there is a man that beats his wife and treats her bad, his child probably is going to be rude and treat girls bad.All in all, I agree that parents are the greatest teachers and I think that they should be very careful with what they say and do in front of their child, because it can define who he is going to be.
llm: I wholeheartedly believe that parents are the best teachers. Children often perceive their parents as uniquely special, which makes them the most significant figures in their lives.To begin with, the words parents choose to use carry immense weight with their children, far surpassing the influence of friends or other adults. For instance, if a child hears from a peer that an action is wrong but their father insists it is right, the child is likely to side with the father, regardless of whether he is mistaken.Additionally, children typically spend more time with their parents than with anyone else, allowing parents greater opportunities to educate and influence them. This close bond fosters more meaningful interactions and deeper connections.Moreover, children tend to emulate their parents. This aspect is crucial because even when parents do not consciously aim to teach, their children are constantly observing and absorbing lessons from their behavior. For example, if a father exhibits abusive behavior toward his partner, it is likely that the child will grow up to replicate similar disrespectful attitudes toward others.In conclusion, I firmly believe that parents are the most impactful educators. They should exercise caution in their words and actions around their children, as these experiences will shape the individuals their children become.

question: Nowadays, food has become easier to prepare. Has this change improved the way people live? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: The Technology has developed a lot. With that development, food can be prepared more easily and it can taste a lot better than it used to. With that change, people’s lives are a lot better for several reasons. Some good reasons are about having more time and being able to prepare better food without being a good cook.Firstly, people normally have lots of things to do. Because of that, they don’t have much time to spend in the kitchen. But being able to prepare a tasty food just putting it into the microwave or into the oven is awesome. For example, if an engineer needs to make a project, but he needs to deliver it tomorrow, he could save hours preparing a food with the microwave instead of cooking everything from scratch.Secondly, when someone wants to prepare a good food alone for some reason, some time ago he/she would need to be a very good cook to prepare that food, but nowadays is very easy to prepare a healthy and tasty food. For example, if a guy wants to prepare a dinner to his girlfriend, he could just buy some food that comes with instructions. Normally you just need to put it into the oven and wait some time.All in all, that ease to prepare food has improved people’s lives. And that happened mainly because of the development of the technology. But people should be careful with what they eat, because some industrial foods are very bad for their health, so they should buy only food from well known brands.
llm: Technology has made significant strides in recent years, greatly simplifying the process of food preparation and enhancing flavors compared to the past. This advancement has positively impacted people's lives in various ways, particularly by granting them more free time and enabling them to create delicious meals without requiring exceptional cooking skills.To begin with, many individuals have busy schedules and limited time to spend in the kitchen. The ability to prepare tasty meals simply by placing them in the microwave or oven is incredibly convenient. For instance, if an engineer is working on a project due tomorrow, he can save hours by using a microwave instead of cooking everything from scratch.Moreover, preparing a delicious meal alone used to demand advanced cooking skills, but today it’s much easier to make healthy and flavorful dishes. For example, if someone wants to impress a date with dinner, they can now purchase pre-packaged food that comes with straightforward instructions—usually just requiring them to place it in the oven and wait.In summary, the convenience of food preparation has significantly enhanced people's lives, primarily due to technological advancements. However, individuals should remain mindful of their dietary choices, as some processed foods can be detrimental to health, so it's wise to stick to well-known brands.

question: Students should be required to take regular standardized tests to prove that they are learning
human: The issue at hand is if the schools should require students to take regular standardized exams. This issue is important because nowadays many people cast doubt on it. However, I believe that standardized tests are valuable option for educational system as long as it would help teachers to know if the students are really getting knowledge.Firstly, standardized tests are preferable due to the fact that they help teachers to fairly grade the students. For example some students are not so active on the lessons, cause they are already familiar with the issue. Therefore, exams could be the only way for teachers to see the real abilities of those students. In addition, many teachers rely only on the exam results while grading the class, so the usage of standardized tests is the superior option for them.Additionally, standardized tests can be good chance for students to apply their knowledge on practice. Since, some students may get used to simply rewriting solved problems from the blackboard, so they will never try to solve problems on their own. However, standardized tests offer them such chance. Thus, it is clear that schools should require students to take standardized tests, as long as this option helps to both sides.Finally, I think that requirement to take standardized tests is the right choice, since in this case teachers can compare the level of knowledge of different students. In any class there will be students who will show low academic performance, so teachers could work with them more intensively. I support the points of those who say that standardized tests are required over those who don’t because if the teacher would know the level of each student he would fairly share his time to all of them.Ultimately I feel that schools which obligate their students to take standardized tests are right. I belive this, due to the fact that these schools can qualitatively check if they are giving an appropriate education to their students.
llm: The current debate revolves around whether schools should mandate regular standardized exams for students. This topic is significant, as many people question the effectiveness of such assessments today. However, I believe that standardized testing plays a crucial role in the educational system by providing teachers with insights into whether students are genuinely absorbing knowledge.To begin with, standardized tests offer a fair method for teachers to evaluate student performance. For instance, some students may not actively participate in class discussions because they already understand the material. In such cases, exams serve as a vital tool for educators to gauge the true abilities of these students. Furthermore, many teachers depend on exam results when determining final grades, making standardized tests a preferred choice for maintaining fairness in assessment.Additionally, standardized tests present students with the opportunity to apply their knowledge practically. Some students might become accustomed to passively copying solved problems from the board, which prevents them from developing independent problem-solving skills. Standardized tests encourage students to engage actively with the material, thereby fostering their ability to tackle challenges on their own. Thus, it is evident that requiring standardized exams can benefit both teachers and students alike.Finally, I believe that mandating standardized tests is a wise decision, as it allows teachers to compare the knowledge levels of different students. In any classroom, there will always be students with varying degrees of academic performance, and standardized testing helps educators identify those who may need additional support. I align with those who advocate for standardized testing, as it enables teachers to allocate their time and resources more equitably among students.Ultimately, I feel that schools that require their students to take standardized tests are making the right choice. This approach not only allows for a thorough evaluation of whether students receive a quality education but also ensures that educators are held accountable for their teaching effectiveness.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? A university education should be provided free of charge to all interested scholars
human: A famous proverb “Knowledge is power” has demonstrated the value of education. I believe that universities should provide free of cost education to the interested scholars because now-a-days universities with good name charge high fees and this leads one to think about affordability. I have observed that many of the interested scholars failed to get the admission in good universities because they have to think about work along with the studies, and this left them with only one choice, which is work.University is more likely to become a money making business, the issue of affordability has become crucial to the students. In today’s world education is getting expensive, and people are tending to apply for self-finance education in order to get the admission. Whereas, the scholars are facing a lot of difficulties apart from their high requirements of previous education, they has a lot to face the other difficulties and burden while getting admission such as accommodation, food, traveling, clothing, etc.Moreover, it is hard to get manage two things at a time for instance, working and studying is not an easy job for the scholars, they need to concentrate on their studies. MPhils and PhDs scholars are probably engage in the research work, which takes their full concentration and surveys. The idea of free of charge education inspires those scholars who really want to put their efforts and get a degree from best universities.Therefore, universities have to look over the issues face by most of the scholars; their message should be spread education, not making money, and motivate those scholars who want to get education. Their notion should be inspirational in such a way which makes our society educative and increase our literacy rate.
llm: The well-known proverb "Knowledge is power" highlights the importance of education. I believe universities should offer free education to aspiring students, as many reputable institutions currently charge exorbitant fees, creating challenges related to affordability. I've noticed that numerous dedicated students are unable to gain admission to prestigious universities because they must balance work and studies, often resulting in their prioritizing employment over education.As universities increasingly resemble profit-driven enterprises, the issue of affordability has become a pressing concern for students. In today’s world, the cost of education is skyrocketing, pushing individuals to seek self-financing options just to gain admission. Additionally, aspiring students encounter numerous challenges beyond simply meeting educational prerequisites, grappling with expenses such as accommodation, food, transportation, and clothing.Moreover, managing both work and study is no easy feat. Scholars require focus on their academic pursuits, particularly those pursuing MPhils and PhDs, as their research demands full concentration and extensive study. The prospect of free education would motivate these committed individuals who genuinely wish to earn degrees from esteemed institutions.Therefore, universities should pay attention to the challenges faced by many students. Their mission should prioritize education over profit, inspiring those eager to learn. If they embrace this vision, we can create a more educated society and improve our literacy rates.

question: Some people think university professors should spend more time doing research while others think they should spend more time educating students. What is your view?Ê
human: Although professors in a university are basically teachers who do the most important thing, teaching, we cannot ignore one more influential aspect that they are always busy with, doing research. In my opinion, a professor should spend more time doing research rather than educating students for a few reasons following.A professor means a researcher or an expert of a specific science subject. He or she should always keep the passion in her field so that he or she could push him/herself forward all the time. And then he or she can do better in teaching works. For instance, the most impressive professor during my studying in university is Mr. Yang who keeps in researching and reading. He is also the one who gave us inspiration and taught us the way to study more efficient by ourselves. All of my classmates gave him a rank of AAA, the excellent teacher.As for students, we can get what we want to know from textbooks, webs or teachers. But we can only turn to our professors when we want to take part in a research and to get ourselves promoted. If a professor doesn't get any researching works, he cannot give us the opportunity. In addition, a professor who is concentrate in his or her research is thinking and creating new ideas all the time. He or she may stimulate us students to come up with some creative sugesstions. That is good for both of the professor and students.Finally, all professors in the university are fortune of the society. They are the leaders almost in every fields of science, arts, culture and so on. Without their research, there will be no new technologies come out quickly. Without their research, there will be more artcrafts being ruined by nothing. Without their research, there will be less information of our ancestors to be known on the earth.In conclusion, a professor should do their research all the time during their careers as a teacher in university. And it's worth to spend more time on it than on teaching.
llm: While university professors are primarily known as teachers responsible for imparting knowledge, we cannot overlook another significant aspect of their roles: research. I believe that professors should prioritize research over teaching for several reasons.Firstly, a professor is fundamentally a researcher or an expert in their specific field of study. Maintaining a passion for their discipline is essential, as it drives personal and professional growth. This continuous engagement with research ultimately enhances their teaching effectiveness. For example, one of my most inspiring professors at university was Mr. Yang, who consistently engaged in research and literature. His enthusiasm not only enriched our learning experience but also taught us how to study more efficiently on our own. My classmates and I rated him AAA, recognizing him as an exceptional educator.Secondly, while students can access knowledge through textbooks, online resources, and lectures, they rely on professors when it comes to participating in research and advancing their academic pursuits. If a professor is not actively involved in research, they are unable to provide opportunities for students to engage in meaningful projects. Moreover, professors immersed in their research are constantly generating and exploring new ideas, which can inspire students to think creatively and contribute innovative suggestions—a mutually beneficial dynamic.Lastly, university professors represent a valuable asset to society, serving as leaders across various fields including science, arts, and culture. Their research drives advancements in technology, preserves cultural artifacts, and expands our understanding of history. Without their contributions, progress in these areas would stagnate.In conclusion, professors should dedicate a significant portion of their time to research throughout their academic careers. This commitment not only enhances their teaching but also fosters a thriving educational environment.

question: How do television or movies influence people's behavior? Use reasons and specific examples to explain your answer.
human: There is no doubt that television or movies influence people’s behavior and they influence us in both bad ways and good ways. But I think in general television and movies influence our behavior in bad ways more than in good ways. They make people to eat more rubbish food, spend less time with their friends and family, and be someone that are not themselves. There are a lot of people eating foods or snacks when they are watching television. Most of the foods they eat are fat foods like chips or pizzas. It is not rocket science to know that these foods are not good for people’s health. Many companies know about this behavior and use advertisements on television to make people buy more of these foods. In turn, people will consume these rubbish foods more and we have to deal with a lot of fat diseases.Television and movies also make people to spend more time on their couch than with their family and friends, especially children. They communicate less with their parents because a lot of their time is used watching television and movies. When people are watching television or movies together, they also talk less to each other, compare to when playing social games, such as parlor games, together.Television and movies nowadays contain a lot of advertisements. These advertisements build ideal images that make people to feel bad about themselves and want to be more like these images. When people see beautiful women and men on the advertisements, they think that they are ugly. Thus they spend a lot of money to buy a lot of beauty products or go to gym to get better appearance or body. When a cool hero characters in a movie smokes and yet a lot of people like him, then people who idolize him may also begin to smoke although they don’t prefer it.I think television and movies are entertaining but most of the time they influence people’s behavior in bad ways. If you want to stay healthy, be yourself and spend time with your family and friends, then you should spend less time watching these media.
llm: There is no doubt that television and movies impact people's behavior, shaping us in both positive and negative ways. However, I believe that, on the whole, their influence tends to be more detrimental than beneficial. They encourage unhealthy eating habits, reduce quality time spent with loved ones, and promote a disconnect from one's true self.Many viewers snack while watching TV, often consuming unhealthy options like chips and pizza. It's common knowledge that these foods are not conducive to good health. Companies exploit this behavior by advertising these unhealthy products, prompting increased consumption and contributing to a rise in obesity-related health issues.Moreover, television and movies often result in people, especially children, spending more time on the couch rather than engaging with family and friends. As screen time increases, meaningful communication with parents decreases. Even when watching together, families tend to talk less than they would if they were playing interactive games.Today’s media is also filled with advertisements that portray unrealistic ideals, leading viewers to feel inadequate about their own appearance. When people see idealized images of beautiful men and women, they may perceive themselves as unattractive, prompting them to spend money on beauty products or gym memberships in pursuit of those ideals. Similarly, when influential characters in movies are shown smoking, admirers may feel encouraged to mimic that behavior, even if they previously had no interest in smoking.While I recognize that television and movies can be entertaining, I believe they often lead to negative behavioral influences. To maintain good health, stay true to oneself, and foster relationships with family and friends, it is wise to limit time spent consuming these forms of media.

question: Many people visit museums when they travel to new places. Why do you think people visit museums? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Many people like to visit museums when they travel to new places, other people don't like to visit museums. I personaly tend to visit museums when I'm in a new place because it's good for me know about the culture, tradition and history of other places.The first reason why people are willing to visit museums when they travel to a new territory is that museums provide a tremendous amount of information about different aspects of the history and culture of that place, as I said back. And also taking the chance for making friends. Visit museums can bring you the opportunity to establish relations and knowledge to participate in conversations. And that kind of knowledge speaks very highly of you.However, other people visit museums are the most boring expirience of a trip. My cousin Pedro literaly hates to visit museums but he really enjoyed his visit to the famous London - Madame Tussaud museum, it was kind of art entertainment but also that visit helped him to understand the artist works, and in addition he started to respect and admire other types of arts that offers in other museums.In coclusion, the museums are a visual source to know the history, tradition and culture of any place in the world. I think it's fun and educational.
llm: Many travelers enjoy visiting museums in new destinations, while others may not share this interest. Personally, I prefer to explore museums when I’m in unfamiliar places, as they offer valuable insights into the culture, traditions, and history of those regions.One reason people choose to visit museums while traveling is the wealth of information they provide about the local history and culture. Additionally, museums can serve as great venues for making new friends and engaging in conversations, as the knowledge gained from visits often enriches social interactions.On the flip side, some individuals find museum visits to be the least exciting part of their trips. My cousin Pedro, for example, absolutely detests traditional museums. However, he surprisingly enjoyed his visit to the renowned Madame Tussauds in London. The experience, a unique blend of art and entertainment, not only entertained him but also deepened his appreciation for the artists' work and broadened his respect for various art forms showcased in other galleries.In summary, museums serve as visual gateways to understanding the history, traditions, and cultures of places around the world. I believe they are both enjoyable and educational experiences.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: In a busy and crowded world, we should not expect people to be polite to others.
human: Once a celebrity said: A man's manner is a mirror that reflects his virtues. Recently, the social environment we lived with busy noises and crowded spaces in case that people pay less attentions on their behaviors and manners. They are being rude towards others. Due to this phenomenon, someone suggests that we should not expect people to be polite to other. Obviously, I do not agree with such kind of altitudes, the explanations I explored would be stated as following.First of all, a person with good manner will give others a fine personal impression. Through those impressions, a person was easily to get acquired with others and blended with the community that surrounded him as soon as possible. For example, I worked in a new company, if I am a guy with good manners and treating everyone well, my new colleagues will accept me, even then I will be approved by the employers. In opposite situation if I am being rude, I can not get along well with each other. Finally, I will be fired and have no other choice but lost my job.Secondly, people will get respect from politeness within each other. Politeness and tender words not only can help the speaker to earn a good reputation but also that encourage the listeners who were in need. A successful corporation must have a relationship with respect and pleasure. There are many more facts have improved that people with politeness are easily to be succeed, because from their behaviors, they made their partners or opponents to find their own individual dignity.Finally, the society needs a civilized environment and orders. And a degree of social civilization depend on its people's qualities. In order to create a better living environment for ourselves and our offsprings, our behaviors must be asked with politeness and good manners. Benefit from those effective measures, there may be an obvious effect on the reducing of criminal rate.All in all, I suppose that people should be polite to others in a such busy and crowded world.
llm: A famous figure once remarked, "A man's manner is like a mirror reflecting his virtues." In today's fast-paced and bustling society, where distractions abound, many people seem to pay less attention to their behavior and manners, often treating others rudely. Some suggest we shouldn't expect politeness from others, but I firmly disagree. Here are my reasons.Firstly, individuals who demonstrate good manners tend to leave a positive impression on others. Such impressions help people connect and integrate into their communities more smoothly. For instance, when I started working at a new company, my good manners and respectful treatment of colleagues made it easier for me to be accepted by my peers and acknowledged by my employers. Conversely, if I had been rude, it would have hindered my ability to build relationships, likely leading to my dismissal.Secondly, polite interactions foster mutual respect among individuals. Courtesy and kind words not only enhance the speaker's reputation but also uplift those who are on the receiving end. Successful organizations thrive on relationships built on respect and goodwill. Numerous studies indicate that people who practice politeness are more likely to succeed, as their behavior encourages others to recognize their own dignity.Lastly, society as a whole requires a civilized atmosphere and order. The level of social civility is directly tied to the qualities of its individuals. To create a better environment for ourselves and future generations, it is essential that we embrace politeness and good manners. By adopting these principles, we can contribute to a noticeable decrease in crime rates and foster a healthier community.In conclusion, I believe that maintaining politeness in our busy and crowded world is crucial for the well-being of society.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Most experiences in our lives that seemed difficult at the time become valuable lessons for the future. Use reasons and specific examples to support your answer.
human: There is a famous old saying that failure is the mother of success. For that reason, some people advocate that some difficulties people met at their early ages will become an invaluable fortune in their future lives. However, some people think it isn't supposed to be that case. From my point of view, I am in favor the former statement that some tough experiences people met before will be helpful in their life path.To start with, hardship makes people realize how to cherish and compliment the common but wonderful little things happened in their life such as, a shining weather, a delicious breakfast and etc. People who have such nice spirit usually know how to find the true love in their life instead of being seduced by greed as to lose themselves in the end. As a result, experiences of difficulties teach them how to keep a nice mood and have confidence all the time.What's more, people who experienced lots of difficulties will be calmer when they are in troubles. Because they already have such experiences of overcoming some difficulties, they are conscious of what to do and how to do when fierce crisis happens. Those people are more likely to achieve their ambitions in their career because they are aware of how to lead people to reach success despite what kind of difficulties are getting in their way.So, to sum it up, both not afraid of difficulties and appreciating common but pleasant things in their lives drive me to believe that most tough experiences in people's life path will be a priceless treasure to them. Remember if you are afraid of encountering difficulties, then you will be in the troubles all the time.
llm: There is a well-known saying that failure is the mother of success. This idea leads some to argue that the challenges faced in early life can serve as invaluable lessons for the future. Conversely, others believe this isn't necessarily true. Personally, I align with the former perspective, asserting that overcoming tough experiences can significantly aid individuals on their life journeys.First and foremost, hardships help individuals appreciate and value the simple yet beautiful moments in life, such as a sunny day or a delightful breakfast. Those who maintain such a positive outlook often have a better grasp of finding genuine love, rather than being consumed by greed, which can lead to self-loss. Consequently, experiences of struggle teach individuals how to maintain a positive mindset and confidence in themselves.Moreover, individuals who have weathered numerous difficulties tend to remain calm in times of trouble. Having already navigated various challenges, they have a clear understanding of what to do during crises. Such resilience increases their chances of achieving career ambitions, as they know how to guide others toward success, regardless of the obstacles they may face.In conclusion, embracing challenges and valuing life’s simple pleasures leads me to believe that tough experiences are indeed invaluable assets on the journey of life. It's essential to recognize that fear of difficulties may lead to constant turmoil.

question: Life in a city is much better than life in the countryside
human: As far as I am concerned, I agree with the statement that life in a city is much better than life in the countryside.Firstly, in the city there is much better education system. This means, that the schools and the universities have well equipped classes and the famous professors would like to work in such places.In addition, I believe that city provides more work opportunities than the countryside. There are not only more jobs, but they are also well-paid. Of course living in a city is more expensive, but incomes are higher too.Moreover, in the urban areas there are also more citizens what means, that the culture diversity is huge. Meeting and knowing new people's tradition is an unforgettable experience, which could influence on one's previous habits.Furthermore, the city has well-organised lines of transport. The buses and trains are more frequent than in the countryside, so the city provides better communication.However, in the countryside there are many places to rest, because of its location. Moreover, peaceful and close to the nature areas could help to avoid worries and sadness.Taking all into account, I think that living in the city is much better nowadays, because of the opportunities it gives. Today living in the rural places is in most causes connected with agrarian lifestyle, which for me is without perspective. If I could decide I would chose living in the city for sure.
llm: In my opinion, I firmly believe that living in a city is significantly better than residing in the countryside. To begin with, cities offer a superior education system. Schools and universities tend to have better facilities, attracting renowned professors who prefer to work in such environments. Furthermore, I believe that urban areas provide greater job opportunities compared to rural regions. There are not only more jobs available, but they are also typically better-paying. While the cost of living in a city is higher, the increased income often offsets this expense. Additionally, cities are home to a diverse population, which enhances cultural variety. Engaging with different people and their traditions can be a truly enriching experience, potentially influencing one’s own habits and perspectives. Moreover, urban areas boast well-organized transportation systems. Public transit, like buses and trains, runs more frequently than in rural areas, facilitating better connectivity.On the other hand, the countryside offers numerous spots for relaxation due to its natural surroundings. Its peaceful environment can also help alleviate stress and sadness.Overall, I believe that city living is far more advantageous in today’s world due to the opportunities it presents. In contrast, rural life often revolves around an agrarian lifestyle, which I see as lacking in prospects. Given the choice, I would undoubtedly choose to live in the city.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Your job has more effect on your happiness than your living environment does.
human: With the development of the economy, people become more and more rich. They start to pay attention to mental requirement like happiness. While I accept that job can offer happiness to some people, I believe that living environment is more important than job for most of us.Admittedly, job can bring us happiness. People can receive a sense of values and respected from job. If people receive respect from others, they will feel achievement and self-confidence. In addition, job can provide money to us. However, people should concern more about their living environment than job. First, for most of us, job is only a tool to maintain our lives. Few people can feel happiness from their job because they have to continue to work more than 30 years. For example, Workers in the FOXCONN factory, which is the main manufacture of APPLE Company, just repeat one action more than 8 hours every day. These labor works cannot provide workers with a lot of happiness because they feel tired and frustrated after long hour work. Second, beautiful environment is one of basic physiological needs, which are the most fundamental requirements for people. Without beautiful environment, people are not able to feel happiness and will fell anxiety. Nowadays, the fast development of economy is gradually destroying our environment very quickly. Factories released a huge amount of wasters into river and soil. In order to build city and factory, people destroy huge forests. In China, some residents who live in nearby some toxic factories became sick because these factories release a lot of toxic water and wasters into environment around people. Even though local residents benefits from an increasing number of jobs which are provided by those factories, they cannot feel happiness from high-paying job yet because most of them suffer from cancer or other diseases.In conclusion, it is far better to protect our living environment rather than focus on job or work since the goal people is for good livers.
llm: As the economy evolves, people are increasingly accumulating wealth and becoming more attuned to their mental needs, such as happiness. While I acknowledge that some individuals find joy in their work, I contend that, for the majority of us, the quality of our living environment is more significant than our jobs.It's true that work can contribute to happiness. A job can provide a sense of purpose and earn individuals respect, fostering feelings of achievement and self-confidence. Additionally, employment offers financial stability.Nevertheless, individuals should prioritize their living environment over their jobs. For most, work serves primarily as a means to support their lives. Very few derive lasting happiness from their careers, especially considering the burdens of decades-long employment. For instance, workers at FOXCONN, a major manufacturer for Apple, often perform repetitive tasks for more than eight hours a day. Such monotonous labor typically leads to fatigue and frustration, diminishing any sense of happiness.Furthermore, a beautiful environment is a fundamental human need, essential for overall well-being. Without it, people struggle to experience happiness and may instead grapple with anxiety. Unfortunately, rapid economic development is taking a toll on our environment. Factories are polluting rivers and soil at alarming rates, and urban expansion often comes at the expense of vast forested areas. In China, residents living near toxic manufacturing sites have suffered from health issues due to pollutants, experiencing serious illnesses such as cancer.
