For example, those facing health concerns can research relevant information to better understand their conditions.Lastly, the internet effectively shrinks the world, which is a positive development. Individuals who may lack the time or financial resources to travel can nonetheless explore diverse destinations through the internet. They can view images and videos of interesting locations, as well as learn about various cultures and traditions, which enhances their understanding of different nations.In conclusion, many people appreciate the internet and often express gratitude for its contributions to education, business, and global exploration. With the invaluable information it offers, individuals can significantly enrich their lives.

question: Some universities require students to take classes in many subjects. Others universities require students to specialize in one subject. Which is better? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: University is the place that provides people knowledge and skills to use in their real life. Some universities require students to study in one subject. On the contrary, others require students to study in several subjects. In my point of view, studying many subjects is better that one because students can study in subjects that they interested in, they can gain knowledge more than one field and they will have more chance to choose their future.First of all, when students finished their high schools, they are confused about subjects that they are going to choose to study in universities. This is because they interested in many subjects and they want to try them all. For example, pupil who want to study science are also like to learn music. Therefore, requiring students to study in many subjects is good for them.In addition, people who know a wide range of is better than people who know just one. Students can gain more knowledge in every different subjects thy study. For instance, university students who study business are also know history of the world. Furthermore, students not only gain knowledge but they also have more experience because they will meet new friends and teachers. Hence, they all can share opinion and knowledge to one another.Finally, students who graduated with a variety of courses during university and lots of experience are definitely have more opportunity to choose their future or career. This is because graduates can work in various kind of works which they can select a job they prefer. For example, students will choose a career that they want including the job with high salary include. Moreover, bachelors can earn lots of money by working in other fields due to their knowledge.In concluding, learning several subjects in universities is better than specialize in one subject because it makes students have more chance to gain knowledge to use in their lives and opportunity to choose their own future.
llm: University is a place where individuals acquire the knowledge and skills necessary for real-life application. Some universities mandate that students specialize in a single subject, while others encourage a broader curriculum involving multiple disciplines. In my opinion, studying a variety of subjects is more beneficial than focusing on just one, as it allows students to explore their interests, gain knowledge across different fields, and enhances their future career prospects.Initially, upon graduating from high school, many students find themselves uncertain about which subject to pursue in university. This confusion often arises because they have interests in multiple areas and wish to explore them all. For example, a student interested in science might also have a passion for music. Therefore, a curriculum that requires students to engage with a variety of subjects can significantly benefit them.Moreover, individuals who possess knowledge across a broad spectrum are generally more well-rounded than those who specialize in a single area. Engaging with diverse subjects enables students to acquire a wider range of knowledge. For instance, a business major may also gain insights into world history. Additionally, students benefit from new experiences by meeting peers and teachers from various backgrounds, allowing them to exchange ideas and insights.Lastly, those who graduate with a diverse educational background and a wealth of experiences have greater opportunities when it comes to career choices. Graduates are often equipped to pursue a variety of jobs, allowing them to select roles that align with their interests. For example, they can choose careers that not only match their aspirations but often come with higher salaries. Furthermore, having knowledge across different fields can open doors to lucrative opportunities.In conclusion, pursuing multiple subjects in university is preferable to specializing in one, as it provides students with broader knowledge, greater life applications, and increased opportunities for their future careers.

question: Some people think governments should spend as much money as possible exploring outer space (for example, traveling to the Moon and to other planets). Other people disagree and think governments should spend this money for our basic needs on Earth. Which of these two opinions do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
human: Although developing technologies to discover amazing thing in galaxy is interesting, there are many people in the world are in poverty or starvation. Thus, these technologies mean nothing if people lack of prosperity. Therefore, in my opinion, I accede with notion that government should pay attention on basic needs of people first.First, as you can see that after great economic recession, many people in many countries were unemployed. Then, many people did not have money. When people did not have money, They had to rob other people. There were increasing in criminal rate in many cities. Consequently, quality of life were dropping and this make people unhappy. So that, government should invest to create more jobs. When people have jobs, they did not have to steal money. Therefore, criminal rate were drop. Thus, people have a good quality life.Second, environment is also important issue that everyone depend on it. Nowaday, industrial in many countries still emit high intense of carbon dioxide, which caused of greenhouse effect. Greenhouse effect causes of climate change. These impact on every living creature in the world. So, government take care of this issue by declare regulate to control emission of carbon dioxide. In addition to controlling emission carbon dioxide, government should invest in alternative energy such as using solar energy instead of coal energy. If we lived in good environment, our life would be better.Lastly, family is a root of society. If everyone in family did not have time to spend with each other, that family could have problems, If family had problems, it mean society could have problems. When society had problems, it could impact to a nation. Thus, government should create campaign to fill love to family. For example, setting event once a week to gather everyone in family to spend time with each other. When family understand each other, it mean society and a nation will not have much trouble.In conclusion, I personally agree with statement that government should spend money on basic people needs. The basic needs: jobs, good environment, and love in family. These three issues are the most important basic needs of people in my opinion that government should pay attention on to improve quality life of people.
llm: While the development of technologies to explore our galaxy is indeed fascinating, it is crucial to remember that many individuals around the world still face poverty and hunger. Therefore, these technological advancements are of little value if they do not contribute to the well-being of people. In my view, governments should prioritize addressing the basic needs of their citizens.Firstly, in the aftermath of significant economic recessions, many individuals in various countries find themselves unemployed and without income. This lack of financial resources can lead people to resort to crime out of desperation. As a result, crime rates often rise, leading to a decline in the quality of life and increased unhappiness within communities. To counter this, governments should invest in job creation. When people have stable employment, they are less likely to engage in theft, resulting in lower crime rates and an overall improvement in quality of life.Secondly, environmental issues are another critical concern that affects everyone. Many industries continue to emit high levels of carbon dioxide, contributing to the greenhouse effect and climate change. These changes have far-reaching consequences for all living beings. Governments should address this challenge by implementing regulations to curb carbon emissions. Additionally, investing in alternative energy sources, such as solar energy, instead of relying on coal, is essential. A healthier environment leads to a better quality of life for all.Lastly, the family unit is fundamental to society. When family members do not have the opportunity to spend time together, it can lead to issues that affect not only the family but also the broader community and, ultimately, the nation. Therefore, governments should initiate campaigns to promote family bonding. For instance, organizing weekly events that encourage families to gather can strengthen relationships. Strong family connections contribute to healthier societies and more stable nations.In conclusion, I firmly believe that governments should allocate resources to meet the basic needs of their citizens. Addressing the essential requirements of employment, a clean environment, and strong family connections are vital steps in improving people’s quality of life.

question: People have different ways of escaping the stress and difficulties of modern life. Some read, some exercise, others work in their gardens. What do you think are the best ways of reducing stress? Use specific details and examples in your answer.
human: Nowadays, we are living in in the world which is absolutely complicated. Everything seem to be rush, and it have a lot of competition. These make people get stress. Thus, many people try to reduce their stress. There are many activities that could relieve those people who are in stress. in my opinion, reducing stress by listening to music, playing sports, and doing meditation are easy and practical ways.First of all, listening to music is a great way to relax. For example, when I go to office, I use public transport. I see many things such as traffic jam, crowded people at bus stop, and all so crowded people in buses. These make me stress. So that I always listen music from my mp3 player. I could enjoy listening music without thinking of people around me. Consequently, I feel happy when I listen music.Second, another way that is perfectly work for everyone to reduce the stress is exercise. For instance, I alway have many things in my mind such as a difficult of my work that I have to finish in time. These problem sometime make me hard to fall asleep because it make me stress. Thus, after work, I always do exercise, and jogging is my favorite sport. I feel that after working out, I am easily to fall asleep. Exercising not only reduce my stress but also make me get a good health.Third, meditation also one of the ways to reduce the stress. when I have many things to think about, and this make me stress, I will do meditation. Meditation is easy way to relax because it is not require any equipment, and it take few minutes. A way to do meditation is that I just sit down, close my eyes, and count my breath. These could relieve me from stress. In conclusion, there are many ways to reduce the stress. In my point of view, listening to music, exercising, and doing meditation are the most activities that people could do to escape from stress. It is are easy and usable. And everyone should find the time to do more and more to feel better physically and in everyone mind.
llm: Today, we find ourselves in a world that is incredibly complex. Everything seems to be moving at a fast pace, and competition is everywhere. This environment often leads to increased stress for many individuals. As a result, numerous people seek ways to alleviate their stress. In my opinion, listening to music, engaging in sports, and practicing meditation are simple yet effective methods for stress relief.First and foremost, listening to music is an excellent way to unwind. For instance, when I commute to work using public transport, I encounter various stressors such as traffic jams and crowded buses. To cope with this, I always listen to music on my mp3 player. Immersed in the melodies, I can forget about the chaos around me, which brings me joy and helps me relax.Secondly, exercise is another highly effective way to reduce stress that works for everyone. For example, I often have many thoughts racing through my mind, especially regarding the challenging tasks I need to complete at work. This mental clutter can sometimes make it difficult for me to sleep due to stress. However, after finishing my workday, I make it a point to exercise, with jogging being my favorite activity. I've noticed that working out makes it much easier for me to fall asleep, and it not only alleviates my stress but also improves my overall health.Lastly, meditation is a valuable technique for managing stress. When I find myself overwhelmed with thoughts, I turn to meditation. This practice is simple and requires no special equipment; it only takes a few minutes. To meditate, I find a quiet spot, sit down, close my eyes, and focus on my breath. This practice effectively releases my stress and calms my mind.In conclusion, there are numerous strategies for reducing stress. From my perspective, listening to music, exercising, and meditating are among the most accessible activities that help individuals escape from stress. They are easy to incorporate into daily life, and everyone should prioritize these practices to improve their physical and mental well-being.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Teachers should be paid according to how much their students learn. Give specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
human: Everyone is different. Although students are in the same process of education system, learning abilities in each students are not equal. Some students are fast learner, but some students are not. Thus, paying for teacher base on grade that students got is not appropriate, and it is not fair for teacher. So that, I disagree with this notion.To begin with, in schools, main task of teacher to give knowledge to students, and this role have to finish in time. there are certain period of time for teachers to teach. In these short time, it is not possible for teachers to pay attention to individual students in class. Teachers have to manage to teach every topics by schedule. If teachers pay attention to specific students, their work might not finish on time, and this might make many student miss some field in topics that they should know.Second, learning abilities in each students is different. It is not possible that they all comprehend all lessons in the same period of time. Some students might understand all topics that they had learnt but some are not. Therefore, testing result are different. This problems depend on how hard study they do. It is not teachers fault. Thus, teachers should not be paid by testing result that students get.Lastly, there could lead to a big problem if schools pay teachers by grade that students get. That is problem in quality of education. Teacher may not care about how they have to teach to make students understand the topics. Teachers may just give high grades to get higher salary. This problem should not be happened. Therefore, grade that students get should not be in evaluating teacher.In conclusion, I totally disagree with this statement that teachers should be paid by how much their students learn because teacher could not pay attention to each students in class. Besides, learning abilities of student are different. Moreover, there are problems if paying teacher by grade students get.
llm: Every individual is unique. While students may participate in the same educational system, their learning abilities vary significantly. Some students are quick learners, while others require more time to absorb the material. Therefore, basing teacher compensation on their students' grades is inappropriate and unfair to educators. For these reasons, I disagree with this idea.Firstly, teachers have the primary responsibility of imparting knowledge to students within a limited timeframe. They follow a set curriculum, and given the constraints of the school year, it is often impractical for them to focus on the individual needs of each student in a classroom setting. Teachers must cover a variety of topics according to a predetermined schedule. If they concentrate on only a few students, they risk not completing the curriculum, which could leave many students without critical knowledge they are supposed to acquire.Secondly, students exhibit diverse learning capabilities. It is unrealistic to expect all students to grasp lessons at the same pace. While some may fully comprehend the material being taught, others may struggle. Consequently, test results will vary, reflecting the different levels of effort each student invests in their studies, rather than the effectiveness of the teacher. Therefore, it is unjust to link teachers' salaries to their students' academic performance.Finally, if schools were to compensate teachers based on students' grades, it could lead to significant issues concerning the quality of education. Educators might prioritize grade inflation to secure higher salaries, rather than genuinely focusing on helping students understand the subject matter. This scenario should be avoided at all costs, emphasizing that student grades should not be a criterion for evaluating teachers.In summary, I strongly oppose the notion that teachers should be compensated based on their students' academic results. Teachers cannot give individualized attention to every student in a classroom, and students' learning abilities differ greatly. Moreover, linking teacher pay to student grades could lead to further problems in the educational system.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Movies and television programs should present stories in which good people are rewarded and bad people are punished.
human: When we watch movies or dramas, some of us like to see good people have a good ending and bad people are punished. While there are also some people who do not like this. Personally, I prefer to see good people get rewarded. However, if the good people always get an happy ending, I don’t think it’s proper.First, if all the story end up in the same way, it will be boring. If good people always win, we can guess the ending of the movies or dramas. Then we will feel less interested in them. But if the good people are not always rewarded, we will try to finish the movie or dramas to find out the end of the story. For example, Hollywood stories usually have a happy ending like a hero beats a crime and get a girl. But now many people, including me, have been tired with it. I don’t want to see the same kind of ending again and again. So we can’t always let good people be rewarded in movies or TV programs.Even in the real world, good people can get a bad ending sometimes. And I think it happen more often in the real world than in those movies. So if children always watch the TV programs that good people get rewarded, they may think it will be true in the real world. They will be misleading by those movies. And they may act like good people in order to get reward. Once they find the good people are not always get rewarded, they may feel upset and not to be a good person. But in fact, the good people do good things no matter the ending is good or not. So we should tell this to the young children to avoid the misunderstanding.In fact, those good endings sometimes are helpful. Some people may be encouraged to do good things. But like I said, this kind of behavior won’t last long, because someday they will realize the truth. So I suggest we should show people the truth in the stories. And if they can, they will be good people no matter how the story ends.Based on my arguments above, I think movies and TV programs should present different stories in which good people get reward or get nothing.
llm: When we watch films or television shows, many of us enjoy seeing virtuous characters rewarded and villains facing consequences. Conversely, some viewers prefer different outcomes. Personally, I appreciate narratives where good people receive their due, but I believe it's important that these stories don’t always conclude happily.To begin with, if every story ends the same way, it quickly becomes monotonous. When good characters consistently triumph, the endings become predictable and, as a result, lose their allure. Conversely, if good characters don't always succeed, audiences will be compelled to watch until the conclusion to discover how it unfolds. For instance, traditional Hollywood tales often end with the hero defeating evil and finding love, but many, including myself, are growing weary of this formulaic approach. Repeatedly offering the same type of resolution diminishes its impact, suggesting that we shouldn't always grant good characters a happy ending in films and television.In reality, good individuals sometimes face unfortunate outcomes, and I believe this occurs more frequently in everyday life than in cinematic stories. If children are consistently exposed to narratives where virtuous characters are rewarded, they might come to believe that this is the norm in real life, leading to a misconception. They may strive to be good merely for the sake of reward, and when they inevitably discover that doing good doesn’t always yield positive results, they may become disheartened and less inclined to act virtuously. It’s crucial to convey to young audiences that good people engage in noble actions regardless of the outcome.While positive resolutions can be inspiring and encourage people to do good, as I mentioned earlier, such motivation may not be sustainable, as they will eventually confront reality. Therefore, I advocate for narratives that reflect the truth. If characters can embrace goodness regardless of their circumstances, audiences can appreciate genuine morality.In summary, I believe movies and television shows should offer a diverse range of narratives where good people may either receive rewards or face unjust outcomes.

question: Distance learning and online computer classes should replace classroom learning.
human: There are many advantages of distance learning, but it should not replace classroom learning. Learning in classroom could provide more information to study. Besides, learning in classroom are not only learning academic skills but also learning social skills, and learning how to solve problem in real situation. Consequently, I completely disagree with this statement that we should replace normal course with online course. I will give reasons to support my opinion.To begin with, learning in classroom could provide more information and make students more comprehend in subjects that they had learnt. Because in classroom have many equipment to demonstrate real example. For example, in biology class, learning anatomy by operating fog have many benefits. Learner could learn how to use tools and see actual organs of fog. Unlike classroom, online class just only study in textbook not learnin real situation.Secondly, online class could not provide knowledge about social skills. For instance, In a classroom, teacher could give assignment to student to work as a group. This could help students to learn how to deal with people, how to collaborate with people in their group. This important skill cannot be gotten in online classes.Lastly, learning in classroom, student could have healthier life because in school can provide exercise class which train student to move their body. Classroom have specialist trainer to teach students to it right way. If student do it by themselves, they might be hurt themselves. This make students have healthier life which online class cannot provide. In conclusion, I personally disagree this this notion that we should replace classroom with online class. Because, classroom could provide real actual example to make students more understand in their subject. Besides, classroom courses are also provide students to learn social skill. Moreover, classroom could provide exercise class to set students to have a good health. Thus, having classroom could provide abundant skills to students.
llm: Distance learning offers numerous benefits, but it should not serve as a substitute for traditional classroom education. Classroom learning not only imparts a wealth of knowledge but also fosters social skills and teaches students how to address real-world problems. Therefore, I firmly oppose the idea of replacing standard courses with online classes. I will present several reasons to support my perspective.Firstly, classroom learning provides students with a richer understanding of the subjects they study. Classrooms are equipped with various tools and resources that facilitate hands-on experiences. For instance, in a biology class, exploring anatomy by dissecting a frog offers significant advantages; students can learn how to use tools and view actual organs, which reinforces their understanding. In contrast, online classes often rely solely on textbooks and do not provide the same level of engagement with real-world scenarios.Secondly, online courses lack the opportunity for students to develop essential social skills. In a classroom setting, teachers can assign group projects that encourage collaboration and interpersonal interaction. These experiences are vital for helping students learn to navigate relationships and work effectively with others—skills that are rarely fostered in an online learning environment.Lastly, classroom education contributes to a healthier lifestyle for students by offering physical education classes that promote physical activity. With trained instructors guiding students in proper techniques, there is a lower risk of injury compared to exercising alone. This aspect of classroom learning supports students' overall well-being—something virtual classes cannot offer.In conclusion, I strongly disagree with the notion of replacing traditional classrooms with online courses. Classrooms provide crucial hands-on experiences that enhance understanding, promote the development of social skills, and support healthy living through physical education. Therefore, in-person learning environments offer a myriad of advantages that online learning cannot replicate.

question: What are some of experiences that have shaped your outlook and the way you live now.
human: Many circumstances that I experienced change the way I think. There are many experiences that are improve my life in many way. For example, I could improve the way that I solve problems, improve how I take care of my health, and improve to plan my life for future. I will give reasons to support my opinion.To begin with, studying in university taught me to be more prudent person to solve problems. For example, in math class, the way that we learnt to find an answer by doing step by step. Start with find cause of problem and the way to do research to solve the problem. I could adapt this method to use my real life. When I want to go to somewhere, I try to find the way to reach to destination. Which ways are shortest and which ways are less consume my time. I could find a better way to solve problems.Secondly, Some experiences could teach me the way to take care of myself. For instance, reading and listening the news about choosing a good diet are the way to keep myself are more healthy. Thus, I am always buy a quality food such as organic food. This food are not have chemical. So that, I can have a good health. This experience teach me to aware my health.Lastly, experiences are also change to plan for my future life. For example, I read about saving money for my retire is a good plan for my life. Consequently, I start changing myself from spending many thing that I want to saving money for my entire life. This experience change me to concern about making plan for my future life.In conclusion, experiences that shape my thinking and the way to live my life are teach me to be a better person. Because I could find a better way to solve problems. Besides, experiences could shape me to be more aware about my health. Moreover, these experiences could make me to make plan for my future life. These experiences taught me to change my life to be a better person.
llm: The various experiences I've encountered have significantly influenced my thinking. Many of these moments have enhanced my life in numerous ways. For instance, they've helped me improve my problem-solving skills, take better care of my health, and plan more effectively for the future. I will present some reasons to support my perspective.Firstly, my time at university has made me a more thoughtful problem solver. In particular, math classes taught me to approach problems methodically, starting by identifying the root cause and conducting research to find solutions. I've been able to apply this step-by-step method in my everyday life. For instance, when I need to travel to a new place, I analyze the different routes to determine which one is the quickest and most efficient. This approach has led me to discover more effective ways to solve various problems.Secondly, certain experiences have shown me the importance of self-care. For example, staying informed about healthy diets through news articles and reports has motivated me to choose better food options. As a result, I consistently buy high-quality organic products that are free from chemicals, helping me maintain my health. This experience has made me more conscious of my well-being.Finally, my experiences have also reshaped how I plan for my future. For instance, I learned that saving money for retirement is essential for long-term stability. Consequently, I’ve started changing my habits by cutting unnecessary expenses to ensure I can save for the long haul. This realization has encouraged me to take my future planning more seriously.In conclusion, the experiences that have shaped my mindset and lifestyle have made me a better person. They have enabled me to find improved ways to solve problems, become more health-conscious, and plan for my future thoughtfully. Overall, these lessons have led me to make meaningful changes in my life for the better.

question: Many people have learned a foreign language in their own country, others have learned a foreigh language in the country in which it is spoken. Which is better? Give the advantages of each and support your viewpoint.
human: Knowing foreign language is became more and more important in this time. Many people pursue to study foreign language. There are two options to learn foreign language. First is stay in homeland to study foreign language. The second option is that go to study in another place that foreign language are spoken. Going to another place to learn language is better choice. I will give reasons to support my opinion.To begin with, going to another country to learn language is a good environment to stimulate people to learn language. For example, everyone around me speaks foreign language, and then I have to improve myself to communicate with people. If I could not communicate with other people, I could not even buy food to sacrifice my hunger. This environment makes me want to develop myself to be able to communicate with people that speak foreign language.Secondly, having friend that speaks another language is help people to professional in that language faster. For instance, English school in outside my home country, there are many people that come from different places and from different languages. The only language that I could talk to make friends is English language. Thus, I could talk with my friend without worrying about speaking wrong. This reason makes me have a progress in foreign language faster.In conclusion, I personally believe that learning language from foreign country is better than learning language in home country because I have to improve myself to communicate with other people. Besides, in foreign country I could have a chance to speak foreign language with my friends. Learning foreign language form another country is better choice for me to study language.
llm: In today's world, proficiency in foreign languages is becoming increasingly important. Many individuals are eager to learn a new language, and there are two primary approaches to doing so. The first option is to study a foreign language in one's home country, while the second is to travel to a country where the language is spoken. I believe that studying a language abroad is the superior choice, and I will outline my reasons for this viewpoint.Firstly, immersing oneself in a different country provides an excellent environment for language learning. For example, if everyone around me speaks the foreign language, I am encouraged to enhance my skills in order to communicate effectively. If I struggle to communicate, I might even find it difficult to perform basic tasks, like buying food. This immersive environment motivates me to improve and become proficient in conversing with native speakers.Secondly, having friends who speak the target language can significantly accelerate the learning process. For instance, at an English school abroad, I would meet people from various backgrounds, with diverse native languages. English would be the common language for making friends, allowing me to engage in conversations without the fear of making mistakes. This kind of interaction helps me make quicker progress in mastering the language.In conclusion, I firmly believe that studying a foreign language in another country is preferable to learning it at home. The necessity to communicate with others and the opportunity to practice with friends in an immersive setting greatly enhance the learning experience. For me, learning a foreign language abroad is undoubtedly the best option.

question: If you could change one important thing about your hometown, what would you change? Use reasons and specific examples to support your answer.
human: Public utilities and surroundings are the primary factors which we basically consider before we decide to live in a place. However, it is difficult to find a community which can perfectly meet our requirements. In my hometown, there are almost complete public utilities for one’s needs but transportation. So the thing that I really want to change is to have more public transportation. Since I’m facing the traffic congestion every day. And this problem seem to get worst. At first, it should have more alternatives to use public transportation, such as a subway train or a sky train. Hence, people will have more ways to go to a place. Since now buses are only a kind of public transportation in this community, It makes people in this area have no choice. They must take only a bus to go to another place. If a subway and a sky train are available here, it will be more convenience to them. For example, people can estimate time from taking a subway train due to the train schedule. On the contrary they cannot do so in case of a bus. Also, this improvement will decrease a bad traffic on the road indirectly. Secondly, the buses provide merely two routes in this community. It is absolutely a major problem. For example, if a place I intend to go is not in the route of buses, I still have to take a bus that does not bring me to my destination but go to the center station first to exchange to another bus. Obviously, it is waste of time. They should increase more routes to make people transport more easily.Lastly, having more kinds of public transportation can dwindle the number of people using their own cars. Also, it provides many advantages. For instance, people can save their expenses form gasoline, which nowadays is getting more expensive. The necessary energy will slowly be used up, since people use less their own cars.To sum up, the transportation is an elementary factor which directly affects to people’s living. I wish one day this problem would be changed. And then, the transportation in my hometown is no longer difficult for everyone in this community.
llm: Public utilities and the surrounding environment are crucial considerations when choosing a place to live. However, finding a community that fully meets our needs can be challenging. In my hometown, basic public utilities are mostly available, except for transportation. Consequently, my primary desire is for improved public transportation, as I face daily traffic congestion that appears to be worsening.To address this issue, there should be more options for public transportation, such as the introduction of a subway or sky train. This would offer residents greater flexibility in choosing how to travel. Currently, buses are the only form of public transport available in the area, leaving people with no alternatives. If we had subway and sky train services, it would enhance convenience for everyone. For instance, commuters can rely on train schedules for time estimates, something that is not possible with bus services. Furthermore, these improvements could contribute to reduced traffic congestion on the roads.Another significant issue is that the existing bus routes are limited to just two. This poses a major inconvenience; for example, if I want to reach a destination not covered by the bus routes, I must first take a bus to the central station before transferring to another one. This results in unnecessary delays. Expanding the number of routes would make transportation much more accessible.Moreover, increasing the variety of public transportation options could lead to a decline in the number of people using their personal vehicles. This shift would not only save individuals money on gasoline—which is becoming increasingly expensive—but it would also help conserve vital energy resources as people rely less on cars.In conclusion, transportation is a fundamental aspect that directly impacts quality of life. I hope that one day, this issue will be addressed, and that transportation in my hometown will become more efficient and convenient for everyone in the community.

question: Schools should ask students to evaluate their teachers. Do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Getting opinions from many sources could augment people's performance. Thereby, evaluating from students is one of the ways to improve quality of educational system. Not only teachers could amplify their performance but the whole education system are also improve performance from evaluation made by students. Therefore, I agree with this notion that students should be asked to evaluate their teachers.To begin with, Evaluating teachers made by students could improve teachers' performance. For example, evaluation made by students is similar to feedback from customer that business owners need to know in order to improve their product. Students might complain about their teachers spoke too fast that students could not catch up on information. Consequently, teachers could improve themselves by speaking slower to make sure that students could get all information that they want to give. Therefore, evaluating from students could improve teachers' performance.Additionally, this evaluation from students could improve schools' quality. Teachers could augment their quality. Consequently, When school gather teachers that have great performance, school are gaining higher quality. For instance, in many cooperation such as Microsoft that could produce many great products because they have employees whose performance are very high. Schools could produce intellectual students because school have teachers who are always improve their quality from evaluation made by students.Finally, people who get the most advantage from evaluation is students. Students could study in class that have teachers who have experienced and greater performance. Because teachers are always adapt the way they teach in order to make students easy to understand their subjects, students could comprehend their subject easily. As a result, students, who study from great schools which have great performance teacher, graduate with great knowledge to survive in next steps of life.In conclusion, I agree with this statement that school should ask students to evaluate their teachers because teachers could improve their performance. Moreover, schools are also improve their quality because they have high performance teachers. Furthermore, students are easy to understand their subjects. Thus, I believe that there are benefits to ask students to evaluate their teachers.
llm: Gathering feedback from various sources can significantly enhance performance. One effective approach to improving the quality of the education system is to solicit evaluations from students. Not only can this feedback empower teachers to enhance their effectiveness, but it can also lead to overall improvements in the educational framework. Therefore, I support the idea that students should be invited to assess their teachers.To start with, student evaluations can lead to better teacher performance. For instance, this feedback is akin to the insights that business owners seek from customers to refine their products. If students express concerns about a teacher's pacing, such as speaking too quickly for them to absorb the material, teachers can adjust their delivery to ensure all students grasp the information effectively. Thus, student evaluations play a crucial role in elevating teaching standards.Furthermore, evaluations from students can enhance the quality of schools. Improved teacher performance contributes to a stronger educational environment. When schools employ teachers who consistently perform well, the overall educational quality rises. For example, companies like Microsoft achieve success by employing high-performing individuals. Similarly, schools can cultivate intellectually capable students by retaining teachers who continuously seek to improve based on student feedback.Lastly, the primary beneficiaries of these evaluations are the students themselves. They are more likely to learn effectively from experienced and high-performing teachers who adapt their teaching styles to facilitate comprehension. As a result, students who attend schools with exceptional educators graduate equipped with the knowledge necessary for their future endeavors.In conclusion, I firmly believe that schools should encourage students to evaluate their teachers, as this practice promotes improved teacher performance. Additionally, it enhances the overall quality of the educational institution by fostering skilled educators. Ultimately, students benefit from more accessible learning experiences. Therefore, involving students in the evaluation process has significant advantages.

question: Some people prefer to work for a large company. Others prefer to work for a small company. Which would you prefer? Use specific reasons and details to support your choice.
human: Companies vary from small to large ones based on the context, success and needs of their work. Small companies usually have a local job in the area, while large companies work in an international context providing for the entire nation or even for other foreign countries. I personally prefer to work for a large company for several reasons.First, to find a job in a large company is way more easier than to find a job in a small company. Large companies always look for new skilled employees to fill in their need of distributing, managing and selling their products in different countries. For example, if a large company decides to open a branch in a foreign country, they would need more employees in that country to work there. In other words, Large company equals more job opportunity.Second, I think that a large company can give better salaries than a smaller one. The fact that a company is a large one, this means that it's having a considerable success. In other words, this means that the company can give more salaries to its employees. For instance, common sense would tell us that a famous and international known company won't give the same salary as a small local company.Third, I love travelling around the world. large companies have an international reputation, as they organize international conferences, meetings and workshops which will give me the opportunity to travel in different countries and meet new people. As well as learning new skills in my field from these workshops.In conclusion, i can certainly state that I would rather prefer working in a large company than in a small one. I have different reasons to hold that, such as having a better chance to find work, having a better salary and having the opportunity to travel around the world to attend international conferences.
llm: Companies can range from small to large based on their context, success, and operational needs. Small businesses typically focus on local markets, while larger companies often operate on an international scale, serving not just their home country but also foreign markets. Personally, I lean towards working for a large company for several reasons.First, securing a job in a large company tends to be easier than in a small one. Large corporations are always on the lookout for skilled workers to help them with distribution, management, and sales across various countries. For example, when a large company opens a new branch in another country, it needs to hire additional employees to staff that location. Simply put, a larger company often means more job opportunities.Second, I believe that large companies are more likely to offer better salaries than their smaller counterparts. The size of a company usually reflects its level of success, which in turn allows it to provide higher wages. It’s generally understood that a well-known, globally recognized company can afford to pay more than a small local firm.Third, I have a passion for traveling. Large companies, known for their international presence, frequently host global conferences, meetings, and workshops, offering me the chance to travel to different countries and connect with new people. These events also provide opportunities to learn new skills relevant to my field.In conclusion, I can confidently say that I would prefer to work for a large company rather than a small one. My reasons include greater job availability, better salary prospects, and the opportunity to travel internationally for conferences.

question: Some people believe that a college or university education should be available to all students. Others believe that higher education should be available only to good students. Discuss these views. Which view do you agree with? Explain why.
human: No one can disagree that knowledge is the most important for everyone. College and university are playing in an important role to provide academic skills to people in order to pursue their goal. There are an issue that some people agree that this opportunity should be preserved for good students however there are others people who think that everyone should have this chance to gain these advance skills from college or university. This issue will be discussed.First of all, many people think that college and university should consider students to study with them only if they are good students. The reason is that studying in advance education take a huge of money. College and university do not want people who not qualify for to waste their money in these expensive courses and waste their time. They believe that only good students have potentials to success programs more that those who are not considered as good students. Consequently, mediocre students are not have a chance to gain these advance knowledge from college and university.On the other hand, there are some people think that all students should have equal opportunity to study in higher education. Of course, higher education take a lot of money and a lot of time however moderate students should have a chance to try. Everyone that has strongly ambition could pursue and success their goal even they are not classified as a good student because people can change. With a good environment in college or university is encouraging students to study harder for a good future. Thus, mediocre students should have opportunity to be trained in college and university.In conclusion, I personally agree with that college and university should be available for all students who want to pursue their goal. Students can have opportunity to learn, to practice, to gain more knowledge for their career and for their future. Studying in college and university is a great opportunity that all students should have.
llm: It is universally acknowledged that knowledge is essential for everyone. Colleges and universities play a vital role in equipping individuals with the academic skills necessary to achieve their goals. However, there is a debate surrounding whether access to these opportunities should be limited to high-achieving students or made available to all. This topic warrants further exploration.On one hand, many believe that colleges and universities should admit only those students who demonstrate academic excellence. The reasoning behind this viewpoint is that higher education often entails significant financial investment. Institutions prefer to avoid admitting individuals who may not meet the necessary qualifications, as this could lead to wasted resources and time on costly courses. Proponents argue that only those with a proven track record of success are likely to excel in rigorous programs, thereby leaving little room for average students to acquire advanced knowledge.Conversely, others contend that all students deserve an equal opportunity to pursue higher education. While it is true that attending college or university requires a considerable investment of both time and money, even average students should have the chance to prove themselves. With strong ambition and determination, individuals who may not initially be viewed as top students can still achieve their goals and experience personal growth. A supportive college environment can inspire these students to work harder and strive for a better future. Thus, providing access to education for all students, regardless of their initial academic standing, is crucial.In conclusion, I firmly believe that colleges and universities should be open to all students who wish to pursue their aspirations. This access allows students to learn, practice, and acquire valuable skills for their careers and futures. Attending college or university represents an invaluable opportunity that should be afforded to every student.

question: Playing Computer Games wastes time and students should not be allowed to play it.Ê
human: It is a debatable subject that children should not be allowed to play computer games since playing computer games is a a waste of time. I hold a positive view against this opinion. First and foremost, a large number of students are obsessed in on-line computer games and as a result their performance in school are declined. An investigation done by Beijing University shows that 80% of the students who failed in the final exam paid 2 hours or more on-online games every week, while 90% excellent students expressed that they did not touch computer games during the most of the days. Recent research by Scientist also reveals that the youngs are more likely to be attacted by and lose themselves in these computer games, because of their low control ability. Second, children could learn nothing from these computer games, therefore time on this activity is really time wasting. Since all these games are developed for commercial purpose and in order to catch the eyes of the children, majority of the games use war, violence, bloody, or sexual subjects to lure the students. However, those subjects are not suitable for the students and will bring bad effects to the youths. Admittedly, there are a few students paying considerable time on the computer games playing finally choose computer games related jobs as their career. But we have to realize the fact: majority of the students failed in front of the computer games playing and they use their time for studying, sleeping and physical exerice to play these computer games. It is not uncommon that the teenages are found sleepless for several days playing on-line games at public internet bar, and there are also some media reports regarding the sudden death case of the teenages in the internet bar. In conclusion, I believe it is better that children are not be allowed to play the computer games. The computer games are like cigerate to adults and we need to set up rules to regulate this area.
llm: The topic of whether children should be permitted to play computer games is a contentious one, particularly given the argument that gaming is a waste of time. I hold a contrary viewpoint on this matter.Firstly, many students have developed an obsession with online gaming, which negatively impacts their academic performance. A study conducted by Beijing University found that 80% of students who failed their final exams played online games for two or more hours each week, while 90% of high-achieving students reported that they rarely engaged with computer games. Recent research also indicates that young people are particularly vulnerable to becoming immersed in these games due to their limited self-regulation.Secondly, children often gain little to no educational value from playing these games, rendering the time spent on them essentially wasted. Most games are designed for commercial gain and frequently incorporate themes of war, violence, and sexuality to capture children's attention. These themes are inappropriate for young audiences and can have detrimental effects on their development.It is true that a small number of students who dedicate significant time to gaming ultimately pursue careers in related fields. However, it is crucial to acknowledge that the majority of students who indulge in these games often neglect their studies, sleep, and physical activity in favor of gaming. Instances of teenagers staying awake for days at internet cafes while gaming are not uncommon, and there have even been alarming reports about sudden deaths of young people in these establishments.In conclusion, I believe it is in the best interest of children to prohibit them from playing computer games. These games can be likened to cigarettes for adults, and we must implement regulations to manage this aspect of youth culture.

question: Do you think classmates or colleagues should work on projects in person or by e-mails. Why?
human: When it comes to the question whether classmates or colleagues should work on projects in person or by email, I am of the view that wok in person is preferred because this means help to achieve a good communication. Firstly, team members may have different views and they need to reach a union opinion efficiently. Obviously, discussion face to face in a meeting is much better than by emails. An experiment conducted by the Beijing University asked two groups of people to discuss the budget of an activity. The first group was asked to discuss in person, while the second group was asked to discuss by email. The result shows that the 1st group used 30 minutes to reach the agreement on the budget, while it takes 30 hours for the later one. The similar experiment done by other scientist show the same result that people can reach an agreement quickly if they could talk to each other. Secondly, work in person can indirectly improve the quality and the efficiency of the project because there will be less conflicts or fight amongst the team members. Writing an email for an informal matter will make that matter looks official, therefore people who receives the email may feel nervous or maybe feel offended by the words in writing. While if the same words are expressed in talking, the counterparty will feel more relaxed since their response will not be recorded and they will not misunderstand the informal discussion to an official claim. Therefore, less misunderstanding leads to less conflicts and fights, and enhance the communication amongst the team members. Admittedly, sometimes we have to use emails if the team members are not located in the same place. Although emails are not convenient for the work but it is better than none. Since it is a classroom or campus projects, there is few possibility that the project members are located in different areas. While we should realize that in a project, there are numerous coordination works are required, if each opinion is communicated via email, there will be hundreds or thousands of emails there that we know this is not a good experience. In conclusion, I prefer the project members to work in person rather them by email because work in person will be more efficient.
llm: When considering whether classmates or colleagues should collaborate on projects in person or via email, I believe that in-person interaction is preferable as it fosters better communication. Firstly, team members often have differing perspectives, and they need to arrive at a consensus efficiently. Clearly, face-to-face discussions are far more effective than email exchanges. A study conducted by Beijing University divided participants into two groups to discuss the budget for an activity. The first group met in person, while the second group communicated via email. The results showed that the first group reached an agreement in just 30 minutes, while the email group took a staggering 30 hours. Similar studies by other researchers have demonstrated that individuals can come to agreements more swiftly through direct conversation.Secondly, working in person can enhance both the quality and efficiency of a project, as it reduces the likelihood of conflicts among team members. Communicating via email about informal matters can lend an official tone, making recipients feel anxious or potentially offended by the written words. In contrast, when discussing the same topics in person, participants are likely to feel more at ease, as their responses aren't recorded and they won't misinterpret informal exchanges as formal declarations. This reduction in misunderstandings leads to fewer conflicts and better communication within the team.Of course, there are times when emails are necessary, particularly if team members are not located in the same place. While emails may not be the most convenient option, they are still preferable to having no communication at all. However, for classroom or campus projects, it is often the case that all project members are nearby.It’s important to recognize that projects require significant coordination, and relying on email for every opinion can lead to an overwhelming number of messages, creating a less effective experience. In conclusion, I strongly prefer that project members work in person rather than relying on email, as in-person collaboration is more efficient.

question: Some people think university professors should spend more time doing research while others think they should spend more time educating students. What is your view?
human: These days, more and more university professors are involved in scientific research. Some are afraid that this will lead to the decline of education quality and suggest them to spend more time on teaching. However, according to my experiences, professors should be encouraged to mainly do research.First of all, doing research is a method of self-improvement for professors. Universities are relatively fenced environment. The research projects provide communication with the outside. In addition, by doing research, professors could catch up with the latest development of modern technologies. I still remembered that my professor took part in several research projects when I was in college. He was often invited to do speech in other universities. Although my university is not in the high-ranking list, he gained a reputation by those projects. The research projects like windows opened to the wider world.Secondly, professors should fully use the research-friendly environment provided by universities. It is very common to see state-of-the-art laboratories in the campus. Also, you could not find another place with so much talent people gathering together. Consequently, there is really no reason to discourage professors from using those advantages. We all know that Einstein developed the theory of general relativity when he was a professor in HU Berlin. Universities positively contribute the professors' success. Last but not least, doing research could also improve the teaching quality. With the help of research projects, professors could lead their students into the practical world from the classroom. They can easily teach students how to imply the knowledge in practice. I still remembered the experience of being an assistant in one of my professor's research project. By participating in it, I had opportunities to use theories on textbooks in real life experiments. The research project provides a more efficient way of teaching. For those reasons, it is natural to support the professors spending more time on doing research. While extending the way of their own development, the outcomes of the researches will also benefit the whole society.
llm: Increasingly, university professors are engaging in scientific research. Some people express concerns that this trend may diminish the quality of education and advocate for professors to allocate more time to teaching. However, based on my experiences, I believe that professors should be encouraged to prioritize research.Firstly, engaging in research serves as a significant avenue for self-improvement for professors. Universities often create a somewhat insular environment, and research projects offer valuable opportunities for interaction beyond their campuses. Moreover, involvement in research allows professors to stay abreast of the latest advancements in modern technology. I recall that during my college years, one of my professors participated in several research initiatives and was frequently invited to give talks at other institutions. Despite my university not being among the top-ranked, he earned considerable recognition through these projects. Research endeavors act as gateways to the broader world.Secondly, professors can take full advantage of the research-friendly atmosphere that universities provide. Campuses often boast cutting-edge laboratories, and they attract a diverse pool of talented individuals. Therefore, there is little justification for discouraging professors from leveraging these resources. A well-known example is Albert Einstein, who developed the theory of general relativity while working as a professor at the University of Berlin. Universities play a crucial role in fostering the success of faculty members.Lastly, conducting research can enhance the quality of teaching. Through research initiatives, professors can guide their students from theoretical knowledge to practical applications. I remember serving as an assistant in one of my professor's research projects, where I had the chance to apply textbook theories to real-life experiments. Such projects offer a more effective teaching method.For these reasons, it is reasonable to advocate for professors to dedicate more time to research. This pursuit not only fosters their personal growth but also generates outcomes that benefit society as a whole.

question: Do you learn better by yourself or with a teacher ?
human: Every person learn in their own manner which they think that is most expedient to them. As for the learning by yourself, it has some certain profit. It gives you a chance to concentrate on what you learn cause there is no one who distracts your attention in presence of you, and your learning becomes more profound. In addition, the learning with a teacher makes us bear more burdens of studies cause they assign us homework, Nevertheless, I prefer to learn with a teacher rather than learn by myself. Firstly, The distinguishing fact of the learning with a teacher is that you can ask about problems related your studies. In other words, when we encounter difficulty in our study which we can not make out, that asking the difficulty from our teacher is propitious way for us to solve it instantly. In addition, professors and teachers have much experience and knowledge, and are so dextrous with letting students understand their study. They know something which are not incorporated in such materials as books and webpages. Hence I, in my class, often communicate with my teacher to find a coordinated answer to a my faced problem, and my classmates are so accustomed to communicating with the teacher. Secondly, in my mind, the learning with a teacher is more efficient than by myself. We can accomplish our assignments with little help of a teacher within less time than do it by ourself. Furthermore, the teachers play important role in leading us to right direction. Moreover, This gives us opportunity to rise our educational level to an exited degree. knowledge may be thereby better improved and strengthened.Finally, of course, being without a teacher has shortcomings. Notable one of the shortcomings is that if someone faced so complicated confusion in his study and his many endeavors on making out it were miscarried, this might be ended in disappointment. I think that for one who depends on only himself in learning, his improvement of ability, with regard to cooperation and express his opinion, is unpromising. Hence I support this point that the learning with a teacher is better.
llm: Every individual learns in their own way, choosing methods that they find most effective. Self-directed learning certainly has its advantages. It allows for complete focus on the material, free from distractions, leading to deeper understanding. However, I personally prefer learning with a teacher rather than learning independently.Firstly, one of the key benefits of learning from a teacher is the ability to ask questions about challenging topics. When we encounter difficulties that we cannot resolve on our own, reaching out to a teacher provides an immediate pathway to finding solutions. Additionally, teachers possess a wealth of knowledge and experience, which they use to help students grasp complex concepts. They often share insights that go beyond what is found in textbooks or online resources. In my classes, I frequently engage with my teachers to address any issues I encounter, and my classmates do the same, making communication an integral part of our learning process.Secondly, I believe that learning with a teacher is more efficient than studying alone. With a teacher’s guidance, we can complete our assignments more quickly and effectively than we might on our own. Teachers help steer us in the right direction and provide invaluable support, facilitating significant academic growth and enhancing our understanding of the subject matter.Lastly, while self-study has its downsides, one significant drawback is the potential for frustration. If a student encounters a complex problem and struggles to resolve it, they may feel disheartened after repeated unsuccessful attempts. Moreover, relying solely on oneself for learning can hinder the development of collaborative skills and the ability to express thoughts clearly. For these reasons, I firmly advocate that learning with a teacher is more beneficial.

question: Technology designed to make people's lives simpler often turns out to make them more complicated.
human: Many people think they are blessed to be in the era of high technology. With newly developing technologies, people are able to carry various tasks more convenient and easy. For example, we no longer have to travel to DMV to renew our driver's license or drive to bank for sending money. Ancient people would probably think that we are like magicians. However, even with all the conveniences, we would have to admit that technologies made our lives more complicated. There are couple reasons and examples to support my answer.Of course, new technologies are always great. However, it takes time for people to adapt them. Since we are informed with devices that are produced with new features nearly every day, many people often get lost. For instance, I use new Iphone which I personally think is great. However, even though I used it for couple months, I still do not know how to use all the features proficiently. At first, I tried to go through all the instructions but, soon, I gave up because I found out that it is time-consuming and there are too many things to learn. Next, technology destroys the language. Ever since people used computers or cellphones to chat with others, they created their own language to communicate. Because people try to type as fast as they are talking, they use a lot of abbreviations and broken language. This has gotten worse with twitter, myspace, and facebook. What are even worse, young people who are still in the early ages are exposed to them and impeded by the newly developed inventions. To clarify, my younger brother does not know how to spell the words correctly and he talks to his friends with terms that I have never heard of. I have tried to correct him for couple times but he just thinks that I am too conservative.Although technologies allowed us to have a convenient life, it has made our lives more chaotic according to the reasons mentioned above.
llm: Many individuals feel fortunate to live in an age of advanced technology. With the emergence of new innovations, daily tasks have become more convenient and accessible. For instance, we no longer need to visit the DMV to renew our driver's licenses or travel to a bank to send money. People from earlier times might regard our capabilities as magical. However, despite these conveniences, we must acknowledge that technology has also complicated our lives. There are several reasons and examples to illustrate this point. Certainly, new technologies are beneficial, but adapting to them can be challenging. With new devices constantly being released, many people often feel overwhelmed. Take my experience with the latest iPhone; while I find it impressive, I still struggle to master all its features even after using it for a few months. Initially, I attempted to read through the instructions, but I quickly abandoned that plan because it proved too time-consuming, and there was simply too much to learn. Additionally, technology is eroding language skills. Since the advent of computers and cellphones for communication, people have developed their own shorthand, relying heavily on abbreviations and incomplete sentences. This trend has intensified with the rise of social media platforms like Twitter, MySpace, and Facebook. Even more concerning is the impact on younger generations who are exposed to these linguistic shortcuts. For instance, my younger brother has difficulty spelling words correctly and uses slang that is foreign to me. Although I've tried to help him improve, he dismisses my efforts, labeling me as overly traditional.In summary, while technology has undoubtedly enhanced our convenience, it has also contributed to a more chaotic existence, as illustrated by the points mentioned above.

question: Nowadays, distance-learning programs are such common thing for us, but some people argue that they're not as good as those by attending in a college or university in person. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: There are some people who believe that distance learning and online computer classes should replace classroom learning while there are some people who strongly disagree with this opinion. As far as I am concerned, I strongly believe that online classes should never replace classroom learning. I list my reasons as follows.First, indeed classroom learning is the best way to provide education comparing to online classes. In the classroom environment you can learn from your classmates, because if you see any of your classmates who is performing better, it will force you for making your performance more better. For example, When I was in First Year in B Com, I was not serious in my study, but when I saw some of my friends who took better grades than me, it influenced me and I intended to do better in my subjects. Finally I got 1st rank in final exam.Second, in classroom learning you have to complete study work on time. It makes you perfect in time management skills. Moreover you can learn by participating in group studies how to communicate with others. It makes you communication and of course your group skills better, which can help you in your future and career.Third, professors play vital role in classroom learning, most of them are specialists is their subjects, and they help you by giving valuable information and useful skills. You can improve your skills by work under any professor; you can ask questions face to face, it will clear your doubts. In result you learn quickly. For example, I have my personal experience. For Toefl IBT Coaching first I was depend on some online courses, but after 1 month I realized that I was wasting my time so I joined an institute for preparation of Toefl IBT, and in 1 month I felt that my English skills have been improving faster.It's undeniable that online classes have some advantages so they could be used as supplementary, but they could not be substitute of existing classroom learning. From the discussed above, we can easily draw the conclusion that the classroom learning is the best way to provide education for these reasons.
llm: Some individuals believe that distance learning and online courses should replace traditional classroom education, while others strongly oppose this view. Personally, I firmly believe that online classes should never supplant in-person learning. Here are my reasons.Firstly, classroom education is fundamentally more effective than online learning. A classroom setting allows for interaction with classmates, which can be a significant motivator for improvement. For instance, during my first year of a Bachelor of Commerce program, I was not particularly focused on my studies. However, witnessing some of my peers achieve higher grades inspired me to elevate my own performance, ultimately leading me to secure the top rank in my final exam.Secondly, classroom learning encourages timely completion of assignments, fostering essential time management skills. Additionally, through participating in group studies, you learn valuable communication and teamwork abilities that can benefit your future career.Thirdly, instructors play a crucial role in the classroom environment. Most teachers are specialists in their fields and provide valuable insights and practical skills. Engaging with professors allows you to ask questions in real-time, which clarifies any doubts and accelerates your learning. From my own experience, when I first relied on online courses for TOEFL IBT preparation, I soon realized that I was not making the progress I hoped for. After a month, I decided to enroll in an institute, where my English skills improved significantly in just one month.While it is true that online classes do have their advantages and can serve as supplementary resources, they should never replace traditional classroom learning. In conclusion, classroom education remains the most effective method of delivering education for the reasons outlined above.

question: In some countries, teenagers have jobs while they are still students. Do you think this is a good idea? Support your opinion by using specific reasons and details.
human: When we talk about student, we generally mean a boy or a girl who study in school or college. In some country, teenage students have the opportunity to do some part time job beside their study. However, some people do not support the concept of teenagers doing job beside study. In my view, it is good for a teenager to do a part time job while he/she is still a student and this is for two reasons.The main reason is that students can learn lots of things from part time job, before starting their real job. Students can learn about time management, money management and convince people by their words. For example, when I was in my high school I worked as a sales-man in a shop for a year. As i had to spend some of my time in my job, therefore, i had to manage my time efficiently. I had to manage my boss as well as had to prepare my homework. This taught me how to manage time efficiently and do any job quickly and effectively. Moreover, I learn money management. When my boss was out of the shop, i had to manage the accounts section of the shop. From this i learned, how to manage money correctly. This experience taught me, doing part time job can help students to learn many things.Another reason is that from part time jobs students can earn money, which can help their parents. For instance, when i was in high school I worked as a home tutor. I taught math to two kids of my neighbor. I helped them to understand the difficult topics of the books. By tutoring them, i earned some money and bought me books with it. Moreover, after taking that part time job i stopped taking my pocket money form my parents. As you can see, part time job can help students earn money and which can help their parents financially.In sum, I am sure; some people will oppose the idea of part time job for students. They will argue, it can destruct students from their study. However, as i did part time job in my high school and it did not hurt my academic result; therefore, i believe part time job will be good for students. Every Student should do part time job beside their study if they want to prepare more efficiently for their future.
llm: When we refer to a student, we typically mean a young person, whether male or female, who is enrolled in school or college. In some countries, teenagers are allowed to work part-time jobs alongside their studies. However, there are those who oppose the idea of teenagers juggling work with their education. Personally, I believe that taking on a part-time job is beneficial for students for two main reasons.Firstly, part-time jobs provide students with valuable lessons before they enter the workforce full-time. Through these jobs, they can acquire skills in time management, financial management, and persuasive communication. For instance, during my high school years, I worked as a salesperson in a shop for a year. Because I had to allocate time for both work and school, I learned to manage my schedule effectively. Balancing my responsibilities to my boss alongside my homework taught me how to work quickly and efficiently.
