For example, players frequently engage in scenarios where their characters kill or shoot, potentially leading to a rise in aggressive conduct and hindering effective communication.Conversely, some people view this issue from a different perspective. The rapid advancement of the internet has facilitated instant electronic communication, allowing users to connect quickly via various apps like WeChat. This shift has made it easier for individuals to exchange messages without the need for face-to-face interaction, effectively bridging communication gaps.In conclusion, while mobile phones offer significant conveniences in communication, they also contribute to various social problems.

question: Modern forms of communication such as email and messaging have reduced the amount of time people spend seeing their friends. This has had a negative effect on their social lives. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Undoubtedly, the movement of modern forms of communication has changed better, which help people to interact to others, such as email and messaging without limitation time. I totally agree that using of these soft devices have cut much of time people need to see with their relatives. However, it is had some demerits on their social lives.Mentioned to societies life style, they constantly use these kinds of electronic letter for making fellowship or just continuing theirs what they already had. Obviousness, there are other ways like social media that they could to use it for meeting theirs buddies such as Twitter and Facebook, also make the communication become feasible and limitless of time.Another perspective, using of these facilities has influenced netizens to keep themselves becoming unsociable. It caused they were swept away by virtual atmosphere, so they do not do much social live interactions with others. The consequence of this case made some people become geek, as too much of using email and messaging, without direct contacts. However, people have had own minded to keep connection with their friends as a good relationship, meet them and talk by face to face directly.In conclusion, I admittedly and strongly agree that the merits of email and messaging have reduced amount of ours time to communicate to. Besides, we need to make sure for the real gathering with our colleague.
llm: The evolution of modern communication tools has undeniably improved the way people interact, allowing for seamless connections through platforms such as email and messaging—without any time constraints. I completely agree that these technological advancements have significantly reduced the time people spend meeting their loved ones. However, there are also some drawbacks to their social lives.In contemporary society, many people rely heavily on electronic communication to foster or maintain their friendships. It is evident that there are also other platforms, such as Twitter and Facebook, that facilitate meeting up with friends, making communication easy and available at any time.On the other hand, the excessive use of these digital tools has led some individuals to become increasingly unsociable. They may find themselves absorbed in the virtual world, resulting in less face-to-face interaction with others. This trend can lead to a more solitary lifestyle, as some people become overly reliant on email and messaging instead of engaging in direct conversations. Nevertheless, many individuals still prioritize maintaining strong relationships by meeting friends in person and having meaningful discussions.In conclusion, while I firmly believe that the benefits of email and messaging have streamlined our communication efforts, it is essential to prioritize real-life gatherings with friends and colleagues.

question: Some people think that a sense of competition in children should be encouraged. Other believe that children who are taught to co-operate rather than compete become more useful adults.
human: It is undeniable that children have an innocent mind, and they requires a proper guidance at a specific time to make them understand the value of life. Some people think that it is better to make them competitive, while other believes to make them co-operative. Both these factors have their own values, and have been discussed in detail below:Competitive children are more likely to be confident enough to handle the situations independently. This factor initially arises from the school, where teacher encourages student to feel more competitive through the grading system, and this is the place where children are trying to get on the top by scoring the highest marks. This factor will lead them to be successful in their lives ahead, but will also restrict them in many ways. For example, MNCs are mainly focusing on a team work, and a person with the competitive mind would be having a difficulty in managing the situation with the team.However, those who wants to create a sense of co-operation in their children is a symbol that they want to make them sensible enough in their lives ahead. Although, they will not be having a pace and an eager to get on the top as the competitors do, but they shall have an art of managing different situations of life with the help of a team.In my opinion, though competitive children will be far more clever and faster than the co-operative child in an initial level, but it will not help them to be on the success path for the long run; while on the contrary, co-operative child will have a potential of structuring and implementing new and innovative ideas with the help of a team.To conclude, I would say that people should create a sense of co-operation in their children to make them feel more accomplished in life.
llm: It is clear that children possess an innocent mindset, and they require appropriate guidance at certain stages to help them grasp the value of life. Some believe it is more beneficial to encourage competition among children, while others advocate for fostering cooperation. Both perspectives have their merits, which will be explored in detail below.Competitive children tend to develop greater confidence and the ability to handle situations independently. This competitiveness often emerges in school, where educators motivate students to excel through grading systems, driving them to strive for top marks. While this approach can lead to future success, it may also present challenges. For instance, many multinational corporations prioritize teamwork, and competitive individuals may struggle to collaborate effectively within a group.On the other hand, parents who focus on instilling a sense of cooperation in their children aim to cultivate their overall sensibility for future challenges. Though these cooperative children may not possess the same urgency to achieve individual accolades as their competitive peers, they often excel in navigating various life situations through teamwork.In my view, while competitive children may demonstrate greater cleverness and speed initially, this may not secure long-term success. Conversely, cooperative children have the potential to develop and implement innovative ideas effectively within a team setting.In conclusion, I believe that fostering a spirit of cooperation in children will help them achieve a greater sense of fulfillment in life.

question: Nowadays the way many people interact with each other has changed because of technology. In what ways has technology affected the types of relationships people make? Has this become a positive or negative development?
human: Nowadays, the variety of communication systems used widely. As technology develops, it has negative influences in many respects. However, I strongly agree with that the technology has large positive effects on relationships between people. The main advantage is that technology has enabled people stay in contact with each other more closely. While public use the Internet or smart phone to share information to each other at different positions. Instead of using letters, technology advanced not only gives us more spare time but also convenient and efficient. More, even if family members who are in different countries, they also can use the Internet to connect each others, especially though the images or videos, they can feel close. Furthermore, technology is also essential for students, live in remote districts, shared the valuable natural resources with friends. Another issue is that in the ever-accelerated updating of science and technology, technology provides opportunities for people to establish the social network. In the past, people might have had pen friends in other countries, but now, thanks to the social networking websites, people can easily to find someone who has similar interests. Also, they can connect with friends who have been out of touch for a long time by using the Internet. In this way, technology is beneficial to humanity develops positive relationships. In conclusion, I agree with that the technology has more optimal effects on people's interaction, because it helps ordinary people to make new friends and to maintain relationships.
llm: In today's world, a wide range of communication systems is prevalent. While technological advancements can have negative impacts in certain areas, I firmly believe that technology has significantly enhanced relationships among people. One of the primary benefits of technology is its ability to keep individuals closely connected. The public increasingly relies on the internet and smartphones to share information instantly, regardless of location. Unlike the days of letter writing, modern technology not only saves us time but also offers convenience and efficiency. Moreover, family members separated by distance can easily connect through the internet, particularly through images and videos, which help them feel closer to one another. This is especially important for students living in remote areas, who can share valuable experiences and resources with friends online. Additionally, in our rapidly evolving technological landscape, people have greater opportunities to develop social networks. In the past, individuals might have had pen pals in foreign countries; now, social networking websites make it easy for people to connect with others who share similar interests. People can also reconnect with long-lost friends using the internet. In this way, technology fosters the development of positive relationships among individuals. In conclusion, I believe that technology has a largely positive impact on interpersonal interactions, as it helps people forge new friendships and maintain existing ones.

question: When a country develops its technology, the traditional skills and ways of life die out. It is pointless to try and keep them alive. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
human: With the development of technology, whether or not it is still necessary to protect the traditional skills and lifestyles leads to a drastic controversy which is becoming a public concern, especially considering the significant impact taken by technology. As far as I am concerned, the importance of traditions should be valued and paid attention to.Traditional skills and lifestyles play important role in modern society, in terms of healthcare, environmental protection and cultural inherit. Although technology takes convenience to humankind, it also contributes to unhealthy behaviors of life, like sedentary lifestyle. Instead, traditional ways of life is a great complimentary for modern life and highlight the importance of work life balance. Meanwhile, due to the fact that traditional skills rely little on fossil energy, it is more environmentally-friendly, which should be promoted to reduce the threat of climate change. Furthermore those tradition-related things convey traditional culture and values. These are important foundation of modern civilization. Protection of tradition can provide the possibility to better understand ancient culture and utilize them to tackle modern problems.Some people who hold different viewpoints may advocate that protecting traditions consume too much financial budget compared with the incoming it takes. In spite of the fact this kind of business bring limited contribution to government finance, it should be emphasized that the expense is trivial compared with the potential value of traditions. Therefore the government authorities and education institutes should work closely together to promote the traditional skills and ways of life, so as to make people to realize the value of them.All in all, protection of tradition is not only important for the entire society currently, but also contributes to the next generation.
llm: The advancement of technology raises a significant debate about the necessity of preserving traditional skills and lifestyles, a topic of increasing public concern given technology's profound influence on our lives. In my view, the preservation of traditions is essential and deserves our attention.Traditional skills and lifestyles play a vital role in contemporary society, especially in areas such as healthcare, environmental conservation, and cultural heritage. While technology undoubtedly offers convenience, it also encourages unhealthy habits, such as a sedentary lifestyle. In contrast, traditional ways of living complement modern life and emphasize the importance of maintaining a work-life balance. Additionally, since traditional skills often rely less on fossil fuels, they present a more environmentally sustainable option, which is critical in mitigating the effects of climate change. Furthermore, these traditional practices embody cultural values and heritage, forming the cornerstone of modern civilization. By protecting traditions, we create opportunities to better understand ancient cultures and apply their wisdom to contemporary challenges.Some may argue that the protection of traditions imposes a significant financial burden that outweighs its benefits. While it is true that this sector may contribute minimally to government revenue, the costs associated with preserving traditions are insignificant compared to their potential value. Therefore, it is crucial for government authorities and educational institutions to collaborate in promoting traditional skills and lifestyles, helping people recognize their intrinsic worth.In conclusion, safeguarding traditions is not only vital for the present society but also paves the way for future generations.

question: Some people think that a sense of competition in children should be encouraged. Others believe that children who are taught to be co-operate rather than compete become more useful adults. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
human: In present educational system there are variety of competitions in academic area and athletic area for children to attend, which could stimulating the will of children to learn and to achieve the best of them, and also be able to teach them teamwork skill. However, some people think it is better to make children be competitive than cooperative, both the values have its arguments.A strong competition sense helps children having urge to learn or to practice for being the best among peers, and this factor is initially arises from the schools and parents, to encourage children to get the highest scores through the grading system. Even though a competitive child is usually more motivated to pursue a goal or to face difficulties independently, but it is also risky that children are becoming too competitive to cooperating with others. Being competitive leads them to success, but could also restrict them in many ways. For example, it might be hard for a competitive person to deal or manage in a team work project.On the other hand, cooperation is also an essential quality for children, no matter in school activities or in communities. Having a good cooperating spirit helps kids to communicate and get along with others, which gives them more possibility to solve problems or to achieve a goal easily by working as a team. After all, in society, there is hardly anyone who could has big achievement by oneself. For example, famous singers or movie stars, despite of their talent to make them successful, there are always a team to manage works or deal with things.In my point of view, though competitive child would have more motivation and perspective that leads them to success, but it would not help them much once they enter to society or company which required more about skill of team work. To sum up, I would say that schools and adults should put a sense of cooperation in children to make them becoming a useful adult whether in society or community.
llm: The current educational system offers a range of academic and athletic competitions for children, aimed at fostering their desire to learn and excel while also teaching valuable teamwork skills. However, there is debate over whether it is more beneficial for children to be competitive rather than cooperative; both perspectives have valid points.A strong sense of competition can drive children to strive for excellence, often motivated by the expectations set by schools and parents to achieve high grades. While a competitive nature can lead to greater motivation and independence in overcoming challenges, it also carries the risk of hindering collaboration with others. For instance, a child who is overly focused on winning may struggle to work effectively in team projects.Conversely, cooperation is a vital skill for children to develop, both in school settings and within their communities. A collaborative spirit enhances communication and relationships with peers, increasing the chances of solving problems and reaching shared goals. Ultimately, very few individuals achieve significant success without the support of others. For example, even immensely talented singers and actors rely on teams to manage their careers and projects.In my view, while competitive children may exhibit greater motivation and ambition, this mindset may not serve them well in a societal context that values teamwork skills. In conclusion, I believe that schools and adults should prioritize fostering a spirit of cooperation in children to help them become valuable contributors to society and their communities.

question: Some people think that advertising give more harms than good to our society. Other refute this. Discuss both views and give your opinion
human: On these days, with the assistance of advertisement, people easily purchase the best products with detailed information and instruction for their requirement. Although some people claim that the advantages of advertising are outweigh the advantages, I believe that advertisement bring more benefits than harms to our lives.On the one hand, it is clear that most advertisements so exaggerate the quality of their products that they often ignore some negative effects of what they sell. In addition to this, all of things are advertised as the best ones result in the confusing for users in picking out the most suitable goods. For example, some kinds of shampoo, namely Sunsilk, Clear, Dove are publicized as magic items to recreate injured hair with the number of other benefits. However, the fact is that not all customers are satisfied with what they bought under the introduction from advertisement. On the other hand, it is undeniable fact that advertising market gives lots of working opportunities from producers, writers to models and cameramen for all of people as long as their qualification adapt to the demands. Moreover, advertisement enables to support users in getting accustomed to enterprises and know thoroughly items sold from these producers. Take Coca cola for an example, this drinking firm is well-known as one of companies invested a major part of their money in advertising. No wonder why this drinking title becomes more and more familiar with customers around the world. Last but not least, online advertisement is one of the easiest approaches due to their potential gains such as cheaper cost, convenience and easily observing.To sum up, everything has its own gains and losses and advertisement is not an exception. From my point of view, advertising will be better if producers and advertisers are more honest in producing advertisements to give people the general view on one product.
llm: In today’s world, advertising plays a pivotal role in helping consumers easily find and purchase top-quality products, complete with detailed information and instructions tailored to their needs. While some argue that the drawbacks of advertising outweigh its benefits, I contend that advertising generally offers more advantages than disadvantages in our lives.On one hand, many advertisements tend to exaggerate the qualities of their products, often downplaying or ignoring the potential drawbacks. This can lead to confusion among consumers, making it difficult for them to choose the most suitable items. For example, shampoos like Sunsilk, Clear, and Dove are marketed as miraculous solutions for damaged hair, promoting a multitude of benefits. However, the reality is that not all customers are satisfied with the products they purchase based on these advertisements.On the other hand, it is undeniable that the advertising industry creates numerous job opportunities, benefiting everyone from producers and writers to models and cameramen, provided their skills align with the industry’s needs. Additionally, advertising helps consumers become familiar with various companies and understand the products they offer. For instance, Coca-Cola is a prime example of a brand that invests heavily in advertising, which has contributed to its recognition and popularity worldwide. Furthermore, online advertising has emerged as one of the most effective strategies due to its affordability, convenience, and ease of tracking results.In conclusion, like everything else, advertising comes with its own set of pros and cons. However, I believe advertising would be even more effective if producers and advertisers adopted a more honest approach, providing consumers with a clearer and more accurate view of their products.

question: Some modern artists receive huge sums of money for the things they create, while other struggle to survive. Government should take steps to resolve this unfair situation. To what extend do you agree or disagree?
human: The amount of money people earning sometimes is unfair. In a field of art, modern artist may receive high salary for their masterpiece creation while labors should be break their bone for years to get similar amount of money. Although some people view that government should be take a responsibility for this unfair situation, critics against such view. I agree that in this occasion the government is not granted to hand in.Proficiency brings perfectness in terms of art work. It is true while the modern artists who implement their creative thinking onto high value creation are paid with immense sum by the art collector. Also, the high sum which modern artists receive is related to the quality instead of the quantity and their rare talent. For example, a 15 centimeter Buddha temple made by hand is granted times in comparison with factory production. On the other hand, modern artists also devote themselves find a unique concept in which ordinary people cannot do, such making impossible become possible. Pieter Padang, Minion creator, has brilliant idea to alter part of song lyric "I swear" become "underwear" when the Minion sing in Despicable Me. He granted huge sums for such idea.Striking contrast, labor working in the merchandise factory receive coin of dollar even they make a hundred of 15 cm Buddha temples a day. In any case, a musician playing "I swear" several times receives different earnings that Padang got because the musician re-plays the song without any creation. Moreover, government cannot equalize the price of creation of modern artist because there is no certain parameter to value it, art value is about taste.Having said that the huge sums of modern artists receives related to their struggle in the field of art, while the term of struggle might different with other field of job. I agree that government cannot take steps to make the salary between modern artists and other job similar because art price is about taste.
llm: The disparities in earnings among different professions can often seem unjust. In the realm of art, modern artists may command substantial salaries for their creations, while laborers toil for years, only to earn a similar amount. While some argue that the government should address this imbalance, I contend that this is not a responsibility the government should take on.The proficiency of an artist greatly influences the perceived value of their work. Modern artists who translate their imaginative concepts into high-value creations are often compensated generously by art collectors. This high remuneration is tied more to the quality and rarity of their talent than to the volume of their work. For instance, a handcrafted, 15-centimeter Buddha statue may be valued significantly more than mass-produced versions. Furthermore, modern artists dedicate themselves to developing unique concepts that often seem unattainable to the average person. Take Pieter Padang, the creator of Minions, who cleverly altered a lyric from "I swear" to "underwear" in the iconic song featured in Despicable Me, earning a handsome sum for his inventive idea.In stark contrast, laborers in manufacturing plants might earn only a fraction of what these artists make, even if they produce hundreds of 15-centimeter Buddha statues daily. Similarly, a musician who repeatedly plays the song "I swear" may earn considerably less than Padang, as the musician is simply performing an existing piece rather than creating something new. Moreover, the government cannot standardize the value of artistic creation since art is inherently subjective and based on individual taste.Ultimately, the considerable earnings of modern artists reflect their unique struggles and achievements in the art world, a concept of "struggle" that may differ markedly from other professions. Therefore, I believe that it would be inappropriate for the government to intervene in an effort to equalize salaries between modern artists and workers in other fields, as the value of art is determined by personal preference.

question: People tend to work longer hours nowadays. Working long hours has a negative effect on themselves, their families and the society, so working hours should be restricted. Do you agree or disagree?
human: Working longer hours is becoming prevalent in these days. There is a saying in my native village, "Health is Wealth". I believe many of people including me are not really considering the importance of health. The need for increased working hours might be because of enhanced competitive environment and desire to acquire much money and promotion. However, people working for extended hours have been found having adverse effects on their health and personal life. In my opinion, a balance between personal and professional life should be created by restricting maximum number of working hours. First of all, many of us would agree to the fact that people; who prefer working longer hours, do not find time to focus on their health. By working too long, they often become tired, lazy and reluctant to carry out physical exercise in order to remain fit and healthy and eventually loose health and become sick. Moreover, they become extensively addicted to their work and become workaholic type persons. The repercussion are so severe that their families and friends remain deprived off their attention and in the end they end up losing balance between their family and personal life.Secondly, these workaholic people do not spend time for the contribution of society by actively participating in any social campaign. As they usually remain busy in their office so they do not find leisure time for such social activities. For instance, I would take my boss's example; he has been working for extended hours in office for many years. Recently, his health and personal life was drastically affected as he broke up with his wife and his family life has totally been in chaos and cries. He started regretting afterwards and now trying to manage his work but it seems to be too late for him.To conclude this, I would strongly emphasis and recommend, Government must include the clause of maximum number of working hours in its Labor Law and enforce to all companies for ensuring their employees do not spend extended hours in companies. This will help in uplift of society, and bring the lost equilibrium between personal and professional life of each individual person.
llm: The trend of working longer hours has become increasingly common in recent times. In my native village, there's a saying: "Health is Wealth." Unfortunately, many people, myself included, often overlook the significance of maintaining our health. The push for longer work hours may stem from a heightened competitive atmosphere and a strong desire for financial success and promotions. However, those who work excessive hours frequently experience negative effects on both their health and personal lives. I believe that establishing a balance between personal and professional commitments is crucial, and this can be achieved by limiting the maximum number of working hours.Firstly, it is widely accepted that individuals who opt for longer work hours often neglect their health. Prolonged working hours can lead to fatigue, laziness, and a lack of motivation to engage in physical exercise, ultimately resulting in a decline in health and increased susceptibility to illness. Additionally, these individuals can become overly consumed by their jobs, descending into workaholism. The consequences of this obsession are dire, as their families and friends are deprived of their attention, leading to a significant imbalance in their personal and family lives.Furthermore, workaholics rarely find the time to contribute to society or participate in social initiatives. Their busy work schedules leave little room for leisure or community involvement. Take my boss, for example. He has spent numerous years working long hours, and recently he experienced a drastic downturn in both his health and personal life, culminating in a separation from his wife and a chaotic family situation. He now expresses regret and is attempting to regain control over his work-life balance, but unfortunately, it may be too late for him.In conclusion, I strongly advocate for the government to implement a maximum working hours clause in its Labor Laws and enforce this regulation across all companies. This measure would not only support societal well-being but also restore the critical balance between personal and professional lives for individuals.

question: A successful person is one who has earned a lot of money. To what extend do you agree or disagree?
human: It's such a common definition of a successful person is one who has earned a lot of money, especially in nowadays society. Each individual visualize success differently. Still, my term of a successful man is one who has certain achievements in life rather than the one with a high income.Money is undeniably pivotal, but ways of earning it is also various. A person's great prosperity does not state that he has gained it ethically by himself. Nevertheless, a man can only achieve his accomplishment through hard-working, dedication and passion. Whether it is a personal or a social achievement, that man is laudable.More importantly, the more beneficial for the society his achievement is, the more successful he is considered. For instance, Thomas Edison is undeniably considered as one of the greatest inventors in the 20th century since his invention's productivity is countless useful for mankind. On the other hand, the fact of knowing a man's utilization of his money remains in the dark. Therefore, judging a person by his income is difficult, especially in the success aspect.In conclusion, using only money as a scale to measure a man's success is impossible despite the fact that it is the essential in basic needs. Yet, it is the common scene that a man can be publicly considered successful when his achievements, which can only accomplished by passion, dedication and ethics, are helpful not only for himself.
llm: In today’s society, a common definition of a successful person is someone who has accumulated a significant amount of wealth. However, success is subjective and varies from one individual to another. For me, a truly successful person is one who has achieved meaningful milestones in life, rather than simply possessing a high income.While money is undeniably important, there are many different avenues through which it can be obtained. A person's substantial wealth does not necessarily indicate that they have earned it ethically or through their own efforts. True success comes from hard work, dedication, and passion. Whether the achievement is personal or social, such individuals deserve recognition.Furthermore, the societal impact of a person's achievements enhances their perception of success. Take Thomas Edison, for example; he is widely regarded as one of the greatest inventors of the 20th century due to the countless ways his inventions have benefited humanity. In contrast, a person's financial activities and how they utilize their wealth often remain obscured. Thus, it can be challenging to assess someone's success based solely on their income.In conclusion, measuring a person's success solely by their financial status is inadequate, even though money is essential for meeting basic needs. It is common for society to regard individuals as successful when their achievements, founded on passion, dedication, and integrity, contribute positively to the community and go beyond personal gain.

question: Question: Today, the high sales of popular consumer goods reflect the power of advertising and not the real needs of the society in which there are sold. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Nowdays, people's choice of consumption is heavily affected by various of advertising on television, street, magazine etc. This argument may be true that people will be swayed by the advertising and buy things they do not need it for their life. For example, in most asian countries, advertisement company usually hire popular singers or actors to advertise the products to boosts the sales, and some people, especially adolescent may buy things from their favourite singer advertised to support their idol instead of to fill their needs.In addition, products usually look more gorgeous and with good quality in advertisement, people are more likely to buy goods impulsively without a second thought. A good advertisement can convince people to believe that it is what they want, even though it is not the real needs of the society. And there are always people purchase particular products swayed by advertising which makes it a trend to follow for other people who is unnecessarily need it.However, buying habit is a very personal things for individuals, the advertisement is not the only cause for people to buy, sometimes it depends on one's needs and ability of consumption. It is unlikely to buy things impulsively for adults who have concern of arranging disposable income. Most of them have to allocate the money if they doing other purchase. On the other hand, children and adolescents who is not economic independence is more possible to buy things impulsively without considering whether they need it or not, since they do not have financial pressure from life and ability to define what is necessary.In my opinion, I think buying habit is people's choice to make, not entirely affected by advertisements. But for children or adolescents who is not mentally develop, it might be hard for them not to swayed by advertising. So it is important that government needs to impose rules on particularly advertisement company (for example, toys company) to avoid youngster have bias thought on what they really need.
llm: In today's world, people's consumption choices are significantly influenced by advertising across various platforms such as television, billboards, magazines, and more. It's certainly true that advertisements can persuade individuals to purchase items they don't actually need. For instance, in many Asian countries, advertising agencies often enlist popular singers or actors to promote products, thereby driving sales. Some consumers, particularly adolescents, may buy these items simply to support their favorite celebrities rather than out of necessity.Moreover, advertisements often portray products as more appealing and higher quality than they may truly be, leading consumers to make impulsive purchases without thinking them through. A compelling advertisement can create a perception that a product fulfills a genuine desire, even when it may not align with societal needs. This can set off a trend, where others feel compelled to buy similar products, often without any real necessity.Nonetheless, purchasing habits are inherently personal, and advertising is not the sole factor influencing consumer decisions. Individual needs and financial circumstances play significant roles as well. Adults, who are typically more conscious of managing their disposable income, are less likely to make impulsive purchases. They often have to budget their money for essential expenses. Conversely, children and adolescents, who lack economic independence, may be more prone to spontaneous buying, as they do not face the same financial pressures and might struggle to discern their actual needs.In my view, while purchasing habits are influenced by advertising, they are ultimately personal choices. However, due to their developing mental faculties, children and adolescents may find it challenging to resist the sway of advertising. Therefore, it is essential for governments to implement regulations on advertising practices—particularly those targeting children, such as toy companies—to prevent young consumers from developing distorted perceptions of their needs.

question: Some people think that by paying taxes they made enough contribution to their society. TO what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Paying taxes is the obligation of citizens in almost every country. Some people believe that they have made enough contribution to the country by doing that. Personally, I tend to disagree with this view.To start with, all people who are able to work should pay tax to the government, as it is the most important source of government's revenue, which is mainly used to serve all citizens. For example, a large proportion of the tax is spent on national defence and in maintaining social stability, so that every one can work and live in a peaceful environment. The tax is also used to pay the salaries of workers working in public service sectors, such as teachers and police officers. Although these workers do not produce profit directly, what they do is for the well-being of the whole society.However, I would argue that citizens have other important responsibilities to fulfil apart from paying tax. As we know, there are impoverished or disabled people in every society, needing help and support from others. It is true that the government can provide some fund to ease their difficulties, but such financial help is usually far from enough. In such case, aids from more capable or wealthier citizens are particularly crucial, which are a great complement to government support. Another responsibility all citizens should take is to maintain social stability together with the police force. There are criminals in every society, and the number of policemen the government can hire is limited. So it is quite necessary for the local residents to take actions and ensure the safety of the communities, by doing things like reporting suspicious activities to the police department.In conclusion, it is a significant obligation of citizens to pay tax to the government. Other than that, they have other critical obligations to take, in order to make our society function in an ordered way.
llm: Paying taxes is a duty that citizens across nearly every nation are required to fulfill. Some individuals believe that by fulfilling this obligation, they have contributed sufficiently to their country. I, however, do not share this perspective.Firstly, it is essential for all able citizens to pay taxes to the government, as tax revenue is the primary funding source for government operations, which ultimately serves the entire populace. For instance, a substantial portion of tax income is allocated to national defense and maintaining social stability, ensuring that everyone can live and work in a peaceful environment. Taxes also fund the salaries of public service workers, such as teachers and police officers. While these roles may not generate profit directly, their contributions are vital for the well-being of society as a whole.That said, I argue that citizens have additional important responsibilities beyond just paying taxes. Every society includes vulnerable groups, such as the impoverished and disabled, who require assistance and support. Although the government provides some funding to alleviate their struggles, this financial aid often falls short. In such instances, support from more capable or affluent citizens becomes particularly valuable, serving as a crucial supplement to government assistance. Moreover, another responsibility of citizens is to collaborate with law enforcement in maintaining social stability. With limited police resources, it is vital for local residents to take proactive measures to ensure community safety, such as reporting suspicious activities to the authorities.In summary, while paying taxes is indeed a significant responsibility of citizens, they also have other essential duties to uphold in order to contribute to a well-functioning society.

question: School should teach children the academic subje cts which have a close relationship with their future careers, so other subjects like music and sports are not important. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: People have many different views about what subjects should be taught in school. Although I accept that students have to study many subjects in school, I disagree with the idea that unimportant subjects such as music and sports should be got rid of the program.Many people believe that students only need to study academic subjects like mathematics, physics because these subject are necessary for students' future. This is understandable when labor market now has high competition; students have to meet requirements regard of qualification. In addition, the unemployment rate is always high, so their parents want children to study these subjects which can help students have a job. Although those above reasons are acceptable, I would argue that there are many things much more important than having a job. Firstly, studying music, art or sports is also very important to students. This enables students to develop their potentials through discovering the natural world around them. Secondly, to get a job in labor market, not only do students require hard skills but also soft skills such as teamwork, presentation. For instance, through taking part in a sport, students can understand team spirit and learn lessons about teamwork skills. Therefore, these subjects might fulfil the students' ability. Finally, children's future do not depend heavily on the academic subjects they study in school, it is the result of their efforts and capacity.In conclusion, although the academic subjects play a primary role in nurturing children, it seem to me that the effects of learning music, sports are profound.
llm: People hold a variety of opinions on which subjects should be included in school curricula. While I recognize the necessity for students to study multiple disciplines, I strongly oppose the idea of removing seemingly less important subjects like music and physical education from the curriculum.Many believe that students should focus solely on academic subjects such as mathematics and physics, as these are deemed essential for their future success. This perspective is understandable given the intense competition in today’s job market, where students must fulfill specific qualifications to secure employment. Additionally, high unemployment rates prompt parents to encourage their children to pursue subjects that may lead to better job opportunities.However, despite these valid concerns, I argue that there are aspects of education that extend beyond mere job acquisition. First, subjects like music, art, and sports are crucial for students' overall development. They provide avenues for self-discovery and enable young individuals to explore their potential while engaging with the world around them. Secondly, succeeding in the workforce requires more than just technical skills; it also demands soft skills such as teamwork and effective communication. Participation in sports, for example, helps students grasp the importance of collaboration and teaches essential lessons about working together. Thus, these subjects significantly contribute to enhancing students' abilities.In conclusion, while academic subjects are undeniably important in shaping children’s futures, I believe that the impact of studying music and sports is equally profound and should not be overlooked.

question: Some people believe that information available in the internet will end the era of newspapers and magazines. Do you agree or disagree? Give your own opinion and examples.
human: Digital media has been extremely popular among people around the globe. With this advancement, newspapers and magazines are struggling to justify their existence. Some believe that traditional paper media will come to an end very soon due to the increased usage of internet based media. But many other still thinks they are going to stay. I agree to the argument that newspapers and magazines will be history with the time. I will establish my view by analysing how internet presents the information about the current affair so fast and the accessibility to the historical news.A very important responsibility of media is to publish information about the current affairs as quickly as possible specially when there is a crisis. This helps readers to get updated and act accordingly. For example, when the aircraft MH 370 went missing, everyone wanted to know the details about this tragic incident. The friends and families of passengers and crews were impatient to know the truth. In such situations, newspapers and magazines can not respond as fast as digital media. Instead of waiting for next publication, people can get trustworthy information about the current incidents from internet within an hour or two. This explains why digital media will rule over paper and magazines.People often want to access news from past for various reasons like to prepare for research, satisfy interest, etc. For example, one research fellow may want to know how a small village named Oramaki in Japan was suffering after Second World War. It is very difficult to get this sort of information from past in newspapers and magazines as one has to know before where to look at. But internet provides efficient search facility where one can search the topic and get the details. This feature of digital media is not supported by newspapers and magazines.To conclude, the fast responding internet media with vast information will be replacing newspapers and magazines as new and information provider for valid reasons. Though considering the current infrastructure and mindset of people, paper media will continue for another few years.
llm: Digital media has gained immense popularity worldwide, leading to significant challenges for traditional newspapers and magazines in justifying their relevance. While some believe that print media is on the verge of extinction due to the rise of online platforms, others maintain that it will continue to persist. I align with the perspective that newspapers and magazines will eventually become obsolete. In this essay, I will support my viewpoint by examining the speed at which the internet disseminates information about current events and its ease of access to historical news.One of the media's crucial responsibilities is to deliver information about current affairs swiftly, especially during crises. This timely dissemination allows readers to stay informed and respond appropriately. For instance, when flight MH 370 disappeared, there was an overwhelming demand for updates on the tragic incident. Friends and family of the passengers and crew were desperate for answers. In such circumstances, newspapers and magazines cannot match the speed of digital media. Instead of waiting for the next print issue, individuals can access reliable information online within a matter of hours. This demonstrates why digital media is poised to dominate over print formats.Additionally, people often seek access to historical news for various reasons, including research and personal interest. For example, a researcher might want to study the impact of World War II on a small village in Japan called Oramaki. Obtaining such information from print media can be challenging, as one needs to know where to look in advance. In contrast, the internet offers efficient search capabilities, allowing users to easily find relevant details. This functionality is something that newspapers and magazines cannot provide.In conclusion, the rapid responsiveness and extensive information available through digital media will ultimately replace newspapers and magazines as primary sources of news. While the current infrastructure and societal attitudes may support the continued existence of print media for a few more years, its long-term future seems increasingly uncertain.

question: When choosing a job, the salary is the most important consideration. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: In many societies, choice of a job depends on the size of the salary offered. Nevertheless, while I admit that the salary is very pivotal factor, I claim that there are other equally vital aspects that need to be considered in this regard.To begin with, I agree that in order for people to cover their daily and general needs they need money as well. However, aspects such as: friendly colleagues, environment and work-place condition, sometimes, have even more impact on person's happiness and quality of life. People, for instance, who don't like their co-workers and working condition are considered less satisfied with their jobs, despite of a high salary. In this sense, it is also one very salient proof of the accuracy of my position.Further and even more importantly, most of the satisfaction of a job comes to people from their professional achievements, skills and the position they reach. In other words, career promotion or getting some kind of credit from the administration of a company or organization are, likely, more enjoyable achievements than getting a high salary. For example, people, who work in monotonous jobs, where no achievements or a new positions can be reached feel themselves more dissatisfied, even though they have a very good salaries.In conclusion, I disagree with the idea that salary outweighs any other motivators, as there are other even more important aspects such as: friendly co-workers, working conditions and professional achievements.
llm: In many cultures, the selection of a job often hinges on the salary offered. While I acknowledge that salary is a crucial factor, I believe there are other equally important considerations to take into account.Firstly, I recognize that money is necessary for individuals to meet their daily and overall needs. However, elements such as having supportive colleagues, a positive work environment, and favorable workplace conditions can significantly enhance a person's happiness and quality of life. For instance, individuals who do not enjoy their relationships with coworkers or the conditions of their workplace tend to feel less satisfied with their jobs, even if they are earning a high salary. This serves as compelling evidence to support my viewpoint.Moreover, an essential source of job satisfaction often stems from professional accomplishments, the development of one's skills, and career advancement. In contrast, the joy derived from promotions or recognition from management can often surpass the gratification one gets from a high salary. For example, individuals stuck in monotonous jobs that offer no opportunities for progress or achievement often experience greater dissatisfaction, regardless of their lucrative pay.In conclusion, I contend that salary does not overshadow other motivational factors. Aspects like having friendly coworkers, favorable working conditions, and opportunities for professional growth are, in fact, equally or even more significant.

question: Using a computer every day can have more negative than positive effects on children. Do you agree or disagree?
human: In today's world, computer is an essential part of everyday life. Around the globe, the effect is evident on children also. It is disagreed that computer can affect children in a negative way if they use a computer on a daily basis. This will be proven by analyzing how computer assists children to use vast resources available over internet to study effectively as well as develop some basic skills which help them in future careers.The best thing about internet is the availability of information in the form of text, image or video related to almost everything and through computer children can access internet to gather knowledge on the subjects they are studying or they are interested about. As an example, students preparing for delivering speech on a certain topic can browse through internet to learn each and every minute details of the subject matter. It's hard to get everything at a same place unless children are not familiar with computers. That is how, computer impacts children on a positive note.Nowadays, computers enable people to prepare presentations, draw complex graphs and pictures, document thesis in a simple though efficient way. When children are allowed to play around with computer from a very early age, they get acquainted with the previously mentioned skills and become expert before facing professional world. For instance, students who used to prepare Microsoft PowerPoint presentation for their school projects, get an edge over others at an early stage of their career. From this, it's clear that computer has a positive effect on the children.Following the demonstration of a computer's contribution in children's study and building skills which are to be used in their career afterwards, it is agreed that computer is a boon to children. However, parents should advise and guide their children properly so that they don't get misled.
llm: In today's society, computers have become integral to daily life, with their impact also evident among children worldwide. While some may argue that excessive computer use can have negative effects on young users, this perspective overlooks the numerous advantages offered by computers. This will be illustrated by exploring how computers enable children to access a wealth of online resources for effective studying and developing foundational skills that will benefit them in their future careers.One of the greatest advantages of the internet is the vast array of information available in various formats—text, images, and videos—on nearly every topic. Through computers, children can easily access the internet to enhance their understanding of the subjects they are studying or are passionate about. For instance, students preparing for a speech can use online resources to gather detailed information on their topic. Without an understanding of computers, accessing such a wealth of information would be challenging. This is how computers positively influence children’s learning experiences.Moreover, computers allow individuals to create presentations, design intricate graphs and visuals, and efficiently document research. Children who are encouraged to engage with computers from an early age can develop these skills, positioning themselves ahead of their peers when entering the professional world. For example, students who create Microsoft PowerPoint presentations for school projects gain a competitive advantage in their early careers. This clearly illustrates the positive impact computers have on children.Given the significant contributions of computers to children's education and the skills that will serve them well in their future careers, it is evident that computers are a valuable resource for young learners. However, it is essential for parents to provide proper guidance to ensure their children navigate the digital landscape safely and effectively.

question: Children who are brought up in families that do not have large amounts of money are better prepared to deal with the problems of adult life than children brought up by wealthy parents. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
human: According to some people, child who is brought up in less well-off family is more quick-witted and can tackle with an adult life problems better than who is from affluent ones. However, I completely disagree with this position.To begin with, children from poorer families are prone to have bad habits such as: crime, thievery and thuggery. Moreover, these people will not have an access to a good education. As a result, they can be proselytized into bad isms. For example, most of the terroristic groups try to attract uneducated people, because the person with better education has a wider outlook, which will allow no brainwash. In this sense, people with lower level of education have more proneness to be attracted in such isms.Nevertheless, people who are born in well-off families have access to good education, which will have a positive impact on their later life. Secondly, children from rich families have better skills on how to use money, because they use it a lot of times. Finally, wealthy families can afford better health services and costly medicines, which will be very beneficial for the health of a child. For instance, many good medicines cost vast amounts of money, which cannot be afforded by poorer families.In conclusion, I disagree with the opinion that children who are brought up in less well-of families are, likely, more successful in the future life due to aforementioned reasons.
llm: Some people believe that children raised in less affluent families are quicker to adapt and better equipped to handle adult life challenges compared to their more privileged peers. However, I strongly disagree with this assertion.First and foremost, children from poorer backgrounds often fall into negative behaviors such as crime, theft, and violence. Additionally, they frequently lack access to quality education, which can leave them vulnerable to being influenced by harmful ideologies. For instance, many terrorist organizations seek to recruit uneducated individuals, as those with a solid educational foundation are typically more resistant to manipulation. In this regard, individuals with lower levels of education are more susceptible to such harmful beliefs.On the other hand, children from wealthy families benefit from access to quality education, which positively influences their future prospects. Furthermore, these children are often more adept at managing money because they have more opportunities to learn about financial matters. Lastly, affluent families can afford superior healthcare services and expensive medications, which significantly contribute to a child's overall well-being. Many effective treatments and medications are prohibitively expensive for families with limited financial resources.In conclusion, I reject the notion that children from less privileged backgrounds are more likely to succeed in life, for the reasons mentioned above.

question: Many of the medical problems that people are experiencing in today's world are due to the fact that we have a very sedentary lifestyle. To what extend do you agree or disagree.
human: It is certainly true that modern people are facing up to a new health problems and ailments than before. Many people claim that it is because of sedentary lifestlyle. However, while I accept that sedentary lifestyle is one of the key factors, I believe that some other factors are having even a greater impact.To begin with, I agree that sedentary lifestyle lead to many serious health problems. The main reason why people are becoming so addicted to sitting at their homes even for the whole day is an advance technology. In earlier times, for instance, even the types of entertainment tools were not in large numbers and all of them required physical presence and as a result they had more outdoor activities. Nowadays people, especially inhabitants of cities, are spending most of their time on sitting in front of TV or other tools.Nevertheless, there are some other causes why people are experiencing serious medical problems. Firstly, the environment of the modern world polluted very significantly from greenhouse gas emissions and other gasses. Many people, for example, are suffering from allergy because of these gasses. Secondly, foods with a low quality such as fast foods, junk foods and any genetically modified ones are influencing to our health very negatively. Finally, life becoming more stressful due to some recent problems such as traffic gam, traffic accidents and others.Given these evidences, it can be seen that people are facing up with many recently appeared illnesses due to aforementioned reasons.
llm: It is undoubtedly true that contemporary individuals are encountering a range of new health issues and ailments not seen in the past. Many attribute this rise to a sedentary lifestyle. While I acknowledge that this is a significant contributing factor, I believe that other elements are exerting an even greater influence.To start, I concur that a sedentary lifestyle leads to numerous serious health concerns. One major reason for people's increased tendency to spend entire days sitting at home is the advancement of technology. In earlier times, entertainment options were limited and often required physical activity, resulting in more outdoor engagement. Today, especially in urban areas, many individuals find themselves primarily seated in front of TVs or other devices.However, there are additional factors contributing to the prevalence of serious health problems. Firstly, modern environmental pollution has escalated significantly due to greenhouse gas emissions and other pollutants, leading to issues such as allergies for many individuals. Secondly, the consumption of low-quality foods, such as fast foods, junk foods, and genetically modified products, is having a detrimental effect on our health. Finally, life has become increasingly stressful due to recent challenges, including traffic congestion and accidents, among others.In light of these points, it is clear that various newly emerged health issues are a result of the factors mentioned above.

question: Foreign language instruction should begin in kindergarten. Do you agree or disagree?
human: Educational institutions have different systems when it comes to introducing foreign languages to children. Some people believe that foreign language instruction should start in pre-school. However, those who disagree contend that this should be taught in later years. This issue has garnered some attention in the academe as it has an impact on the children's learning. I personally believe that it is important for children to be taught with a secondary language as early as kindergarten.To begin with, children might not be really comfortable with the use of a language other than their native tongue when they are in their kindergarten years. Learning at school must be convenient for them if they speak in a way that they are used to. Moreover, teachers think that foreign language most likely leads to confusion for children who are yet to start learning. Another important thing to consider is that the teacher should be well-trained in the use of this specific language, so quality education will be delivered. Nevertheless, it is undeniable that kids are amazing learners, and the best time to hone them is in their younger years. The introduction of foreign language will be new to them; however, their curiosity will drive them to learn and comprehend. In this way, grasping a new language will be natural to them. In addition, the positive impact of this strategy is beneficial to both learners and teachers. Teachers will not find it difficult to make students learn such new concept in their teenage years. It is certainly clear that the advantages of early introduction of foreign language outweigh its disadvantages.In conclusion, the use of foreign language instruction as early as kindergarten is supported by some people; however, there are those who disagree. I am totally convinced that if this endeavour is properly implemented by schools, this will most likely lead to improvement of learning ability among children.
llm: Educational institutions vary in their approaches to introducing foreign languages to children. Some individuals advocate for starting foreign language instruction in preschool, while others argue for a later introduction. This topic has attracted attention in academic circles due to its impact on children's learning. I firmly believe that teaching a second language as early as kindergarten is crucial.Initially, during their kindergarten years, children may feel uncomfortable using a language other than their native one. It is essential that the learning environment is comfortable for them, using language they are familiar with. Furthermore, many educators worry that introducing a foreign language too early could lead to confusion for children who are still in the process of acquiring their first language. It is also vital that teachers are well-qualified to teach the specific language to ensure high-quality education.However, it is undeniable that children are exceptional learners, and their formative years provide the best opportunity for language acquisition. Although foreign language instruction may be new to them, their natural curiosity will motivate them to learn and understand. Consequently, acquiring a new language can feel instinctive for them. Additionally, this approach benefits both students and teachers, as it makes language learning easier for students when they encounter it again in their teenage years. Clearly, the benefits of introducing foreign languages early outweigh the drawbacks.In conclusion, while there are differing opinions on the timing of foreign language instruction, I am completely convinced that if schools effectively implement it as early as kindergarten, it will enhance children's learning abilities.

question: International tourism has become a huge industry in the world. Some people think that the problems caused by international tourism outweigh benefits. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Along with the advancement of long-distance transportation, international tourism has boomed in the last few decades. Some people believe that this has brought more problems than benefits. I disagree with this view.I admit that tourism can have a negative impact on the natural environment. In order to meet the needs of tourists, local governments are likely to build more facilities and infrastructures around tourist attractions, which may result in the destruction of natural habitats. Tourism also creates more pollution and waste, including growing emission of greenhouse gases, dumped leftovers and overuse of water, power and other kind of energy in luxurious hotels. Based on these grounds, it seems that tourism puts great pressure on ecosystem and local resources, and it should not be encouraged.However, flourishing tourism in a place can be very rewarding in terms of local economy. Holiday makers flocking to other countries are not only bound to spend on tickets of attractions, but also pay for food, accommodation, transportation and entertainment. Both local people and governments can make a large amount of money through these services, and more employment opportunities can be created as well. I also believe the revenue earned form tourism can be used in turn to reduce pollution and protect the environment.Furthermore, the increasing development of tourism is a boon to travelers as well. The provision of direct airlines makes it possible for them to travel conveniently and comfortably. With adequate local facilities and services available, they can spend more of their holidays having fun and relaxing. In addition, both locals and tourists can experience more cultures than ever before, and they can be more open-minded to eliminate preconceptions and deepen mutual understanding among nations.In conclusion, the prosperity of tourism can provide benefits for people on a global scale. Although there are some inevitable problems, they are outweighed by advantages and can be tackled if proper measures are taken.
llm: With the advancement of long-distance transportation, international tourism has seen significant growth over the past few decades. While some individuals argue that this trend has brought more challenges than advantages, I hold a different perspective.I acknowledge that tourism can negatively impact the natural environment. To accommodate the influx of visitors, local governments often construct additional facilities and infrastructure near tourist attractions, which can lead to the destruction of natural habitats. Moreover, tourism contributes to increased pollution and waste, including higher greenhouse gas emissions and excessive consumption of water, energy, and other resources in luxury hotels. These factors suggest that tourism may exert considerable pressure on ecosystems and local resources, and therefore, may warrant caution.Nevertheless, a thriving tourism sector can yield substantial benefits for the local economy. Tourists traveling to various destinations not only purchase tickets for attractions but also spend money on food, lodging, transportation, and entertainment. This influx of spending can generate significant revenue for both local residents and governments, creating numerous job opportunities in the process. Furthermore, the income generated from tourism can be reinvested into initiatives aimed at reducing pollution and protecting the environment.Additionally, the growth of tourism offers numerous advantages for travelers. The availability of direct flights enhances convenience and comfort, allowing visitors to enjoy their holidays to the fullest. With adequate local amenities and services, tourists can focus more on leisure and relaxation. Furthermore, both locals and travelers gain unprecedented access to diverse cultures, fostering greater open-mindedness and promoting mutual understanding between nations.In conclusion, the growth of tourism offers global benefits. Although some challenges are unavoidable, they are outweighed by the positive aspects and can be effectively addressed through appropriate measures.

question: Some children can learn more efficiently by watching TV. Therefore, children should watch TV regularly both in school and at home? do you agree or disagree?
human: Education is undeniably pivotal for an individual. Although, it is agreed that learning by watching TV is more effective to some children, I find it difficult not to oppose against the idea of having students spend more time on TVs. The reason for this is traditional education has its stand for most appropriate method. Thus, physical inactivity should not be encouraged for the aim of bettering youngsters' skills.To begin with, classic teaching methods has been scientifically proven and utilized as the best mode of educate a child. Technology and its advance, to some degrees, have influenced the educational industry positively. Nevertheless, it has not changed the importance of teachers' role in classes. The fact that students nowadays do their homework or researches on computers rather than go to libraries is an illustration for this. Yet, monitors are unable to replace the appearance of educators since their knowledge and adaptability is priceless. Therefore, teacher cannot be switched with some unconscious screens. Secondly, watching television is a very passive action and should not be promoted by increasing periods spent on it. On the other hand, children who have had such activities that interrelate to creativity, cooperation, competition tend to perform significantly better in general terms. For instance, a conducted experiment indicates out-performance in skills like differentiate types of plants or animals of a child that experienced various activities in nature to a child spent most of his time watching documentaries. As a result, such activities can equip a child necessary skill that is useful for his future career.In conclusion, despite the fact that learning by watching TV suits some children, kids should never be encourage to engage in such passive activity. School has been applying traditional teaching procedure since for ages. Additionally, it still performs at its best to equip a child with essential skills.
llm: Education is undoubtedly crucial for individual development. While some argue that learning through television can be more effective for certain children, I have reservations about the idea of allowing students to spend increased time in front of screens. This perspective stems from the enduring value of traditional educational methods, which have proven to be the most effective approach. Encouraging physical inactivity in the pursuit of improving children's skills is not advisable.Firstly, traditional teaching methods have been scientifically validated and recognized as the optimal way to educate children. Although advances in technology have positively impacted the educational landscape, they have not diminished the critical role that teachers play in the classroom. For example, today's students often complete their homework and research using computers instead of visiting libraries, highlighting the shift in resources. However, digital screens cannot replace the presence of educators, whose knowledge and adaptability are invaluable. Therefore, it is essential to recognize that teachers cannot simply be substituted by screens.Additionally, watching television is a passive activity and should not be encouraged by extending the time children spend engaged in it. In contrast, children who participate in activities that foster creativity, collaboration, and healthy competition tend to excel overall. Research indicates that children exposed to various hands-on experiences in nature perform better in distinguishing between different types of plants or animals compared to those who primarily watch documentaries. These interactive activities equip children with essential skills that will benefit them in their future careers.In conclusion, although some children may thrive from learning through television, encouraging such passive behavior is not advisable. Schools have adhered to traditional teaching methods for centuries, and they continue to provide the most effective means of equipping children with vital skills.

question: In some countries, with the widespread use of the internet, people are able to work or study from home, instead of having to travel to work or college. Do the advantages of this outweigh the disadvantages? Discuss and state your own opinion.
human: Undoubtedly this is an era of internet which impacts one's personal as well as professional life. The effect is seen more on the developed countries where people choose to work or study from home instead of going to office or university. Some consider this approach to be an advantage while others reject this as a disadvantage. Both the points of views will be discussed in order.On the one hand, the benefit that professionals or students get by connecting from home is enormous. For one, it helps working people to maintain work life balance. The best example is the new mother who can join her work as well as take care of her baby. People also get the desired flexibility in terms of working hours. For students too, studying from home is an attractive option. They save the travelling time to Universities and utilize that time on their studies. In a busy city like Tokyo, students waste a lot of time in travelling. Thus, the advantages that people enjoy by working or studying from home, are obvious.On the other hand, one part of the society, has doubt over the productivity of people who prefers to work or study from home. Many employers argue that once an employee works from isolation, he or she spends a lot of time in communication via phone or email with colleagues. This harms an employee's deliverable. Teachers think that students get affected too as they can not clear their doubts in study topics instantly. Due to this they lag in their studies. These factors affect people who work or study from home.Following both the point of views, the option of working or studying from home is thought to provide more benefits than drawbacks. It is hoped that people will continue to use internet to work or study and improve on the disadvantages into the foreseeable future.
llm: There is no doubt that we are living in an internet-driven era that significantly affects both personal and professional spheres. This impact is particularly evident in developed countries, where many individuals opt to work or study from home rather than commuting to an office or university. Some embrace this trend as beneficial, while others view it as detrimental. Both perspectives will be explored.On one side of the debate, the advantages of remote work or study are substantial. For instance, working from home allows individuals to achieve a better work-life balance. A prime example is a new mother who can manage her professional responsibilities while caring for her baby. Additionally, employees enjoy greater flexibility with their working hours. For students, studying from home presents an appealing alternative as they can eliminate travel time to universities and dedicate that time to their studies. In bustling cities like Tokyo, this can result in significant time savings. Thus, the perks of remote work or study are clearly advantageous.Conversely, some members of society question the productivity of those who choose to work or study from home. Many employers contend that employees working in isolation tend to spend excessive time communicating through phone calls or emails with coworkers, which can negatively impact their productivity. Similarly, teachers express concern that students may suffer since they cannot receive immediate assistance with academic questions, leading to gaps in their learning. These issues can significantly affect individuals who opt for remote work or study.Taking into account both viewpoints, it appears that the benefits of working or studying from home outweigh the drawbacks.
