It is anticipated that people will continue to leverage the internet for work and education, finding ways to mitigate the disadvantages in the foreseeable future.

question: International tourism has become the biggest industry in the world. Some people think it causes tension between people from different culture. Others think it leads to understanding between countries. To what extend do you agree or disagree?Ê
human: I agree with both opinions that international tourism not only causes tension but also leads to understanding between people from different culture, because most people will be trying to understand each other after they have conflict or debates.There is no doubt that some behaviors of the tourists are not welcome in the local area. Firstly, some people leave the rubbish after visiting the attractions. Therefore, those local residents have to clean the place frequently so that the new batch of tourists will have a tidy and neat environment. Moreover, tourists may offend the local people due to their different culture background. For example, Indians don't eat beef since they worship cows. Thus, if tourists want to respect the tradition, they will not order any beef in the local restaurant. On the other hand, in order to avoid the conflicts between foreigners and locals, people are trying to understand different culture and find solutions. For instance, tourists are given the brochures about the local traditions and customs before they visit the place. Furthermore, the tour guide are willing to help tourists to understand the culture from other countries. Thus, the possibility of the conflicts is reduced because the understanding between both parties.Obviously, people are looking for the solution such as understanding each other while they encounter the conflicts caused by international tourism. Hence, I think international tourism leads to both tension and understanding between people from different culture.
llm: I concur with both perspectives that international tourism can create tension as well as foster understanding among people from diverse cultural backgrounds. After conflicts or debates, most individuals tend to seek common ground and understanding.Undeniably, certain behaviors exhibited by tourists can be unwelcome in host communities. For instance, some visitors leave litter behind when exploring attractions, necessitating frequent clean-ups by local residents to ensure that subsequent tourists encounter a pleasant environment. Additionally, cultural differences can lead to misunderstandings; for example, Hindus abstain from eating beef due to their reverence for cows. In such cases, tourists who wish to show respect for local customs should refrain from ordering beef in local eateries.Conversely, efforts are being made to mitigate potential conflicts between visitors and locals by promoting cultural understanding. For instance, tourists often receive brochures outlining local traditions and customs prior to their arrival. Moreover, tour guides are eager to assist visitors in grasping the cultural nuances of their host country. As a result, the likelihood of conflicts diminishes as understanding grows between both parties.Clearly, people actively seek solutions, such as fostering understanding, when they face challenges arising from international tourism. Consequently, I believe that international tourism results in both tension and mutual understanding among people from different cultures.

question: Nowadays celebrities are more famous for their glamour and wealth than for their achievements, and this sets a bad example to young people. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
human: Some people think that celebrities are known for their glamorous lifestyle rather than the work they do. While I agree this will bring negative impacts on the younger generation, this is not necessarily the case for those celebrities who are ambitious in their jobs.It is true that some celebrities tend to show off their images in front of the public. For example, some movie starts enjoy wearing luxury brand clothes and showing their expensive life style in front of the media, thereby gaining the public attention. If they continue to behave in such a way, it will create a misleading image to young people who may think that extraordinary life can be achieved without hard work. Consequently, the attention of young people may become focused on chasing the dream of celebrity status. This is detrimental to study and work ethics and habits. Nevertheless, I believe that other celebrities do set up role models to young people because of their visible accomplishments. Firstly, celebrities such as sports player whose performance and professional skills can be directly seen by their fans. This means that people understand that the great deal of efforts on training is directly linked to their results. Therefore, this kind of self-made celebrity can inspire children to develop their talents through application and perseverance. Secondly, other celebrities such as musician also have achieved great success in their career. Take Michael Jackson as an example, his works are widely spread around the world, and have been extremely welcomed by the younger generation. His songs spread the idea that people should care about each other, which suggests to young people how to become a good member of society. In summary, although some celebrities misguide young people by showing their external wealth and appearance, other celebrities do lead young people in the right direction.
llm: Some individuals believe that celebrities are more recognized for their glamorous lifestyles than for their professional achievements. While I agree that this perception can adversely affect younger generations, it doesn’t apply universally to all ambitious celebrities.It is true that some celebrities tend to flaunt their wealth in public. For instance, certain movie stars enjoy donning luxury brand clothing and displaying their extravagant lifestyles in the media, which often draws public attention. If this behavior continues, it could create a misleading impression for young people, who might come to believe that an extraordinary life can be attained without hard work. As a result, they may prioritize the pursuit of celebrity status over dedication to their studies and work ethics, which can be harmful.On the other hand, I believe that many celebrities serve as positive role models for young people due to their visible achievements. For example, professional athletes demonstrate their skills and performance directly to their fans, illustrating how extensive training and effort correlate with success. This type of self-made celebrity can inspire children to cultivate their talents through hard work and determination. Furthermore, musicians like Michael Jackson have also attained remarkable success in their fields. His music, which resonates worldwide, has garnered immense popularity among younger audiences. His lyrics promote the idea of caring for one another, providing young people with a model for being responsible and compassionate members of society.In conclusion, while some celebrities may mislead young people with their ostentatious displays of wealth, others pave a positive path by showcasing the importance of hard work and personal achievement.

question: Children can effectively learn from watching television. Therefore they should be encouraged to watch TV in both home and school. Agree/Disagree?
human: TV is an immense source of information and pupils can learn and develop various skills by watching it. But I believe that by allowing students to watch TV at both school and house can adversely impact on their overall growth. If children spend too much time in front of TV, it will negatively impact their health and study.It is true that TV is one of the prime source of data and information. There are international and local news channels like BBC, CNBC, Etv Gujarati, Etv Marathi etc to keep individuals updated about latest happenings. By watching TV, children can develop skills in extra-curriculum activities. For example, Cooking programs teach about how to make new dishes and similarly, sports events like cricket, football can teach leadership skills, team building skills, communication skills and many more that can help students in their future jobs.But on other hand, watching TV for a continuously long hours can adversely impact children health. For example, they can get poor eyesight in early ages of childhood, and also develop back pain. Sometimes, students watch restrictive programs not allowed for their ages and this can have major psychological consequences. Many times, students get addictive to their favorite programs like Cartoon channels, or baseball and easily get distracted from study during exam period and this can seriously impact their grades. In conclusion, I believe demerits of watching TV outweigh its merits and thus if students were allowed to freely watch TV without any proper controls by parents or teachers then it would produce more negative effects on children.
llm: Television is a significant source of information, and students can acquire and enhance various skills through its content. However, I am convinced that allowing students to watch TV both at home and at school can have detrimental effects on their overall development. Excessive screen time can harm their health and academic performance.Indeed, television serves as a valuable source of news and information. Stations like BBC, CNBC, ETV Gujarati, and ETV Marathi keep viewers informed about current events. Additionally, programs can help children cultivate skills in extracurricular activities. For instance, cooking shows offer insights into preparing various dishes, while sports broadcasts, such as cricket and football, teach essential skills like leadership, teamwork, and communication, all of which can benefit students in their future careers.On the flip side, prolonged TV viewing can have negative repercussions on children's health. For instance, excessive screen time can lead to poor eyesight at a young age, as well as back pain. Furthermore, students may be drawn to programs that are not age-appropriate, potentially resulting in significant psychological consequences. Many kids become addicted to their favorite shows, such as cartoons or sports, which can distract them from studying, especially during exams, ultimately affecting their academic performance.In conclusion, I believe the disadvantages of watching TV outweigh its advantages. If students are permitted to watch television freely without proper guidance from parents or teachers, the negative impacts on their development could be significant.

question: It has been claimed that workers over 50 are not responsive to rapidly changing ideas in the modern workplace and that for this reason younger workers are to be preferred. To what extent would you support or reject this idea?
human: Throughout human history, the offspring has always proved its stronger adaptability and advancement than its predecessor. This is still true in the industrial society nowadays, where younger workers are preferably employed and promoted rather than over-50 workers. There are three reasons that can explain their unresponsiveness to the modern workplace.First and foremost, old workers are not a patch on the younger ones for their unchanged paradigm. The old were raised in poverty, probably caused by war, look at the world from a negative and pessimistic point of view. The misery is so ingrained in their mind that they refuse to change, or more precisely, to accept the existence of such modernity. For example, most would rather choose to piece together parts of a machine than have it done by a robot for their disbelief of its efficiency and safety compared with human's capability.Secondly, their unresponsiveness can be attributed to their attitude towards life. In other words, that they are aware of their deteriorating health and lack of enthusiasm comes with their taste for monotony and safe ideology. This, by all means, is outweigh by youngsters' adventurousness and bravery. Blatantly seen, success of most companies stems from young people, whose enterprising ideas that catch up with the world is regarded as wind of refreshment.Last but not least, knowledge is worth mentioning as a key factor to help young workers outrank the elderly. Who would the employer choose, an old man with old-fashioned education and a young man who is not only good at fundermentaly subject, but also knows how to program or how to speak foreign languages. Not to undermine old workers, but their lack of authority over such basically required fields in this day and age leads to their incompetence in every modern workplace.All in a nutshell, workers over 50 have proven themselves subordinate to the following generation in all aspects. However, in my point of view, it is still of great importance to remain the harmonious coexistence of both sides for the smooth sailing of the company.
llm: Throughout history, each generation has demonstrated greater adaptability and progress compared to the previous one. This trend continues in today’s industrial society, where younger workers are often favored for employment and promotion over those aged 50 and older. There are three primary reasons for this disparity in responsiveness to the modern workplace.First and foremost, older workers often struggle to adapt due to their static mindset. Having grown up in times marked by poverty and conflict, they tend to view the world with a more negative and pessimistic lens. This deeply rooted sense of hardship can lead to resistance to change and an unwillingness to embrace modern advancements. For instance, many older individuals would prefer to manually assemble machine parts rather than trust robots, driven by skepticism regarding the efficiency and safety of technological alternatives.Secondly, their responsiveness can also be linked to their approach to life. Many older workers are acutely aware of their declining health and may lack the enthusiasm that characterizes their younger counterparts. This preference for stability and routine contrasts sharply with the boldness and adventurous spirit often exhibited by younger individuals. It is evident that the success of numerous companies can be attributed to the innovative ideas of young employees who bring a much-needed fresh perspective.Finally, knowledge plays a crucial role in allowing younger workers to surpass their older colleagues. Employers are more likely to choose a young candidate who not only possesses a solid foundation in essential subjects but is also knowledgeable in programming and foreign languages, over an older individual with outdated skills. While we should not undermine the experience of older workers, their limited expertise in critical modern skills can hinder their competitiveness in today’s job market.In summary, workers over the age of 50 have largely been overshadowed by the next generation in various aspects. However, I believe it is vital to foster a harmonious coexistence between both groups for the continued success of any organization.

question: The use of machines are increasing day by day which is reducing physical work done by humans. Do you think advantages outweigh the disadvantages
human: Advancements in technology have touched new heights in past few decades. This can be seen no where clearer than in increasing use of machines now a days. These machines reduce the physical work done by humans. Some people think that this is a positive development while others believe it to be disadvantageous for humans.Both sides will be critiqued before a reasoned conclusion is reached.It is felt by many that the usage of machines is harmful for health of humans since machines decrease the work done by people. For example, in many institutions staircases are replaced by lifts now a days. People opt for elevators instead of climbing one or two flight of stairs. It is confirmed in a number of researches that daily usage of elevators in workplaces promotes obesity. So this example clearly shows the linkage between using machines and adverse health effects.On other side of the coin, many people believe that usage of machines makes work easier and less time is consumed for doing similar amount of work. Take the example of use of food processors in kitchens. The work of chopping, blending, grating, kneading has become so easy that people can not imagine their lives without this simple machine at their homes. Thus it is very obvious that using machines makes daily tasks less time consuming and less cumbersome.After analyzing these two points of view, it is believed that using machines is advantageous as machines make work easy and smooth. The negative effects on health can be put on the back seat because there are many other ways to exercise and stay healthy. Therefore, it is hoped that in coming time people will enjoy using more and more machines and will choose alternative ways to stay disease free.
llm: Technological advancements have reached unprecedented levels over the past few decades, particularly evident in the growing reliance on machines in our daily lives. These machines significantly reduce the physical labor required from humans. While some view this shift as a positive development, others argue it poses disadvantages for humanity. Both perspectives will be examined before a final conclusion is drawn.Many believe that increased reliance on machines can negatively impact human health, primarily because it diminishes physical activity. For instance, in numerous buildings, staircases have been largely replaced by elevators. People frequently choose lifts instead of climbing just one or two flights of stairs. Research has shown that the regular use of elevators in workplaces can contribute to obesity. This instance clearly illustrates the connection between machine usage and adverse health outcomes.Conversely, there are those who argue that machines simplify tasks and save time when completing comparable amounts of work. Consider the role of food processors in kitchens; functions such as chopping, blending, grating, and kneading have become so effortless that many can't envision their daily routines without these devices. Clearly, machines can make everyday chores more efficient and less burdensome.After evaluating both viewpoints, it can be concluded that the advantages of using machines outweigh the disadvantages. Although health concerns merit consideration, there are plenty of alternative methods for maintaining fitness. It is anticipated that as technology continues to progress, people will increasingly embrace the use of machines and find new ways to stay healthy.

question: When a country develops its technology, the traditional skills and ways of life die out. It is pointless to try and keep them alive. To what extend do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
human: These days, most of countries on the world invest for technology. It is evident that technology promotes economy. Many people think that conventional things will not exist and should be eliminated. I totally disagree this opinion.First of all, traditional skills and ways belong to value of culture. They make differences between countries. Every country has unique tradtions which show their creation, intelligence. Consequently, people feel pround of their country, so they keep reserving conventions. For example, ways to build a house in every country are different and they distinguish between countries.In addition, in some cases that traditional way can not replace by a new technology. Lot of people like to use traditional things because if their quality and durability. In paticular, vases are made by hand would be used more. Futhermore, there are plenty of works that using traditional way is unique method. For instance, making cone hats from leaves have to use hand. Not only because there is no machine for the work, but also it looks more beautiful when it is made by hand, so resulting in greater value economy.The last thing is about education. Traditional skills and ways of life will help youngsters study and know more history. Methods which their ancestors used in the past will be displayed again for new generations. After that, they might create somethings that are useful for life.In conclusion, technology has brought many benefits, but traditional skills and ways are always valuable and will last forever.
llm: In today's world, most countries are investing heavily in technology, as it is clear that technological advancements drive economic growth. However, many people believe that traditional practices should be phased out and discarded. I completely disagree with this perspective.Firstly, traditional skills and customs are an integral part of cultural identity. They differentiate nations from one another and reflect each country's unique creativity and intelligence. As a result, people take pride in their heritage and strive to preserve traditional practices. For instance, the methods of constructing houses vary from one country to another, showcasing their distinctiveness.Additionally, there are instances where traditional methods simply cannot be replaced by modern technology. Many individuals prefer traditional products due to their quality and durability. Handcrafted items, such as vases, are often more desirable. Moreover, certain crafts, like the creation of cone hats from leaves, require manual expertise. Not only is there no machine that can replicate this process, but hand-made items also possess an aesthetic appeal that adds to their economic value.Lastly, traditional skills and lifestyles play a crucial role in education. They provide young people with insights into history and the methods used by their ancestors. By reintroducing these practices to new generations, they may inspire innovative ideas that enhance contemporary life.In conclusion, while technology offers numerous benefits, traditional skills and practices hold immense value and will continue to endure.

question: The only way to reduce the amount of traffic in cities today is by reducing the need for people to travel from home for work, education or shopping. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Big cities nowadays can be described as melting pots. The problem off traffic overload, caused by overpopulation, has aroused interest of many city planners. It is argued that only if the demand to go out on the street is cut down can we solve the seemingly insurmountable issue of traffic gridlock. However, I have to profoundly disagree for there are still two viable solutions besides besides this way.First of all, public transport is a key factor to minimize the number of vehicles on the street. Buses and trains have been phased in the streets for quite a long time and have proven themselves the best candidates among all options. Apparently, a bus can carry no less than 30 people, while a train can carry as much as nine or even ten times of that number. Not to mention the fact that highway train is operated underground, which leaves the street above with buses and non-fuel-based vehicles. Together, they will lessen the crowded image in most cities nowadays.Second, rarely do we realize the helpful existence of urban areas. It is believed that if some of the enormous shopping malls or universities were relocated in the commuter belt, the city street would be les burstling and overly-teemed as it is now. As a rule of thumb, huge centers of attention distributed equally in a wide region means that residential areas will come along thus exert less pressure on the public facilities. The city itself will be absolved of enduring the influx of immigrants as well as unemployed people.In conclusion, city planner can still opt for non-personal vehicle and the exploitation of the suburb areas. It is highly recommended to put forward such solution, especially in some developing countries like Vietnam or China, with the ever-growing demand for job or education.
llm: Modern cities can be described as melting pots, facing the challenge of traffic congestion due to overpopulation. This issue has garnered significant attention from city planners, with the belief that reducing the need for people to venture onto the streets is the only way to address the persistent problem of gridlock. However, I strongly disagree, as there are two effective alternatives to consider.First and foremost, enhancing public transportation is crucial for reducing the number of vehicles on the road. Buses and trains have long been integral to urban transport, demonstrating their efficacy as reliable options. On average, a bus can accommodate at least 30 passengers, while a train can carry nine to ten times that amount. Furthermore, underground train systems alleviate street congestion by allowing public transit to operate below ground, clearing the roads for buses and other environmentally-friendly vehicles. Together, these modes of transportation can significantly ease the overcrowding in many cities.Secondly, the often-overlooked potential of urban sprawl should be acknowledged. If large shopping malls and universities were to be relocated to suburban areas, city streets could become less bustling and crowded. Distributing major attractions across a wider region encourages the development of residential neighborhoods and alleviates pressure on public infrastructure. This approach can also help manage the influx of migrants and the unemployed in city centers.In conclusion, city planners should explore alternatives to personal vehicles and capitalize on suburban development. This strategy is particularly beneficial for developing nations like Vietnam and China, where the demand for jobs and education continues to rise.

question: Celebrities are usually famous for glamour and wealth rather than their achievements. Some say taking them as an example can be dangerous for young people. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Young people all over the world are greatly influenced by media and celebrities. These celebrities are popular among younger generations because of their glamorous lifestyles. It is agreed that following celebrities can be dangerous for the youth. This will be proven by looking at how health and personality of young people is affected by following celebrities as their mentors. First of all, it is seen that following celebrities blindly affects the health of adolescents. Many young people indulge themselves in drugs and start smoking at an early age. For example, in a survey carried out in a university, it was asked to students that why did they start smoking, then around forty percent of individuals answered that they wanted to look like their favorite screen actor while smoking cigarettes. This example makes it clear that imitating celebrities has a negative influence on health of young individuals.Secondly, it is believed that when youth follows celebrities it affects personality of young people in a bad way. Adolescents follow not only the make up and attire of their favorite stars but also their behavior. For instance recently in a poll conducted by an American magazine it was found that most of the parents and teachers complain that teenagers use derogatory words and abusive language at home and at schools. So, this example makes it obvious that these glamorous celebrities have a poor effect on the conduct of young people.Thus to conclude, it can be said that when young people follow celebrities, it affects their health as well as behavior in a negative way. This has an overall effect on personality and future of an individual. Therefore it is recommended that young people should be educated not to follow these celebrities blindly, rather they should focus on their career so that they may hope for a bright future.
llm: Young individuals worldwide are significantly influenced by media and celebrities, who captivate younger generations with their extravagant lifestyles. It is widely acknowledged that emulating these celebrities can pose risks to the youth. This assertion can be supported by examining how the health and behavior of young people are impacted when they look to celebrities as role models.To begin with, the uncritical following of celebrities can adversely affect the health of adolescents. Many young people find themselves engaging in substance abuse, including smoking, at an alarmingly early age. For instance, a survey conducted at a university revealed that around 40% of respondents cited a desire to emulate their favorite film star while smoking as their motivation for picking up the habit. This illustrates the harmful effects of celebrity imitation on the health of young individuals.Furthermore, it is argued that following celebrities can negatively influence the personalities of young people. Adolescents often mimic not just the fashion and makeup of their beloved stars, but also their attitudes and behaviors. A recent poll by an American magazine found that many parents and educators have expressed concern about teenagers using offensive language both at home and in school. This clearly indicates that the behavior of these glamorous celebrities can have a detrimental effect on the conduct of youth.In conclusion, it is evident that the adulation of celebrities can lead to negative consequences for young people's health and behavior. Such influences ultimately shape their personalities and future prospects. Therefore, it is essential to educate young individuals to avoid following celebrities blindly, encouraging them instead to concentrate on their careers and aspire for a brighter future.

question: Universities should accept equal numbers of male and female students in every subject. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: The gender issues have been already discussing for many years in order to give solutions for realising the equal proportion of developing human resources. Implementing the statue and right of equal education are believed as a sustainable policy that should be held. Nowadays, there are many institutions that accept the same average number of male and female students in many kinds of course. I strongly agree about this statement.The proportion of women is rising year by year in many parts of the world recently. Automatically, the issue stimulates the stakeholders from many places to think what kind of preparations they should take for stabilising the economic growth and the quality life of people. We can see now that women tend to work in various fields which in the past normally done by men such as being engineers, and dealing with machines. Those activities have proven that women can also do the men's works. Therefore, female students are indicated having the same potential and capability as men.Another reason is order to gaining higher education degree as it is required to establish a person's career. These days, it is so hard for young people to get a proper job when they have not degree certificate from Universities. So, learning from human's history, education provides someone to widen his or her knowledge and experience for facing the real situation of workplace through subject taught in college. According to this opinion, giving equal education for both men and women is a must.In conclusion, the needs for having developed-skills and gaining degree certificate in order to build someone's career are totally needed to implement and applied for any gender. As the world's situation is always changing, act for distributing education needs are absolutely important to compete the future challenges.
llm: Gender issues have been discussed for many years, focusing on solutions to achieve equality in the development of human resources. The implementation of equal educational rights and policies is viewed as a sustainable approach that should be prioritized. Currently, many institutions admit an equal number of male and female students across various courses, and I strongly support this initiative.The representation of women is increasing year by year in many regions of the world. This trend compels stakeholders to consider the preparations necessary to ensure stable economic growth and a high quality of life for all. We now see women working in diverse fields that were traditionally male-dominated, such as engineering and machine operations. These examples demonstrate that women are fully capable of performing jobs typically associated with men, indicating that female students possess the same potential and abilities as their male counterparts.Additionally, obtaining a higher education degree is essential for advancing one’s career. Today, it is increasingly difficult for young individuals to secure a good job without a university degree. History shows that education broadens knowledge and experience, preparing individuals for the realities of the workplace through college curricula. Therefore, providing equal educational opportunities for both men and women is essential.In conclusion, the demand for skilled professionals and degree holders is critical for career development, and this must apply to all genders. As the global landscape continues to evolve, prioritizing equitable access to education is imperative to meet future challenges.

question: It has been proved that smoking kills. In some countries it has been made illegal for people to smoke in all public places except in certain areas. All countries should make these rules. Do you agree or disagree with this statement?
human: People the world over have designated smoothing as a shameful practice and a lethal habit. Several millions of smokers die suffering from cancers such as lung and oral. This bad habit also responsible for causing health hazards to passive-smokers: who are around smoking is taken place. Thus, it is argued that smoking should be made prohibited in public places such as bus and railway stations. This position will be proven by looking at how this arrangement has benefited both general public as well as smokers.To start, non-smoking public would be undoubtedly benefited by enforcing such restrain. Prior to 1980's public places in Sri Lanka, illustrates unpleasant situation where people smoked freely. Even in public transportation they engaged in this intolerant bad habit, some instances that lead to belligerent incidents. After enforcing restrictions the situation came to control and this act as benefit rendered to the public.In addition to this, introducing smoking ban in public places would greatly discourage people from engaging tobacco puffing. For instance, further enforcement banned smoking in capital in Sri Lanka has reduced this consumption related diseases and deaths, as per the ministry of health. As this shows, smoking restrictions has successfully daunted public from this bad puffing that put less strain on country's healthcare systems.After analyzing smoke illegalization in public places in Sri Lanka, it has been proven benefits people enjoy this arrangement. It is thus hoped governments would consider smoke banning in public places following footsteps of Sri Lanka as well as many other countries.
llm: Across the globe, smoking has been widely recognized as a harmful and shameful habit. Millions of smokers succumb to diseases like lung and oral cancer, while non-smokers, or passive smokers, also face health risks when exposed to secondhand smoke. Given these dangers, there is a compelling argument for prohibiting smoking in public spaces such as bus and railway stations. This perspective can be supported by examining the positive outcomes that such a ban has on both the general public and smokers.Firstly, non-smokers would benefit significantly from implementing such restrictions. Before the 1980s, public places in Sri Lanka were characterized by rampant smoking, leading to uncomfortable situations and even conflicts in public transport. Since the enforcement of smoking bans, this issue has been effectively managed, resulting in a healthier environment for everyone.Moreover, instituting a smoking ban in public areas would serve as a strong deterrent against tobacco use. For example, a further crackdown on smoking in Sri Lanka's capital has led to a notable decline in smoking-related diseases and fatalities, according to the Ministry of Health. This evidence illustrates how smoking restrictions have successfully discouraged the habit, alleviating pressure on the country’s healthcare system.In summary, the experience of Sri Lanka in regulating smoking in public places has demonstrated significant benefits for its citizens. It is hoped that governments worldwide will take note of these advantages and consider similar smoking bans in public areas, following the example set by Sri Lanka and other nations.

question: Tourism is a modern form of colonialism. It distorts local economies, causes environmental damage and ruins the places it exploits. To what extent would you support or reject this idea?
human: Tourism, since its first appearance a long time ago, can be described as a controversial celebrity. Some believe that tourism is attributed to domestic economic distortion, environmental devastation and irrepairable damage to the exploited places. However, I strongly disagree with this misconcept for the two following reasons.First of all, tourism plays an indispensable role in nurturing the economy in a way it is meant to be. Basically, places of interest often locate in the wilderness areas, of which economy, before their appearance, haven't blossmed yet. Not until the investment of some companies do chains of hotels and services spring up. It will, by all means, attract considerable attention which goes hand in hand with the enormous income for the local residents. In other word, tourism helps divert the local economy to its right direction, which exploit the best out of its own potential.Secondly, even though environmental damage is inevitable, it is not tourism to be blamed for. In order to turn a wilderness into a place of attraction, the planners must have taken the nourishment of the sceneries into thorough consideration. To be precise, for instance, a fortune is spent on trimming the trees, watering the flowers, preserving and balancing the local fauna and flora, in the hope of beautifying the wild. Not to mention ecotourism, a new kind of environment-friendly service, which gives all environmentalists and nature lovers a hand in raising the awareness of people in protecting their coexistent creatures. Because of that, tourism should not be alledged to be notorous for its detriment to the ecological diversity.All thing considered, tourism has proven its friendly attitude towards the exploited areas in terms of finance and environmental impact. In my opinion, the combination of tourism and teaching process is highly recommended in pursuit of a harmonial relationship between human and their surroundings.
llm: Tourism, which has a long history, can be seen as a contentious celebrity. While some argue that tourism leads to economic distortions, environmental harm, and irreversible damage to the places it touches, I firmly disagree with this perspective for two key reasons.Firstly, tourism is essential for fostering economic growth in a manner that benefits local communities. Often, tourist attractions are situated in remote or rural areas that have not previously flourished economically. The arrival of tourism investments—such as hotels and services—creates job opportunities and generates significant revenue for local residents. In other words, tourism helps to steer the local economy in a positive direction, maximizing its inherent potential.Secondly, while some environmental degradation may occur, tourism should not be held solely responsible. The transformation of a wilderness area into a tourist destination involves careful planning and attention to environmental sustainability. Substantial resources are invested in maintaining the natural landscape: companies often spend significant amounts on tree pruning, landscaping, and preserving local wildlife in order to enhance the beauty of these areas. Moreover, ecotourism has emerged as a responsible approach that engages environmentalists and nature enthusiasts alike in promoting awareness and conservation of ecosystems. Therefore, it is unfair to label tourism as detrimental to ecological diversity.In conclusion, tourism has demonstrated a positive impact on both the economies of the regions it touches and their environmental stewardship. I believe that integrating tourism with educational efforts is crucial for fostering a harmonious relationship between humans and their natural surroundings.

question: In the last 20 years there have been significant development in the field of information technology (IT), for example the World Wide Web and communication by e-mail. However, future developments in IT are likely to have more negative effects than positive. To what extent do you agree with this view?
human: The appearance of information technology (IT) in the last 20 years has brought about significant developments in life standard as well as work efficiency. However, it is believed that the evolution also proves to be detrimental. In my opinion, there is a likelihood that future developments in IT will put the users at their own expense.With the rapid developing pace, IT seems to have turned its users to its slaves. In the past, there used to be World Wide Web or e-mail, but the cyber world now varies form games, online TV shows to means of communication, and probably still keeps going. Such irrisistible temptations drift people from the real world to the unreal ones, resulting in their dependence on technical equipment. What is more, the lack of soft skills attained form outdoor activities will agitate the IT addict, therefore, staying inside with computer and mobile phone will always be the first alternative.Future IT has also aroused concern on health issues. The existence of Skype, Viber or Yahoo has notably reduced even the longest distance into one click. As a result, rarely do people go out of their comfot zone, provided with snack and air conditioner, to assemble with others in flesh. Needless to say, their action will make a beeline for obesity, short-sighted, diabetes and other heart-related problems.In conclusion, despite the contribution of IT to the society, its effect on the users' independence and prositution should not be out of concern. To my mind, there have to be some alterations before IT has more serious impact on each individual's life.
llm: The emergence of information technology (IT) over the past two decades has significantly enhanced both living standards and work productivity. However, it is also believed that this evolution has negative consequences. In my view, future advancements in IT are likely to come at the expense of its users.With the rapid pace of development, IT appears to have transformed users into dependents. While the Internet and email were once the primary tools of communication, the digital landscape now encompasses a myriad of distractions, including online gaming, streaming services, and various forms of social interaction, which continue to expand. These enticing options pull people away from reality and foster a reliance on technology. Moreover, the decline in soft skills, which are typically developed through outdoor activities, exacerbates this dependence, making time spent indoors with devices the preferred choice.Additionally, the future of IT raises concerns regarding health issues. Platforms like Skype, Viber, and Yahoo have made it possible to connect with anyone around the world with just a click. However, this convenience often discourages people from stepping outside their comfort zones, leading to social isolation and a sedentary lifestyle characterized by constant snacking and air conditioning. Consequently, this behavior can contribute to obesity, nearsightedness, diabetes, and various heart-related ailments.In conclusion, while IT has made valuable contributions to society, its impact on users' autonomy and well-being deserves careful consideration. I believe that changes are necessary to prevent IT from having a more adverse effect on individuals' lives.

question: An increasing number of people are turning to vegetarianism. some belive that people are following a vegetarian diet for reasons other than animal rights issues. Do you agree with this? Give reasons why some people are choosing to become vegetarian
human: Since the dawn of time, human has considered meat as a fundamental protein sources. Meat has served as the main dish in almost every family's meals all around the world. Recent years, however, has seen a rapid increase in the number of vegetarians. Some people claim that this is brought about by the care for animal rights issue, others think it is much beyond that. It is clear to me that people avoid eating meat mostly for the sake of their health and relegious aspect.Firstly, health improvement is the main reason for vegetarian diet to become so popular. Many researchers have convinced that many kinds of vegetable contain antioxydant which can prevent cancer. This fortifies the fact that a vegetable diet can do good for our health. Although some argue that a meal without meat can lead to a lack of protein intake, it is proved that many kinds of bean such as soy bean or pea are also comparable protein sources.Secondy, relegious beliefs also contributes to a vegetarian diet. Some religion, such as Buddha, believes that animals were human being in their previous life, so eating their meat mean you eat the flesh of your parent sentient beings. It is often said that this view is rather unscientific. However, I am convinced that it is vital to follow one's own religious practices which can bring the enlightenment in mind.To sum up, it is evident for me that people choose to become vegetarians for health and religious concern rather than the benefits of animals. However, a meal which is nutritionally balanced is always most recommended.
llm: Since the beginning of time, humans have regarded meat as a key source of protein. For many families around the globe, meat has traditionally been the centerpiece of their meals. However, in recent years, there has been a notable surge in the number of vegetarians. Some attribute this trend to a growing concern for animal rights, while others believe the reasons extend beyond that. I believe that the primary motivations for people to avoid meat are health considerations and religious beliefs.First and foremost, health improvement is a significant factor contributing to the rising popularity of vegetarianism. Many researchers have found that various vegetables contain antioxidants that may help prevent cancer, reinforcing the idea that a plant-based diet can be beneficial for our health. While some argue that forgoing meat could lead to insufficient protein intake, it has been shown that various legumes, such as soybeans and peas, can provide comparable protein sources.Secondly, religious beliefs also play a crucial role in the choice to adopt a vegetarian diet. For instance, some religions, such as Buddhism, hold the view that animals were once humans in previous lives, suggesting that consuming their meat equates to eating the flesh of sentient beings we may have known. While this perspective may seem unscientific to some, I believe it is essential to adhere to one's religious practices, as they can lead to mental enlightenment.In conclusion, it is clear to me that individuals are drawn to vegetarianism primarily for health and religious reasons, rather than solely for animal welfare. Nonetheless, it is always advisable to maintain a nutritionally balanced diet, regardless of dietary choices.

question: When a country develops its technology, the traditional skills and ways of life die out. It is pointless to try and keep them alive. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
human: There is no doubt the application of technological developments in some countries will be accompanied with modern skills and new lifestyles. It is argued that these so-called cultural invasions will result in the distinction of national traditions, and there is no need to maintain them. However, from my point of view, what can be expected, is a change of the role of the tradition but not its disappearance from the society.It is undeniable that the country's culture is passed down mainly through traditional skills and ways of life. For instance, in Vietnam, many water puppet shows which once demonstrated our seasonal agriculture and communal activities, are today substituted by cinemas and music concerts. This means the young generation can solely get access to their ancestor's early life through books and images, which otherwise would be much more easily absorbed.In tradition, a person should look back at the past, mainly by means of custom handcraft or antique lifestyle, to progress. Understanding why, and how our predecessors survived through thick and thin will probably be invaluable lessons for us today. Also, study form their mistakes helps us accomplish our goal with smooth sailing.To sumarize, there should never be any replacement for traditional skills or ways of life. They are the ones that teach, and will teach us to be self-esteem and experienced, which means their preservation throughout history deserve our attention.
llm: There is no doubt that the implementation of technological advancements in certain countries will bring about modern skills and new lifestyles. Some argue that these so-called cultural invasions will lead to the decline of national traditions, suggesting that there is no need to preserve them. However, I believe that rather than disappearing, traditions will evolve in their significance within society.It is clear that a country's culture is largely transmitted through traditional skills and ways of life. For example, in Vietnam, numerous water puppet shows that once showcased our seasonal agriculture and community activities have now been replaced by cinemas and music concerts. As a result, younger generations can only learn about their ancestors' earlier lives through books and images, which is a less immersive experience.Tradition encourages individuals to reflect on the past, primarily through traditional crafts and antique lifestyles, in order to progress. Understanding the struggles and triumphs of our predecessors can provide us with invaluable lessons for navigating contemporary challenges. Learning from their mistakes can also help us achieve our goals more smoothly.In conclusion, traditional skills and ways of life should never be substituted. They are essential for teaching us self-esteem and imparting valuable experiences. Thus, their preservation throughout history is deserving of our attention.

question: Without capital punishment (the death penalty) our lives are less secure and crimes of violence increase. Capital punishment is essential to control violence in society. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: "Capital punishment or the death penalty is a legal process whereby a person is put to death by the state as a punishment for a crime." In recently years, many countries have polished the law of the death penalty. In the whole world, 51% countries have polished death penalty; even, it is at 98% in Europe. Some people claim that without this punishment our lives would be less secure and crimes of violence would increase. However, others argue that it is not essential to control violence in society by the death penalty. Personally, I think it is no evidence about the reduction of crime rates due to the death penalty because of many reasons.Firstly, capital punishment is a form of revenge which creates violent culture. Crimes kill someone which is illegal; nevertheless, the government use law to punish them, which is the same way they sinned but in a legal one. As a fact that the criminal is repeated second time; also, it is regarded as the "legalized revenge" to victims' family. Hence, death penalty neither controls the violent in society nor creates a violent culture.Secondly, nobody has the right to take another human life. It is undeniable that the rights of life are the basic and vital rights of a human being. No one has the right to take the life of a human; even if he committed murder. If you kill a criminal, you become a criminal. Moreover, if we think that killing is the best way to solve the problem, it is neither unethical nor immoral. In short, crimes seem to increase due to the capital punishment.Finally, with some of serious criminals, capital punishment is an easy way out. Criminals should be punished for their misdeeds. If they kill someone and end their life by dead without paying for their sins, it is so easy for them. They do not undergo any pain or misery. Why do not we have other wisely punishments? As we can see some industries such as mining, oil and gas extraction, reclamation, etc, needs many labors. Why do not punish them by doing something meaningful for the country- it is better. Moreover, rehabilitation and education is also a better way in order to prevent or minimize offensive acts. To conclude, capital punishment is a form of legalized revenge, it is an easy way for serious crimes, and nobody has rights to take others life; thus, it neither demines crimes of violence nor be essential to control violence in society. The world should consider clearly about polishing the law of the dead penalty.
llm: Capital punishment, often referred to as the death penalty, is a legal procedure through which the state executes a person as punishment for a crime. In recent years, many nations have reformed their death penalty laws. Globally, 51% of countries have abolished capital punishment, and this figure rises to 98% in Europe. Some argue that eliminating this punishment would lead to increased insecurity and a rise in violent crimes. Conversely, others contend that the death penalty is not necessary for controlling violence in society. In my view, there is insufficient evidence to support the claim that capital punishment effectively reduces crime rates for several reasons.Firstly, capital punishment represents a form of revenge that perpetuates a culture of violence. While crimes are already illegal and carry life-altering consequences, the state’s use of lethal punishment mirrors the violence of the original offense, albeit in a legally sanctioned manner. Additionally, it does not deter repeat offenders and often serves as a form of "legalized revenge" for the victims' families, failing to address the underlying issues of violence within society.Secondly, no one has the authority to take another human life. The right to life is fundamental to all human beings, and this right should not be forfeited, even by those who have committed serious crimes. Engaging in state-sanctioned killing reduces us to a cycle of criminality: if we execute a murderer, we risk becoming complicit in a similar act. Furthermore, resorting to killing as a solution raises ethical and moral concerns. Ultimately, capital punishment may contribute to an increase in crime rather than its reduction.Lastly, for some serious offenders, capital punishment serves as an easy escape from their responsibilities. Those who commit heinous acts should face appropriate punishment for their actions, and execution deprives them of the opportunity to truly atone for their crimes. In fact, why not impose more constructive penalties? Industries such as mining, oil and gas extraction, and reclamation require a significant workforce; assigning offenders to meaningful labor could prove beneficial for society. Additionally, focusing on rehabilitation and education offers a more effective approach to preventing future offenses.In conclusion, capital punishment functions as a form of legalized revenge, offers an easy escape for serious criminals, and violates the fundamental right to life. Therefore, it neither deters violent crime nor is essential for maintaining social order. It is imperative for the world to reevaluate its stance on the death penalty and consider more humane alternatives.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? A zoo has no useful purpose. Use specific reasons and examples to explain your answer.
human: For a long time, the zoo has been a second home to endangered animals. However, other people believe that the existence of zoos is next to nothing. In my opinion, the zoo deserves maintenance and public respect for two specific reasons.First of all, the zoo should be considered as a means of education with regard to providing real and vivid materials for learners. With zoos, pupils will have a chance of observing the habit and unique instinct of, for instance, a lion or a crocodile. At a higher level, it is of university students' benefits to do biological research based on practical statistics and live recordings, which otherwise would not be at hand. This means that the zoos conduce to the acquisition of knowledge at various levels.Secondly, the zoo also serve as a means of ecological protection. Nowadays the process of globalisation is accompanied by the encroachment upon natural habitats, which consequently calls for the help of zoos. What is more, the ever-increasing huntings are having a heavy toll on rare and specious species. Only when zoos appear are such distinction-driven animals as: giraffe, panda, koala or leopard provided with their own inaccessible territory.In sum, the role of zoos towards both human and animals is undeniably indispensable. It is highly recommended that zoos should be seen with different perspective in order to function at their most efficiency.
llm: For many years, zoos have served as a sanctuary for endangered species. However, some individuals argue that the existence of zoos is unjustifiable. In my view, zoos merit support and public appreciation for two main reasons.Firstly, zoos play a vital role in education by providing real-life experiences for learners. They offer students the opportunity to observe the behaviors and unique instincts of animals like lions and crocodiles up close. For university students, zoos serve as valuable resources for biological research, offering access to practical data and live observations that would otherwise be difficult to obtain. This illustrates how zoos contribute to knowledge acquisition across diverse educational levels.Secondly, zoos are crucial for ecological conservation. In today's world, the forces of globalization often encroach on natural habitats, necessitating the involvement of zoos. Additionally, the rising trend of illegal hunting poses a significant threat to rare and endangered species. Zoos provide a safe haven for animals such as giraffes, pandas, koalas, and leopards, offering them protected environments that are otherwise unavailable in the wild.In conclusion, the importance of zoos for both human society and wildlife is truly significant. It is essential to reevaluate our perceptions of zoos to ensure they can function at their highest potential.

question: Several languages are in danger of extinction because they are spoken by very small numbers of people. Some people say that governments should spend public money on saving these languages, while others believe that would be a waste of money. Discuss both these views and give your opinion?
human: It is true that the increasing number of languages which are at risk of extinction has become one of the most significant issues that many people of today's society are very concerned for. The question whether our government should make an effort to preserve them by investing more money on that minority languages or not is still a debatable one. I personally suppose that no matter how widely they are spoken, every language should be protected from being disappeared.There are several reasons why saving regional languages could be seen as a waste of money. Firstly, we need to consider that if the government expands the use scope of that languages, it can be really expensive because educational programmes will need to be given so as to keep young people learning and using them. For example, some certain areas in the Southern Vietnam have been trying to help their secondary school students who are originally from khmer people speak their language beside Vietnamese, so the local government has recently struggled with their costly investments on language teachers, facilities and appropriate materials. Secondly, it is obvious that in many aspects such as communication, trade, cooperation as well as transaction, it will be absolutely easier for the whole society to work together in one language only.Despite of the above arguments, i still strongly believe that the government should try to preserve minority languages. This is because language can be seen as much more than just one method of communication. In addition, forming a language must be undergone thousands of years; thus, it deserves to be respected and preserved. Last but not least, language is one of the essential factors creating the differences and unique cutures in the world. Therefore, saving the use of that kinds of languages in this case generally is the most important element of the cultural diversity's preservation.In conclusion, although letting languages spoken by ethnic minorities be extinct seems to be very beneficial, it will definitely impact seriously on many other aspects especially in the loss of our cultural heritages.
llm: The rising number of languages at risk of extinction has become a major concern in today's society. The question of whether our government should invest more resources into preserving these minority languages remains a topic of debate. Personally, I believe that every language, regardless of its number of speakers, deserves protection from extinction.There are several arguments suggesting that efforts to save regional languages may be an unjustifiable expense. Firstly, expanding the use of these languages could result in significant costs, particularly through the need for educational programs aimed at encouraging young people to learn and use them. For instance, in certain areas of Southern Vietnam, initiatives have been implemented to help secondary school students from the Khmer community speak their native language alongside Vietnamese. However, the local government has faced challenges due to the high costs associated with hiring language teachers, providing facilities, and acquiring appropriate materials. Additionally, it's evident that unifying communication, trade, cooperation, and transactions in a single language can streamline interactions within society.Despite these arguments, I firmly believe that the government should prioritize the preservation of minority languages. Language transcends mere communication; it embodies cultural history and the evolution of societies over thousands of years, deserving our respect and protection. Moreover, language plays a crucial role in shaping the unique identities and cultures around the world. Therefore, safeguarding these languages is vital for maintaining cultural diversity.In conclusion, while allowing the extinction of languages spoken by ethnic minorities might appear advantageous in certain respects, it would have far-reaching negative effects, particularly regarding the loss of our cultural heritage.

question: Out of a country's health budget, a large proportion should be diverted from treatment to spending on health education and preventative measures. To what extent do you agree or disagreee with this statement?
human: There has always been a saying in medicine: "Prevention is better than cure". This statement has raised a question whether the government should allocate a large sum out of the national health budget to educating and phasing in health-protected measures. In my opinion, this plan should be put into practice for the two reasons mentioned accordingly.No one can argue the importance to include health lessons in school programmes, especially at primary level, in the hope of raising people's awareness. Children should be taught about balanced diets, nutritious food as well as harmful ones, thereby they will have a fundamental grasp of how to lead a healthy lifestyle. What is more, it is much easier for people at early ages to form a habit of, for instance, not consuming too much fast food, over-fried food or intoxicants.In addition, it will be of economic benefit to pre-empt certain kinds of diseases. Needless to say, such unpreventable illnesses as cancer or HIV will cost the victim a fortune, not to cure, but to lengthen his longevity for 1 or 2 more years. Similarly, if humans tend to keep fit more regularly by participating in outdoor activities or using health-care product, obesity, myopia or other diseases that require expensive treatments will never stand a chance.To sum up, I have to concede to the materialistic diversion from treatment to health education and preventative measures. This will yield positive results on not only the people's physical and mental development but also their finance.
llm: A well-known adage in medicine states, "Prevention is better than cure." This raises the question of whether the government should invest a significant portion of the national health budget in education and preventive health initiatives. In my view, implementing this strategy is essential for two key reasons.Firstly, the integration of health education into school curricula, particularly at the primary level, is crucial for fostering awareness among young people. Students should learn about balanced diets, nutritious foods, and the dangers of unhealthy ones, equipping them with the knowledge needed to maintain a healthy lifestyle. Additionally, it is easier for children to develop positive habits early on, such as avoiding excessive consumption of fast food, fried foods, and harmful substances.Secondly, focusing on prevention can lead to significant economic advantages by reducing the incidence of certain diseases. Treating serious conditions like cancer or HIV can be exorbitantly expensive, often requiring vast sums just to extend life by a year or two. Conversely, if people engage in regular physical activity and embrace health-conscious products, the likelihood of developing costly issues such as obesity or myopia diminishes.In conclusion, I strongly support the shift from a treatment-centric approach to one that prioritizes health education and preventive strategies. This transition will not only enhance individuals’ physical and mental well-being but will also provide financial benefits.

question: University education should be restricted to the very besst academic students, rather than being available to a large proportion of young people. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Universtiy is an entrance to life. It equips us with a package of wisdom and virtue to succeed. It is the importance of university that raises a question whether students with best scholastic performance deserve university study or just any young wishful people. Both sides are to be discussed before a conclusion is reached.To begin with, outstanding academic students are eligible for university due to their intellectual advantage. To be precise, such abstract or complicated informatin, easily absorbed by those students, may prove as a matter of pressure for those who lack equivalent skills. Besides, it is undeniable that one deserves what he has done. University is like a gift presented to those who have gone to great length to attain.However, university is not just about academic studies but also a place to nurture artistic talent and develop soft skills. Therefore, it should be up for grabs for a majority of young people, who wish to pursue their passion as well as develop comprehensively. What is more, there is a tendency for social vices to rise if university is to be restricted to only the best people. Apart from the disheartened ones, many devoiding of neccessary preparations are likely to be recipes for failure when applying for jobs, mostly the white-collar ones.In conclusion, university restriction has both pros and cons. In my opinion, it will yield more negative results than positive ones. That's why it should be made available for a wide range of learners.
llm: University serves as a gateway to life, providing us with a wealth of knowledge and values essential for success. This significance brings forth the question of whether only the top-performing students should be granted access to higher education or if the opportunity should extend to any ambitious young individuals. Both perspectives warrant discussion before arriving at a conclusion.Firstly, high-achieving academic students are well-suited for university due to their intellectual prowess. Such students can easily grasp complex concepts that might overwhelm their peers who lack similar skills. Moreover, it is only fair that those who have worked diligently should reap the benefits of their efforts. University can be viewed as a reward for those who have dedicated themselves to their studies.On the other hand, university is not solely a hub for academic learning but also a nurturing ground for artistic expression and the development of interpersonal skills. Thus, it should be accessible to a broader range of young people who are eager to explore their passions and grow holistically.Furthermore, limiting university access to only the top students could lead to a rise in social issues. Those who are discouraged by such restrictions may find it challenging to transition into the workforce, particularly in competitive fields, as they might lack the necessary preparation.In conclusion, while there are merits to restricting university access, the drawbacks may outweigh the benefits. I believe that higher education should be made available to a diverse array of learners.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answerÊ
human: Recently, there has been a social concern with regard to who is the best teacher for children's education. Indeed, children grow up with two important people, their parents and teachers, and both are important in children's development. As far as I am concerned, I agree with the view that the teacher is the best option for children's education in some aspects. In the first place, school teachers are more qualified than parents in the field of education. For instance, to be able to obtain the teacher certificates, people need years of training at their normal schools to learn theoretical knowledge. However, in comparison to teachers, parents tend to have less knowledge to teach their children's subjects such as mathematics and physics.Furthermore, teaching staff are professional and experienced in terms of promoting children's communication skills. For example, after many years of teaching experience, teacher are able to know how to help children to develop important life skills such as learning personal boundaries, facing future problems and learning important conflict resolution skills. By contrast, parents are facing difficult generation gap with their children because they are less likely to know how to handle family conflicts in an efficient way. Last but not least, compared with teachers, parents do not have enough time to spend with their children. Nowadays we are facing a global economic crisis and it is necessary for both parents to work, hence there is only limited time for them to teach their children. Thus, it was impossible for them to be a good teacher.In conclusion, teachers are the best for children's education. Not only do they contribute much to children's professional skills but also they can teach their students important social communication techniques in order to survive in this competitive world.
llm: In recent times, there has been increasing concern about who plays the most pivotal role in a child's education: parents or teachers. Children are influenced significantly by both of these key figures in their lives, each contributing to their overall development. Personally, I believe that teachers are often the better option for children's education in several important ways.Firstly, teachers possess greater qualifications than parents when it comes to educational expertise. For instance, acquiring a teaching certificate requires years of training in educational theory and practice. In contrast, parents may lack the specialized knowledge needed to effectively teach subjects like mathematics and physics to their children.Moreover, educators are professionals with extensive experience in fostering communication skills among children. After years of teaching, they develop the ability to help children cultivate essential life skills, such as setting personal boundaries, tackling future challenges, and resolving conflicts. On the other hand, parents often struggle with generational gaps, which can hinder their capacity to manage family disputes effectively.Additionally, parents typically have less time to devote to their children's education. In today's world, many families face economic pressures that necessitate both parents working, leading to limited opportunities for them to engage in teaching. Consequently, it becomes challenging for parents to fulfill the role of a good educator.In conclusion, teachers are ideally positioned to provide a quality education for children. They not only enhance children's academic skills but also impart crucial social and communication abilities necessary for navigating our competitive society.

question: When choosing a job, the salary is the most important consideration. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Along with the increasing physical demands of human life, salary has become the most influential consideration in defining careers of everyone. I personally suppose that there are still many other aspects which should be seen as important as income when people choose a job. In the following paragraphs, some of my viewpoints would be given and analyzed respectively.On one hand, i agree that money is very essential in order to meet human' basic needs. More specifically, people tend to choose high salary jobs so as to not only help themselves but also support partially or wholly their family's living needs such as food , clothes, accommodation, education, medication. It is obvious that people who are woking in art or painting industries, for example, will find it quite difficult to live comfortably and enjoyably. This is because they are doing what they love, their income however seems to be quite low compared to many other career paths.On the other hand, i believe that if we are passionate about what we are working, we are likely to achieve success easily in that field. There are plenty of people, who are now really successful, have started working in challenging as well as competitive fields as singers, dancers and painters. Besides, important factors in choosing a job such as level of happiness, satisfaction of jobs, personal relationships, professional skills, working environment, managers and colleagues should not be underestimated. Finally, some people choose a career due to their desire to help others and contribute positively to their countries and societies.In conclusion, it is undeniable that income is still a vital determination impacting us on choices of careers. Nonetheless, passion on jobs, in my opinion, can bring actual happiness and help us get promoted in working to earn even more money later on.
llm: As the physical demands of modern life continue to rise, salary has emerged as a key factor influencing career choices for many individuals. However, I believe that there are numerous other elements that deserve equal consideration alongside income when selecting a job. In the following paragraphs, I will outline and discuss my viewpoints on this matter.On one hand, I acknowledge that financial compensation is crucial for fulfilling our basic needs. People often prioritize high-paying jobs not only to support themselves but also to provide for their families' essential living requirements, including food, clothing, housing, education, and healthcare. For instance, those working in creative fields such as art or painting may struggle to maintain a comfortable lifestyle, as their passion for their craft often comes with lower income compared to other career options.On the other hand, I firmly believe that a genuine passion for one’s work can lead to greater success in that field. Many individuals who are now thriving in competitive areas like singing, dancing, or painting once faced significant challenges. Additionally, factors such as job satisfaction, happiness, interpersonal relationships, professional development, work environment, and the quality of management and colleagues should not be overlooked. Furthermore, some individuals choose their careers out of a desire to make a positive impact on their communities and contribute to society.In conclusion, while it is true that income plays a critical role in career decisions, I contend that pursuing a job we are passionate about can lead to genuine fulfillment and ultimately pave the way for greater financial success in the long run.

question: The burning of oil for transportation, especially in private cars, is wasteful and environmentally irresponsible. Taxation on petrol and diesel fuel should be increased to very high levels to discourage the use of private cars. To what extent would you support or reject this idea?
human: There is no doubt our life has had a change for the better since cars were introduced. However, cars themselves, especially private ones, have exerted severe pressure on the environment and economy for wasteful oil consumption. While many believe that petrol and diesel fuel should be charged with the highest taxation, I strongly disagree with this notion.One can not deny the fact that if petrol and fuel taxation are raised, people might hesitate choosing a personal automobile. Taxation may have tackled the environmental issue simply by diverting people to public transportations such as trains, buses or ferries. Additionally, for those who have already afforded a car, there is a likelihood it is restraint from usage on long journeys or to crowded cities.However, taxation on flamable resources might backfire by conducing to inflation. To be precise, the more costly petrol is, the higher the price of necessary product: rice, meat or even vegetable. Consequently, people have to turn to cheaper alternatives, which might cause the abundance in goods and later on, economic crisis.Another point that should be taken into account is countries that import oil will be more dependent on the exporters, both politically and financially. Suppose that the those countries cut down on its oil support, other nations will have to pay more as well as release beneficial policies for them. America, for example, has recently drawn its intervention in Russian crisis only due to the influx of oil.To summarize, higher fuel and petrol cost has its own pros and cons. However, it disadvantages may outweigh its advantages with regard to economic and politic issues, making it advisable to seek another options to reduce the use of personal cars.
